text:
If i could give this Wendys a negative star i would. You will be waiting at least 20min either inside or at drive thru...one time i was in drive thru line 42min... and when i finally got to order they were so rude.
  I will drive to one on Broadview rd in Parma because they are friendly and though sometimes its busy i have never waited more then few min. 
  I dont know how 55th location still open . And check your order because more then half time they forget something then act you are bothering them when you bring it to their attention.

name: Wendy's

text:
Once a year I tell myself that there is no way Wendys has not improved...so I try again..
Well,It is possible that this Wendy's is worse than ever..what a shame.
So many complaints and many people talk about how the quality has gone down hill..This is just sad.Pathetic actually.Cold.Gross.BAD....
I CANT BELIEVE IT BUT MCDONALDS MAY HAVE BETTER SERVICE AND FOOD! GOODBYE WENDY'S.
Things sure have changed over the years and I am amazed they stay open. I guess people truly don't care but I'm done. And the owners most definitely don't care! Today was the last day I kick myself into thinking it will improve.
name: Wendy's

text:
This is a sad, sad, very sad Wendy's.   Holy crap are they slowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww.   Did I mention this place is sad?   I am Vegan and the one thing I can eat in Wendy's is fries, and they F those up.   So you wait 20 mins for two orders of fries that are cold...how is this even possible.   I have been there twice and both times the manager comped part of the order because I missed two of my birthdays waiting in line.   Even the comped food was crap, cold and dried out.

The employees don't give a crap, the manager does his best with the crew he has I guess, but none of them are gonna win any land speed competitions.

Really, just go out of business already...

First visit: out of pepper

Second visit: out of large cups, and ketchup cups...napkins empty had too ask for some.

They really don't have their shit together.

Sign outside says now hiring $8.50 per hour, no wonder no one here cares.
name: Wendy's

text: Worst service ever got stuck in the drive through line it took 25 minuets to get my food they are so unorganized
name: Wendy's

text: Ordered pizza for supper. Fast delivery and they got the order right! They are very reasonable and the pizza is great. Good combination

text: this place is terrible. Their food is decent but their service is the absolute worst. I always order a large pizza, extra garlic sauce, and garlic parmesan cheese breadsticks. I recently purchased a high school discount card from a football player.  It gives a papa johns code for pick up and also carryout.  I called to try and use it.  The girl on the phone...I believe her name to be Laurna  or something to that extent was extremely rude.  She completely dismissed it.  I told her I was holding it in my hand and she said I'd have to come in to use it.. ok I'm down the street... oh...but we're closed right now... I can order over the phone and have it delivered... but they wouldn't accept my coupon...because they were closed... uh ok... so after she hung up on me and then hung up on my brother in law.. we ordered pizza hut.  So tonight we decide we're going to try this valid coupon again...it doesn't expire until JUNE 2017... they were rude on the phone yet again and wouldn't let us over... I'm over this place.  never will eat at this location again.

text: Love this Starbucks location. Super friendly and kind workers. Certain times of day much more busy than others, but coffee is great. Highly recommended location!
name: Starbucks

text: Done with this Starbucks.   Slow and almost always out of food. Just not good.  How in the world can they do that when they admit it's a problem.
name: Starbucks

text:
I don't know how I've lived here 3 years and never noticed that this little jewel was next to me. 
This Starbucks makes the best coffee, hands down. Typically, I always need to ask for an extra shot with my drink, but not here. They're also very friendly. I love these guys.

The fact that there is a drive thru makes this place so appealing. See, I am your typical UGG wearing, iPhone using, fast food eating American. I live for drive thrus. Even my pharmacy has a drive thru. Don't really go to the pharmacy, but I keep a mental note in case I have to.
name: Starbucks

text:
I usually go to Starbucks to get some of my favorite drinks but tonight I just wanted to order a trenta ice water & let me tell you the baristas were so nice to me! I worked at a coffee shop for 3 years and I've been able to meet all kinds of people will all kinds of orders. The nice gentleman that took my order was so sweet & made great conversation about coffee! They treated me like any other customer even though I went in just to get water. 

I will definitely come back to this Starbucks since the service was so great!
name: Starbucks

text: The worst drive thru I've ever been to. Most people chose a drive thru for convenience but I waited over 15 minutes both times at this location.  On top of that both times they forgot to put sweetener in my coffee.
name: Starbucks

text: Not only is the slowest store, but the baristas are SO rude and need to care about the drinks they're making. Every time I get my drink here the syrup is not even mixed in and they almost always put too much in when I ask for a lesser than default amount.
name: Starbucks

text: Good experience overall! Staff was friendly, Taylor especially!! Super happy and cheery and seemed like they genuinely like their jobs.
name: Starbucks

text:
Any coffee shop is going to be chaotic in the morning - especially if they're by the freeway. 
I've been that customer stuck in the drive thru line, stressed and getting anxious if I'll ever get my coffee in time to make it to work. Trust me, I understand the struggle. 

Resolution to that issue: Mobile orders. 
I've been ordering through the app for the past couple months now and it's been a breeze! 
I live about 5 minutes away. I'll place the order before I head out the door and it has worked seamlessly! My drink is waiting for me on the counter as soon as I make my drive over there. 

This literally saves me at least 20 minutes in the morning from waiting in those horrendous lines. I'm puzzled why more people aren't taking advantage of this method.
name: Starbucks

text: If I could give them no stars I would. I can't believe they are 50 yards from a kids gym and have no kids seats in their store. I was rudely told they weren't "required" and that no Starbucks had them. I drink Starbucks everyday all over the country and have never been to a store that didn't think about kids. Well Starbucks, I am not "required" to spend my money at your store! Try to train your staff not to be rude to Moms just because you don't care about kids!!!!!
name: Starbucks

text:
This Starbucks isn't bad, not great either. 4 stars for cleanliness, customer service, and the actual drink and food item being made correctly. 

Cons: The line was super long and moved pretty slowly. Being located in a corner of a plaza by the road is convenient but makes for the parking lot to be a hot mess. 

Pros: Staff was friendly and really tried to keep the line moving. The area is pretty small and was kept clean. My coffee cake tasted fresh and my caramel macchiato was also just what I needed.
name: Starbucks

text: I love coming here. Awesome staff. Order from the Starbucks app to get a quicker fix on your favorite Starbucks coffee. It's near the house so it's very convenient.
name: Starbucks

text: There was no one in line and no one waiting my the pickup area, I ordered at 7:42PM and didn't receive my salted cold foam cold brew until 7:51, AFTER they had to ask what I was waiting for... to top it off the coffee was terrible and improperly made (was not salted, tasted like their ice coffee not cold brew, kinda tasted like cardboard and none of the usually Cold Foam Cascara taste. Wish I hadn't tipped the baristas.
name: Starbucks

text: Worst service I've ever had at a Starbucks. There were 2 other people in the store and 3 people working. They forgot to make the drink. Was told, "oh, I thought you were just sitting there," by a barista. Thanks for making me late due to your carelessness.
name: Starbucks

text: This is my favorite Starbucks, I will drive out of my way to get a drink and a croissant from here. The staff is AMAZING, Alexa, Yahaira , Esmi, Jessica, Yasub, Brenda, Jacky, Teddi & Sarah, they all make this place feel like home and deserve some  recognition.  This store is kept clean, After coming to this Starbucks for 6+ years, I find it amazing how I constantly see the same faces, I even remember all the partners names ! Their turn over rate must be so low! - A very happy customer.
name: Starbucks

text: Very bad customer service and the barristas give you that funny look like you are not welcome. Especially the blonde one
name: Starbucks

text: Nice Starbucks next to North Vista hospital in downtown  North Las Vegas.   Newly remodeled, looking nice but not really comfortable.  Too bad they removed the patio tables like other stores have due to a vagrant  problem. No issues with service.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks has gone through so much, it's located in a very dangerous part of town, they've been held at gun point, they've been broken into, and they've been violently threatened before. If they're in a bad mood, don't ask why. Be surprised they're still there taking your orders. I once saw a homeless guy throw his dirty cup of ice at one of the managers cause he was going to throw the tip jar at her, but luckily she was able to get a handle on it before he threw it at her. It's not that they're I intentionally in a bad mood, some people just bring out the worst in you. And for a little above minimum wage, it's not worth going through all that.
name: Starbucks

text: this place is dirty dirty dirty. dirty tables dirty floor dirty drink station. bummer!
categories: Food, Burgers, Fast Food, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea
name: McDonald's

text: Love love love. Prompt and courteous every single time! Used mobile app to order and pay for my coffee and walked in and got it without waiting even one second!
name: Starbucks

text: Most of the time the people at this location are fast and polite! However, my order is wrong EVERY SINGLE TIME. I used to work at Starbucks so when I taste my drink I know what a missing.. I usually order either a hot chocolate (which is always missing vanilla or whipped cream at this location) or an single shot iced venti soy chai that never has the shot of espresso in it... this morning I ordered a cold buster tea and it has no lemonade.. I live right next to this location and its convenient because it's a drive thru.. however it's not really worth it because it's always wrong. I'd rather drive to gilbert and baseline to get the correct drink with the same service.
name: Starbucks

text: The service was terrible inside. So rude to customers. I went to the drive through on Friday and the young lady was so nice. Very disappointed in the barista  working today.
name: Starbucks

text: This is defiantly a bad Starbucks! Their drink orders are always made inconsistent, employees never make a connect with you and seem to not care how they treat their customers. Multiple times my order has been messed up and remade even worse and with attitude. Wish they could be better Starbucks is a great company and has great drinks it just sucks the people working here run it down the drain. Please drive an extra mile to go to another location and save your self the headache.
name: Starbucks

text: I have blood sugar issues so I can't have very sweet drinks without getting sick. I ordered my green tea frap with only one pump of sweetener and when I got it, it was super sweet. I understand people make mistakes so I just asked them to remake it with only one pump of sweetener. They took it back and a few minutes later brought me back my drink. I tasted it before I left while the barista watched to see my reaction. She asked "Is it better?". It tasted like they filled my drink with a little more tea and passed back the same drink. I was so furious I was afraid I would lose my temper so I said it was better and drove off. I won't be back to this location. Shame on y'all. Many people have a very good reason for ordering their drinks in a particular way!
name: Starbucks

text: So I stopped by through the drive thru to get a whopper jr meal . They failed to tell me they ran out of ketchup which neccisarely isn't a huge deal but they were definitely aware and choose not to tell the customer but the real issue is the lack of customer . The girl who handed me the order literally when i asked her if I could have ketchup packets she was like "i dont think we have any and proceeded to look and yell hey do we have any ketchup the manager was like we dont she then was like we dont have any ketchup and slams the window door like hello thats rude ass hell . Atleast seem a  tad bit apologetic

text:
This location is awful!
Ordered an online delivery and my reciept said 30-40 minutes. Waited an HOUR before calling and got told "it's being made" would be there in ANOTHER 15 min. Then after demanding something be done about this poor service I got told a bunch of bullshit lies about a free pizza being applied and sent to my email in a few minutes. NEVER got one, but did get a cold pizza about 10 min later 

DONT waste your money at this location, they are the true definition of ignorance and incompetence.

text: This Papa John's is horrible, I just received an order from them and it was not up to par. They do not care about what they give people. I'm very dissatisfied with my order. I waited 45 minutes to an hour to get my food, by that time I was too hungry to send it back. The pictures I uploaded are from the same order. Shame on you Papa John's!
name: Papa John's Pizza

text:
On my first few visits here, after they opened and a few months after that, I was met with slow service and a crowded seating area. I read review after review about the long line at the drive thru and how poor the customer service was, so I was reluctant to even try this location. 

On my most recent visit there I can say that they have stepped. it. up. They finally have enough staff to work efficiently and quickly! I am here during a crazy happy hour ($3 frapps) and they are working quickly and also maintaining a positive attitude and environment! 

My tip still stands -- this place is freezing! So if you tend to get chilly, as I do, make sure you bundle up if you're going to be working inside for a while. 

Also, because this location is very busy, they do tend to run out of things during their busy hours which can be a bummer. As long as you have a backup favorite drink, you're good!
name: Starbucks

text:
This location is not on the top of my go to places just because I have one closer to home.  But the remodeled store is very nice.  It is a bit more clear where to be and what they have.

They made my drink well and I will come back to this location again if I find myself in need of a beverage.
name: Starbucks

text:
Interesting! I placed a mobile order (with points = $0.00) while sitting in the store, saving a table, and figured to approach the register to ask about it after the line disappeared. 

But I didn't have to! My name was called and I picked it up from the server. What I don't get is... what if I was in the drive thru waiting? How did they know I was physically present in the store?

Hmmm.
name: Starbucks

text: Have to knock this down a star.  With almost every visit, there is something that they are out of.  Today, it was cold brew and straws.  The last time it was venti cups.  C'mon guys, it can't be that hard to stay on top of inventory!
name: Starbucks

text: Not the best service. Never recognized my arrival at register. Young man talked a lot about his friends. Never acknowledged me standing there. Young woman said she'd be with me but never told me I was at wrong register. Luckily she felt compelled to rudely point out I was at wrong register when she finally decided to help me. Apparently mobile orders come first or they get mad I was told. Spoke with manager, he said he's just gotten there. An apology would have been nice. Oh well, plenty of other coffee places.
name: Starbucks

text: Love the physical location, but not a fan of this particular Starbucks. The staff, with a few exceptions, are curt and busy socializing with themselves. They are frequently out of food/snacks, even at 8am. And, in general, I would recommend bringing a book as the wait times are ridiculous, especially the drive-thru (from which there is no escape).
name: Starbucks

text: Extremely slow. We were here before noon and a simple coffee took 10 plus minutes. Will NOT come back to this location. This is ridiculous!!!
name: Starbucks

text: There are flies and bugs in their food case. When we told an employee, his response was "yeah, we have a hard time keeping them out" and that was it. This is a food safety issue.
name: Starbucks

text:
I have to imagine this location recently got new management, who basically do not care about customer service or food quality, because it used to be good. Yes I know we are talking about McDonald's here, but this location was halfway decent compared to others in the area.
My last visit in, I ordered a filet o fish meal where the fish basically was over cooked and inedible, then you have the ice cold fries to top it off. I don't care if this is McDonald's, it should still be worth the money.

text: I go to this location because it's basically a half-mile from my house. Whenever I go to a fast-food place and I order fries without salt for two reasons, first I have high blood pressure and I try to avoid salt as much as possible and second, they always put way too much salt on them. For some reason when I order them without salt here instead of just waiting for or making new ones, they toss the old fries back into the fryer to get the salt off. This is totally gross and that process not only doesn't get all the salt off but the fries are abnormally greasy. Apparently this is a common practice here as this is at least the third time I've seen them try to give me fries this way and I've refused to take them and made them make me new ones. Now I have to wonder how many times I didn't catch it or what other bad practices they are using on customers?? I did say something to the manager that was there but he didn't seem to care what the employees were doing!

text: This is probably the worst McDonald's to go to. There is this lady that is rushing through everyone's order. Now, they aren't busy at any time, but every time I go from 7am-12pm she messes up my order and never gets it right. I've been going here for a year and it's the only one around my job. I RECORDED the order and she still says "you didn't say that". Like lady I JUST SAID IT. Like I don't know what I said !?!? So unless you want you're order messed up 24/7 don't go between those times. I honestly can't stand a worker that doesn't care about you. Ever since I confronted her on it she doesn't speak face to face with me because she knows she gets it wrong EVERYTIME and today they hand a name for me when I pulled up to the window and started laughing. I can't believe that McDonald's allows workers to be this rude to their loyal customers. Good luck staying in buisness. Honestly, 0 stars needs to be a rating!!

text:
Stopped by Wendy's after a recent, nearby volleyball tournament around 8:30 PM and they were short staffed. The line in the drive through wrapped around the building, so we went inside to place our orders. A few minutes later, a lined began to form while we received our food. 

I ordered a chicken salad with apples and it was delicious. My daughter ordered a chicken sandwich with fries. The Coca-Cola machine offered a virtually unlimited variety of sodas, which is really cool. It can be frustrating waiting for persons who have never used these machines because it takes a minute to figure out the interface. Since there was only one machine, we found ourselves waiting for a while, even though there was only one, non-technical person in front of us.

I really felt bad for the people behind us because this one lady waited more than 10 minutes for a burger. She was patient, however. When we walked out after finishing our meals, she was still waiting patiently.
name: Wendy's

text: Terrible. Why do I do this to myself? The quarter pounder made with fresh beef is disgusting. It's mostly scrap meat and salt. I actually threw mine out after 2 bites. I've threatened this before, but I am finally done with this company altogether.

text: This was the worst Starbucks I have been too. First it took so long to get my coffee. Taking into consideration this was 6 in the morning and of course there was a line. I ordered a Carmel maculate.  What I received was mostly hot water and milk. I could not taste any coffee. I didn't want to drink milk and water so of course I threw it out. What a way to start the day. Never again I just wasted $5.00. If I am paying that much for coffee I expect to receive coffee.
name: Starbucks

text:
This place is great when the drive thru line is not wrapped around pretty much the whole store. When it's busy, the quality of both drinks and food seems to go way down.

When they weren't swamped, my frappucino was icy and my bf's iced cappucino had ice in it. When they were swamped, my frappucino was like the ones in the bottles (melted completely) and his cappucino was watery.
name: Starbucks

text:
Their drive thru is currently wrapped around which means that all the baristas are making drinks for them. While I'm the only one that ordered from their lobby area, it's been 10 mins and still no drink for me. I usually don't complain but I do think that they shouldn't ignore other consumers. 

Ordered a white chocolate mocha frapp, made to perfection. Their lobby is clean, lots of tables and chairs available to lounge in or study. The music is a little too loud at this location but at least it's calm music. Bar seems to be fully stocked and wiped down. My go to location when I'm on the north side running errands. 

One of the bathrooms were clean but someone forgot to flush on the other. Not sure if they check on that hourly but I'm assuming they do because of the wet floor sign that's blocking the entrance.
name: Starbucks

text: Great service, but busy, busy, busy if you come here at peak times.  We are usually at this Starbucks on weekend mornings and it's not bad, but forget about it if you're here on a weekday morning on your way to work.  Even with the mobile app, I avoid this location because the parking lot is a nightmare.  Knowing this, do come here at any other time or if you're not in a rush to get your caffeine fix.
name: Starbucks

text: That one shawty barista with the leprechaun hair be bomb af  she can make me coffee any day for me! Good coffe too...
name: Starbucks

text:
We came here to get a tea for my cold. They have a great white defense tea. Lynette was very helpful. We'll definitely be back next time I have a cold. 

04/03/18
Turns out they have a puppochino, which is a cup of whip cream. I was offered one when they saw my dog in the backseat on a different visit. 
I got a white chocolate frappucino myself as they had special reward points from today until 4/9. 125 gold stars if you're a rewards member (or whichever term they use for this).
name: Starbucks

text: My not so fave location anymore. 3 days in a row at the drive thru.. Everytime we order WHITE HOT CHOCOLATE, they kept giving me white mocha with an espresso shot. My hubby never mentions the word Mocha.. they kept saying we said white mocha.. the other day we were charged $3.95 for a venti white hot chocolate. Everytime we say our order we get white mocha. Maybe i need to start recording my hubby when he orders. And make them listen to it. We never mention white choco mocha. Why would i want mocha?! I am pregnant and I am craving for a white hot chocolate not white mocha! Damn! And today they charged us for a white mocha $4.95 instead of white hot chocolate. It's only a steamed milk with white chocolate syrup,, for $4.95?! They're lucky I am not a hard customer. Because if I am I will make a big deal about this. Bring it up to management and train their baristas properly and listen carefully to people's orders.
name: Starbucks

text: I can count on my drink order being wrong at least 4 out of 5 times at this location. Seriously. What is so difficult about paying attention to what is on the label they print out and put on the cup? I order an iced grande vanilla latte with WHOLE milk and I always get percent milk. For over $4 a drink, yes I want it to be right!  I worked at Starbucks for 2 years so I know by the taste and the color my drink is wrong. I loved working at Starbucks back in the early 2000's where we actually learned how to pull espresso shots and steam milk. We had pride in what we did!  Maybe that's the problem, there's no pride in making a drink by pushing a button. I stopped going to this location awhile back but decided to give it a try again because I was running late....and once again they proved they always get it wrong.  Take the time to drive just up the block to the location at W. Craig and Tenaya (where they'll soon have a drive-thru)...my drink is always right and for some reason the espresso tastes so much better at this location!
name: Starbucks

text: If I could give 0 stars I would. Literally the worst Starbucks I have ever been to. The staff were so incredibly rude I could not believe it. Shame on you, Starbucks manager at Craig and Jones, shame on you.

text: Everytime in the past when I have come to the Starbucks they have either a crap attitude or they make my drink taste nasty. Today the barista Sam changed all that. Even though they were out of the food item I wanted, she was super helpful and very nice. My drink tasted amazing! Thank you Sam for making this Starbucks one I can stop at regularly instead of just when I'm in a time crunch.

text: Not a person to write bad things without trying to find a positive, BUT the only reason i come to this starbucks is because it is the closest one to my mothers, & everytime i come here they mess something up & have a bad attitude. I work in customer service and as a manager you should be training your team consistently how to work with people/guest. But i guess this place is fine with the bad reviews and stars! & the girl with long black hair, hispanic looking with winged eye liner, fix your attitude sweetheart or learn how to make drinks!

text: This is literally the worst Starbucks in the valley. They always burn the espresso (yes I worked at Starbucks and if you watch, you can see the espresso settle, that's what makes it taste awful) and the drink always tastes so bad. I thought because we hadn't been here in a long time that it would make a difference... It definitely hasn't changed..so gross! I will drive the further distance just to get a better tasting coffee especially when you're paying $15 for two drinks.

text:
While out on morning errands I decided to go to Starbucks. What a waste of my time and money!! Ordered a hot blonde white mocha drink. 
When it had cooled a little so I could drink it I was shocked that it didn't taste like any type of coffee or expresso. I went back to let them know that there was no flavor and requested a replacement. The young man had a very difficult time understanding that NO, I didn't want to buy another drink, I wanted one to replace the horrible one they had made a few minutes earlier. The second drink still tastes like crap!! Zippo flavor, don't know who is working there today, but they need to train them how to make tasteful coffee! This used to be one of the best Starbucks in the area, sure isn't now...at least today's experience has cured me of spending my money for overpriced coffee. Goodbye Starbucks...once again this just proves that employees can make or break a business.
name: Starbucks

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
So, I normally wouldn't wrote a review for fast food. However, I've got to talk about my experience. 

I had a horrible experience at a Chipotle a few years ago and vowed never to return. Mind you, my husband loves you guys and eats there all of the time. After a busy day.  I just wanted to relax and eat. We decided on pick up from Chipotle. 

I got a bowl, with chicken, steak and tofu with the works. I asked for everything. Including guacamole. 
I dug into my meal and I could immediately taste the lime that was used on the white rice. Which is great because most fast food places don't really hold up to their quality. It's nice to know that, Chipotle does.
The chicken, steak and tofu were cooked perfectly and my entire bowl was fantastic. I ate the whole damn thing.

On a side note. I see a lot of people complaining about the line and the wait times. People, it's simple. Download the FREE app. Order, wait 10 to 15 minutes and then go wait 5 minutes to pick up your food. I mean, the Yelp app is free, instead of leaving terrible reviews because of the long line. Download the free app and just order a head. I didn't wait but 3 minutes. Paid and left. Simple.

text: This is the worst BK I have ever visited.  The employees are clueless and it takes forever to get your order.  I was in the drive thru for 45 minutes.  There was an employee outside on her cell phone yelling obscenities for most of the time I was waiting in the drive thru.  This location needs a new staff!!!
name: Burger King

text: I have to agree with the other one-star reviews thus far.  I too was very excited to get a local Burger King.  I did notice that the restaurant seemed ready to open for business way before they actually had their grand opening.  I live very close and drove by almost every day.  My guess was that they were having a hard time finding and hiring employees.  I am willing to bet that they hired anyone who walked through the door just to open the place and it shows unfortunately.  The flame broiled taste is the only remnant of a Burger King while all other aspects fail from alternative menu items to service.  What a shame that they are on the same track as the previous Burger King that closed years before just across the road.  I have noticed a huge decline in patronage not surprisingly.
name: Burger King

text:
Edited 3/26/18: I originally said the food was good here yet the inside of the restaurant was disgusting. Let me amend that as of today and another visit by saying the food has reached the distinction of being terrible to my taste buds as well. This place will be lucky to exist next year if it doesn't get shut down this year. It seriously needs an entirely new crew to come in and rescue it.

I live less than a mile for this location and was thrilled when I heard last year that we were getting a new Burger King so close. Ironically, it's right across the street where the former Burger King (now Brighton Hot Dog Shoppe) was. For the first couple of weeks that it was open, it was impossible to get near. The drive-thru lanes were always backed up and the rest of the traffic for the restaurant literally went into main road. I know, it's Burger King. Not worth that much fuss.

Yesterday (1/6/18) was my first visit. I went through the drive-thru and apart from them putting onions on my Whopper when I asked them not to, the order was fine and the burger and fries were as good as any other BK I've visited. So far, so good.

However, I returned today (1/7/18) and went inside at 2:41 PM. The place was an absolute disaster. It's a smaller location, so there's not as much room as all the other BKs I've been to. But there was one cashier with a line of people already five or six deep, an unruly manager yelling at the crew constantly, and all the other staff just seemingly confused, not listening, or not bothered enough to do their jobs.

Orders in front of mine were filled wrong multiple times. The cashier kept punching in orders incorrectly and had to be corrected by the customers. The manager was too busy yelling at everyone and getting in a hurry that he wasn't even paying attention to what was going on and just throwing orders out to the counter, one of which wasn't even completely filled. He wound up bagging mine as a take out order even though it clearly stated that it was for dine in. 

It shouldn't have been that unruly. It was a regular after lunch crowd on a Sunday with nowhere near a crazy drive-thru line. Once I finally got my order, I went back and sat down all the way in the back of the dining room because it was literally one of the few tables that was clean. 95% of the other tables had sticky stuff on them, or hadn't been wiped down in general. There was one table that had a cup on it that whole time I was there and remained there when I left. Whomever's it was had left long before I arrived.

The floor near me had a huge half wet-half dried soda spill on the floor under the table. The walls were filthy with black, brown, and white smudges. The men's bathroom had a leftover ketchup cup on the soap dispenser, white streaked residue on the walls, a dirty floor and a urinal with old toilet paper in it. To top it off there are two already broken stools in the dining area.

THIS PLACE HASN'T EVEN BEEN OPEN A MONTH.

Pics are included of all the offenses. The kitchen was no better, with knocked over bun trays near the back, with bun halves and other debris on the floor, along with some brooms. I wasn't able to get a picture of that, but you can see how the front end cup service next to the soda fountain looked.

It's a shame. This place is brand new and already neglected. The staff are obviously not trained well and not trained enough. The manager on duty needed to learn to catch his breath and not create more confusion and getting orders wrong on top of orders that were already wrong. Until this place gets its act together, I won't be going back in. They had a full staff and not one crew member was even looking to clean up the place. It wasn't that busy that this should have happened.
name: Burger King

text: If I could give it zero stars I would. Worst service ever. I only get a half an hour for lunch and it takes 20 minutes to get a cheeseburger and an order of nuggets. The manager is walking around doing nothing and the entire staff is standing around barely doing anything.  Not to mention they all are rude and give you dirty looks while you stand there waiting for so-called fast food. And since I guess I had to wait for my nuggets that took forever my cheeseburger was cold. Will never go back again.

text:
Fast food reviews are always tricky.  You know the food's not gourmet, service can suffer depending on in-store traffic, etc.  And for those that work in fast food its hard, thankless work so you should always cut them some slack.  I try to only call out those places that demonstrated a consistent poor performance.  So here it goes...

If you're looking for late night eats after hitting the bars in Uptown/South End, I advise you to stay clear of this Mickey Ds.  Hit the one on Beatties Ford instead.  Last few times I've gone its either been the quality of food was bad, some main menu items weren't available or in one case an order was messed up (no cheese means no cheese!).  Generally the one thing you can always count on regardless of which MCD's you go to, whatever the time of day they serve it- are some deliciously salty fries but even they messed that up.  The cardboard the fries were in would have tasted better than those fries.  So sorry to say to this McDonald's when it comes to your food I'm not loving it.

text:
This is an interesting location.Â  It is in a corner of a strip mall next to a Subway .Â  Those corner parking spots will tempt you but don't be fooled, they are tricky as hell to get out of without hitting other cars.

I had an interesting chap in front of me who decided to order 50 gift cards!Â  Damn guy, order those online rather than holding the whole cafÃ© up!Â  There was plenty of seating both inside and out.Â  I would prefer the seating outside just so I can watch people try to get in and out of those tricky corner spots.Â  The inside is fairly nice with ample seating and clean restrooms.

Be prepared, this location does not have everything on the menu as a normal Starbucks.Â  I asked for my usual here and they said that they didn't have it.Â  Sorry, but I'll have to dock you a point for that.
name: Starbucks

text: A decent Starbucks that is not too busy in the afternoon.
name: Starbucks

text:
I'm starting to think that I choose awkward drive throughs for the challenge. This Starbucks has one. The locations great though, at the southwest corner of McKellips and Scottsdale. The place is always clean, and the staff always friendly. 

The drinks are on par with other Starbucks. I have never had an order messed up, and I've never had them be out of product.

The app is great, the ability to order ahead is great and the ability to tip afterward on the app is also great. My drink of choice is chai, because I'm allergic to coffee. (I know. Red cup season is excruciating. No peppermint mochas for me.) The spinach and feta wraps are also a favorite.

If you like Starbucks,  this is a good one.
name: Starbucks

text:
As a place to meet with other people for discussion, I give 2 this venue stars because people can have fun and laugh with their friends and talk.  But as a result, no one else can hear who they are sitting with at other tables, because the sounds are magnified like a megaphone, pinging off the hard walls and floor.

Also the chairs here are hardwood and super painful for my bony butt.  I had to go to the car to get my 99 Cents Only Store foam chair cushion.

So if you want to meet and discuss things at this Starbucks, there are other places that are more comfortable, that even have couches, and not sooooo loud.
name: Starbucks

text:
Ordered a grande salted caramel mocha-hot!
Also decided to try a protein box for first time.
Mocha was very good with the chocolate I desired!
Protein box includes two cage free eggs, a multigrain muesli bread patty with honey peanut butter spread, grapes and sliced apples, and 2 small slices of cheese. Fruit equates to one cup according to the label. 
Very well packaged and hearty meal!
name: Starbucks

text:
I hardly ever eat at fast food restaurants. My husband wanted to grab a quick snack on our way to the renaissance festival, so I agreed to make a quick stop at Taco Bell. The drive thru line was insane so we parked and came inside. No customers were inside eating. So we figured we would be on our way pretty quickly. That was not the case at all. All we ordered were 4 beef soft tacos, 2 nachos with cheese and 2 drinks. 

We had to wait 20+ minutes for those simple items. When my husband went up to ask about our order, the young man cooking in the back yelled at him and said he was "WORKING ON THEM DAMN". First off... that's NOT how you speak to anyone. Doesn't matter if it's a co worker, boss or customer. Extremely unprofessional. If I knew his name I would have stated it in this review. 

I understand that it takes time to make things. But I don't believe for a second that it takes 20+ minutes to make items that come off the dollar menu. Such a waste of time. Cheap food. Guess we got what we paid for. This is why fast food restaurants are over rated. So much for a "quick snack"

text:
I usually never have problems with coming to this location after I leave class at 7:30pm-8pm. I am usually able to come before they close at 9. I was waiting at the drive thru for several minutes at 8:30am. It was unusually long so I thought I'd just drive through and go to another location because maybe they closed early for some reason. But another car was at the window when it was about 8:35pm so I reversed and waited again at the menu to order but no answer. I pulled up to the window but no one was there. I parked and seen people inside. One female employee was mopping while the male employee was cleaning things behind the counter and I parked just watching them work for a minute and was just about to get out to just go inside instead. There was a truck that had pulled up next to me to park, who also came from the drive thru but he got out and walked up to the door to find it was locked. If they needed to close early due to short staff or something of that sort, it wouldn't be such a big deal. But there was no sign at the drive thru window and none of the 2 employees went to tell the man knocking on their door that they were closed. It looked like they were intentionally ignoring him because they didn't look up and continued to work on what they were doing. 

Again, this is the first time that it has happened but i'm disappointed more of the unprofessionalism then it actually being closed early. So much that I took the time to type this in my car while I continue to watch these two employees clean.
name: Starbucks

text: They messed up my order 3 times over 2 weeks. Avoid location if possible. They need to get better management.

text: I have pretty low Starbucks standards - i.e., if they keep their sweeteners stocked, make my drink correctly, and are fairly efficient, I'd say they're a decent Starbucks. So the quick and friendly service here in the mornings before work exceeds my low expectations. I can always count on getting in and out quickly (the drive through is a different story. Have you SEEN the morning lines?). My only complaint is that it's kind of in a pain-in-the-ass location when you're coming from the 95 towards Sandhill. Gotta make a u-turn and drive through a pretty crappy parking lot to get there. Still, very close to work and they give me my fix.

text: I am so disappointed as Chipotle is my favorite fast food restaurant but I do have to complain this time. Went There on my lunch break this evening, Waited in line for over 20 mins though one older lady in line was being difficult and fussy so I'll cut them some slack on that one, gets to my turn I ask for a steak bowl,  she doesn't even ask which rice I want just slaps some in the bowl. I then am asked twice which bowl when I clearly asked for a steak bowl, she adds a tiny pathetic  not even half spoon of steak so I ask for extra and say I'll pay the extra cost and everything so she rolls her eyes and slaps a bit more and tells me in a sarcastic tone to enjoy the rest of my day ..everything from the next station went smoothly then I get to the register guy rings me up I ask for my tortilla which they weren't going to even give me they toss it in my bag ..great ok time to go...get to my car drive back to work, park and open my bag to find that the tortilla they had tossed into the bag was all balled up and stuck together and looked like it wasn't even a whole tortilla and when I looked at my receipt they charged me almost 3 dollars extra for chicken when it was supposed to be the standard 95 cent extra steak charge . Won't ever go back to this location which is too bad because I buy Chipotle at least 3 times a week. If i could  give them no stars I would.

text:
Located post-security (around the "D" Gates), this Starbucks offers those on the go a quick bite to eat or a coffee to help wake you up (or keep you awake as the case may be). As others have said, the service is prompt and friendly despite the often long lines; however, the condiments area is typically in disarray -- a consequence of heavy traffic in an airport waiting area, so I don't necessarily fault the employees for lack of upkeep.

Beyond that, there really isn't much more to say. If you're familiar with Starbucks and you like their products, then you should approve of this one. It upholds the standards we've all come to expect from this coffee shop!

text:
I honestly have to say that I am proud of myself for living in the Pittsburgh region for so long and being able to avoid this location for so long.  I loathe McDonald's, so much so that I will go years between partaking in a meal from any establishment that offers such.  I don't understand how this location stays open, not because of the mass chaos that happens here on a daily basis, but because it sits on such a prominent spot downtown that would be better suited for a high rise of some type.

I can tell you that my most recent visit was during a busy time downtown.  Arts Festival, Pride Festival, baseball game, etc.  Should have known better than to come in here, but when you are with your friends, you tag along with them.  This place was a nightmare, a never ending nightmare.  I mean it felt like you never moved and yet you saw people in front of you being served "fast food."  Yes I put that in quotations because it really wasn't that fast.  

It actually looked like a scene from one of those wildlife documentaries you'd find on PBS.  Animals fighting over a carcass.  Mass chaos.  What is funny is that there are always people outside trying to make a quick buck.  I left my friends' side, went outside, purchased a water and came back in before the line even moved.  When people overheard that I bought the water outside and how cheap it was compared to McDonald's pricing, several left the line and headed outside to get a drink.

Will I ever set foot back inside here?  Not on purpose.  I would say to use the bathroom, but they seem to have a strict policy about bathrooms being for paying customers only.  Honestly, come in here during a rush and slide on in if you have to really use the restroom.  No one will notice.

text:
Honestly? My favorite Starbucks. As someone who practically lives at Starbucks (feat. 15 different locations lol) I have high expectations and this Starbucks always blows them out of the water! With friendly staff, a non-existent wait time for drinks, and a quick drive thru, it's always a pleasure heading over to this Starbucks. 

There's gender neutral bathrooms, a great selection of food and Starbucks product, and a large menu to pick from. They have plenty of seating and the parking isn't miserable like a lot of the more popular locations. They're open late hours and they're always super cool about giving answers when you've got questions! I've never had a bad experience here and I quite frankly love coming. 

I'm so glad it's close to my house!

text: Been coming to this location since I was little. Never had any issues here until recently. Was there the other day to grab dinner. I ordered a chalupa meal, 3 soft tacos, 2 grilled stuffed burritos, nachos and cheese and the new nacho fries supreme and a chili cheese burrito! My receipt has everything listed correctly. I got a regular fries and nacho cheese, not the supreme. Ok, let that slide. Honest mistake. Then got to my chili cheese burrito ... what a joke that ended up being. I had more of the tortilla than anything else. Usually they're bursting and the chili cheese gets all over the place. Best part of it. It was as thin as can be. Anorexic chili cheese burrito. Our food ended up being cold and all the tacos ended up being a basic salad! Hardly any meat on anything. Looks like I'll be going to the Columbia road location. It's farther away as I'm on Lorain in Fairview but I'd drive for quality. Pics of the chili cheese to follow. I put a Gatorade cap next to it to show how thin it was.
name: Taco Bell

text:
I think I have become a Coffee Snob. Starbucks in general, doesn't thrill me like it used to. We came here after finding out Milk Bar was closed.

The store itself looks very cool and artsy and the staff was nice. Our coffee itself was just blah. a Grande Cappuccino with Whipped Cream came with no Whip. My Grande Mocha Frappuccino with an Extra Shot didn't taste like it had any coffee in it at all. We were in a hurry and checking out, so we just drank our coffee and left. text:
Nicest and biggest location I've seen thus far.

I got the vegetarian burrito which I didn't really enjoy. They should have the option to grill your burrito like other places, so my burrito was on the cooler side. Guac was good and I love the portion size. The burrito itself was rolled poorly and fell apart right away. In comparison to other burrito places, Chipotle has only one vegetarian which really isn't that good. 

The service wasn't the greatest. No one greeted me while making my burrito or cashing out. Think this will be my last time giving Chipotle "another chance."

text: Worst McDonald's to go to. It's like you're waiting for a 5 Star plate to be served because of how long they take. It never fails that this location by minimum takes 15 mins to serve a customer. I never have left them a review but this time they really out did themselves. We went to go grab a snack tonight-not busy at first. The machine tells us to move forward. Waiting for the worker to take our order, at least 5 mins go by and we hear the machine behind us taking the other car's order!!!!!! We drive up to the window. Again waiting, this time for the car in front of us to get his order. Another 7 mins go by. We finally get to tell the girl we haven't order because they never took our order. She says oh well you're gonna have to drive around again because there's a line now and I can't take your order here. I was about to go off on the lady and ask her if I could talk to her manager. I understand if possibly their machine doesn't let them take our order like that but they at least could of done something for the shitty experience. "I'm sorry you have to go around but let me talk to my manger to see if we can compensate you something for the inconvenience".

text:
This is my go to Starbucks because it's closest to my apartment.  What I love about Starbucks is that I can order my coffee and pay on my Starbucks app without having to wait in line or talk to someone!  How great is that?  
My usual routine is to place my order on my phone, drive or walk the two blocks there, walk in and my coffee is sitting there waiting for me!  All I have to do is grab my drink and go!  Every time I walk in the staff is very friendly and greets me with a hello and a smile, and when I leave they wish me a great rest of my day.  Quick in and out, just how I like it!  I also really like this Starbucks because they have never mess up my order.  It's been correct every time and my coffee always taste great!  Another plus is that they have a parking spot right out front for people like me who are running in and out picking up their order.  It's very convenient because this Starbucks is located downtown and I don't/won't pay to park my car for coffee.
As long as I live here, in the Flats, this will continue to be my go to Starbucks :)

text:
Yes, it's Starbucks, but it's more. It's the ambiance! It's inside the William Penn, for heaven's sake, how can it get any better than that? Unlike some Starbucks that have few seats due to all of their merchandise, no matter what size your group -- within reason -- you'll have plenty of room.

Oh, and I have to say ... the baristas are great too. I know Starbucks will remake my drink if they get it wrong, but it sure is nice to get it perfect the first time. I've never had one I didn't like here.

text: This is my regular STARBUCKS, close to home and always consistent.  Never have any trouble here. The staff is nice and the store is big enough to find a seat. I like to sit at the bar and sip on my fraps or shaken teas.  Lately, I have been getting the hot holiday drinks with half the pumps of syrups. They still taste sweet enough, but I am reducing the calorie load. The peppermint mocha drink is really delicious. I ask for half the # of peppermint pumps and sugar free mocha.
name: Starbucks

text: I don't usually do reviews on Starbucks because they are usually all the same but I had the best experience at this location! Baristas are super nice and I got my drink super quick and I also got a recommendation for a drink and loved it!!  Not really a coffee person and I got a peppermint mocha and it is so good! Also I was so happy because I could use my points at this location! Not only this but i usually burn my mouth off when i drink hot drinks but they got it the perfect temperature so i could drink it right away
name: Starbucks

text:
Coffee, coffee, coffee! One of the major components in my life that it needs to function! 

Needing coffee this was the only Starbucks here, so here I am in line! The line is three deep and the damn Starbucks customer service is so fantastic that its fanatical. The over friendly Target/Starbucks employee is so nice that it's disgusting this early! Damn! I need less talk and more coffee! All of the um, and shrugs are pointing in one direction from the crowd of coffee people behind me too! Less talk and more hustle hustle in the morning to make sure that the coffee is in my hand! 

The store was highly organized and the Starbucks employee was in the best mood ever! Damn her energy level was off the top! She was highly motivated to make all of her customers comfortable and feel welcomed. She just needs to know that speed should be her friend. Especially this early in the morning. Having had no coffee this over excess chatter was cumbersome! I appreciate her extra care and service but damn less talk and a lot more action. The action that I'm talking about is the coffee that should be in my hand!

I decided to have the salted caramel mocha in the grande size with added extra caramel and whip! All of the coffee tasted fantastic too! And it was so painful to watch her make it since she moved fast but with a pace that was not focused on what she was doing! She kept giving her opinion of the drink as she made it! Target should consider her for the sales of their company! Anyways back to coffee! After the last comment about how she and I share the same tastes of extra caramel on top I was given my refreshing coffee beverage.

Nirvana finally has arrived! The mix of mocha and sweet delectable caramel quells yet another possible "out of character" moment! Thanks coffee for keeping me sane all these years. I have to say that my patience level is very high and I tolerate a lot, probably because of the twins! Lol! This morning I was border, a race car in the red.... ! Now that the coffee is half gone and in my system I think that I'm good! Not great, with more coffee comes that greatness! 

I did not sample from the pastries today, the waiting game was the hardest part. Really how long would of it been for a sandwich? Let's not do that? My most excellent cheri had an Americano. He had this iced and added his own fixings. I was the one that waited for the coffee to be made; by the way. He walked away and wanted to leave because of the wait. With all the patience in my court and wanting Starbucks I needed there sweet essence this morn! A bit trying in the patience department. For sure!

Will I return, not in the morning time when I "need" and "long" for my coffee! If I was just casually shopping and doing running around this is a great little store. The store is so clean and the staff way tres outgoing and friendly. Considering the area which outside the store is not the best area! They have done a fantastic job at keeping this store so amazing and awesome! Bravo there. The reason for the four stars is for the speed of service which should be the utmost priority. I timed how long that it took to make my coffee from the order until I had it . It was eight minutes. This is Starbucks loosing money, not that she was not amazing, but her speed needs to improve! She is an awesome overly friendly talented individual. Just get the coffee to people in the morning fast so that race car stays out of the red!
name: Starbucks

text: Ok, SERIOUSLY?!?!? What the hell am i really paying for? text:
Good enough Starbucks location.  I drive a little out of the way when I am in Pittsburgh to stop here.  It's at the end of a strip mall and like most Starbucks, the service is a little slow.  I never understand why they only have one person making drinks.  No idea.  

They did screw up my order but it actually worked to my benefit.  On top of my coffee, I asked for the egg white sandwich.  Somehow they heard "egg bites" and I'm not the pickiest when it comes to food so I just took them.  It's something I typically wouldn't order but I'm glad I received them.  They were excellent.  They came with gruyere cheese and bacon.  It all worked out well in the end.

text: Tis must be the worst McDonalds on the planet. You will have less than a 50-50 chance of getting your order correct. My wife and I justed waited over 10 minutes in the drive through lane with just 3 people ahead of us at 7 PM. You would think that waiting all that time that our order would have been queued for us by the time we got to the window but no. We waited an additional 5 minutes because the frys were not ready. Then we noticed that the Frappe we ordered did not have one of ingredients. We should have looked in the bag also because we only ordered two large fries and instead received 1 fry and a Big Mac. It's almost laughable but so sad because it seems like we have a problem on every visit. In some small way we're going to help them fix it by not going to this McDonalds ever again. Can't believe how hard they make it to support a local business.
