text: I ordered a captain crunch and instead I got a strawberry cream frappe and it doesn't taste like a captain crunch they also forgot the java chips. It is also melted.
name: Starbucks

text:
This location is hit and miss. A couple of times they do fine, then you get a morning like this one. I mobile order. When I arrive there are three employees talking to each other. One is checking his clipboard while the other two are socializing. They made eye contact with me but said nothing (mind you, I was the only customer in the place not sitting at a table). Another couple came in and got their order taken. Then Gene goes to make their drinks and sees he left mine half done on the counter. Instead of starting over he used what was sitting there. Disappointing. 

Try the location on Warm Spring instead, they have a better set of baristas.
name: Starbucks

text: The customer service at this place is awful. I've only visited twice but both time the guy at the drive thru window is rude! Seems like he hates his job. will not be visiting this location again. Can get what I like from McDonald's for cheaper anyway.
name: Starbucks

text: 25 minute wait only to get your drink wrong thanks a lot! If you are out of an item mention it to the customer instead of trying to pass a half complete drink. Only good thing about this location is they have a 24 hour drive thru just hope it doesn't take that long to get your order.
name: Starbucks

text: This store has done nothing but go down hill since it's remodel. I spoke today with the manager, and complained about the horrific taste of my coffee. The coffee seriously tastes like bitter rotten water, mashed into stale potato chips. She was apologetic but the only offer of a refund was for me to come back to the store and they would make me another coffee. I work 14 hour days, 6 days a week. I cannot come back to the store now, I'm 15 miles away. Never again. I will no longer purchase items from this location. Such crap service.
name: Starbucks

text:
This place is hopping right before close!  People watching... & got my gold starbux status as an added bonus.  Thania (think Dr Zhivago : yes I'm here to make u think...) was  so sweet while we chatted about life.  And I threw in the popular culture reference to 
" I am Spartacus " and Starbucks.  Too much fun.  See below https://improveverywhere.com/2013/11/26/spartacus-in-real-life-movies-in-real-life-episode-9/  

& yes, your welcome.
name: Starbucks

text: Busy morning , however , that didn't stopped the Staff for doing great customer service with a smile. Thanks Jon for doing a great job.
name: Starbucks

text: Always use the app to get your orders quicker. The drive thru is really slow you'll be waiting for hours if you don't.
name: Starbucks

text:
This Starbucks looks really nice from the outside... When I stepped in, I was surprised by how small the area was. 

The seats aren't that comfy and the music is kind of loud which might bother some people. I had headphones in, so it didn't matter to me. Like I said though, the area is pretty small. If you wanted to study or work on stuff here, I would recommend going to a bigger Starbucks or another place.

My drink was nice though. I ordered an iced caramel macchiato.
name: Starbucks

text:
While the drive-thru line was pretty long (6-7 cars). It moved fairly quickly. I ordered my usual Venti Vanilla Latte. I swear I have to fight to not buy one of those lemon pound cakes. 

Pros - Great location, consistent drink
Cons - Long lines (sometimes you are out in the parking lot and might be in the way of passing cars).
name: Starbucks

text: Went through the drive thru and had horrible service.  I ordered two drinks and a water.  When i came to the window i was handed my two drinks by a girl who had a major attitude.  When i asked if i could have a water (since i already ordered it) she made a discussed annoyed sound and turned away without saying anything to me.  She grabbed a cup and filled it with the tap water and shoved it towards me.  I would think customer service would be a big deal, but i guess when you have a huge company like this they dont care.  I will just go to dunkin' doughnuts from now on since it's close to this location anyways from now on.
name: Starbucks

text: This location sucks. Every time I come here for a mid work day caffeine fix I end up almost falling asleep in the drive through line due to it being at least 15 minute wait every time. The staff is rude too. This last time I questioned the girl at the worst window about my drink, which I believe was old watered down iced coffee?! and she didn't even respond. Save your money.
name: Starbucks

text: THE SLOWEST STARBUCKS YOU WILL EVER ENCOUNTER. I have to get there maybe 20 minutes earlier because the workers are super slow. It's the only one near my house which is why I stop by to this one.
name: Starbucks

text: Love Starbucks. Hate this location. Seriously no pace and presence, no attention to the cafe area and they are never fully in stock. It's so weird that they have 7 people on the floor and 6 of them solely focused on the drive thru while the cafe is slammed. Maybe the team should drink a little coffee, wake up and get with it. Leaders in this building should really look at their business and get back to the "legendary customer experience" that Starbucks was once known for. And please for the love of the coffee gods... Chill your coconut milk or take down the ads for the special coconut milk beverages.
name: Starbucks

text:
Summary: If you have the ability to go to a Starbucks location other than this one, do it.

This Starbucks location was always hit and miss. Lately it has been miss and miss. The interior is beat up, small and there is usually at least one homeless person hanging out inside. With the new mobile order, you order your drink enroute, walk in and pick it up. Not here. Last time I walked in, the barista got my name and went back to making drinks. 10 minutes later I asked about my drink. The barista forgot to let them know I was here, so I was pissed and my drink was cold. I could have had them remake it, but they already wasted enough of my time.

Today I decided to give them another chance, things happen. I go in at 6am, a nice quiet time. I mobile order 10 minutes before my arrival. I get there and the drink is not ready. Three baristas are hanging out in the back corner and forgot to mention to the one making drinks that my order came in, so I wait again.

The drinks come out well, but the service here is deplorable.
name: Starbucks

text:
I won't come back here.  The woman was lazy and rude!  I wanted help figuring out what teas they had.  She wouldn't list them.  She expected me to read small print.  I told her I couldn't read it and ask what kind of teas they had and still she refused to help me.
I'm so not happy with this store.
name: Starbucks

text:
I'm updating from 2 stars to 3. The last 2 visits were after 8 AM and during busy periods. My mobile orders were correct and reasonably timely. Because I have trouble walking (never mind walking and carrying things) I'm still stuck with drive-thru (I have hand controls) so coffee is still not as hot because it is made while I wait in drive lane. At least items were correct. 
Suggestion may be to do curbside like McDonalds. Another suggestion is to give a bag for multiple food items so I don't have to order a bag. And a drink carrier when I have (as I always do) more than 1 drink
Still only 3 stars because had orders wrong or delayed more than half of the time

Now. Four months later I have upgraded this location to 5 stars. The menus online are updated and available. Plus the drive thru is quick and service pleasant
name: Starbucks

text:
They still suck even after a 3 year break
Waiting for mobile order, in the drive thru
I could have gone to Procyon by now!!! Where at least theyre nice...
name: Starbucks

text:
I love Starbucks iced black coffee; that's what I get 90% of the time here.  This is my second time getting a drink at this location; they water down the ice coffee by adding bunch of ice in the container they keep the ice coffee then pore it into an ice filled cup! 

When I had the first sip I thought they gave me iced tea!! I will not come back to this location; waste of my hard earned money dude.
name: Starbucks

text:
Mobile ordered the same thing 5 days in a row. First day it was correct. Next day coffees were cold but correct. Third day they gave my coffees to someone else so I had to wait. Fourth day they say they were out of the ham and cheese but asked about substitutions because they had already charged the card. Today they had me wait at the window for 8 minutes because they hadn't heated the ham and cheese. Ultimately they gave it to someone else and gave me someone's sausage and egg on English muffin. When I pulled back into drive thru the girl argued with me that she had put it in the bag herself. I had to hand her the bag with 2 sandwiches that were correct and had my name on the stickers and the third incorrect one to prove she didn't give it to me. By then the coffee was cold (it was only 45 degrees outside) so I ordered a new one (and paid for it) while I waited for the ham & cheese croissant. After 5 minutes I said I'd circle around because the line was getting very long. If I were able bodied or had the wheelchair loaded I would have gone inside but I couldn't. Mobile ordering doesn't seem to be as much of and advantage as it should be in the early mornings. 
I found it really offensive that they would act like I'm trying to scam them out of a $4 croissant after having spent hundreds of dollars there just in the last 2 weeks. It's definitely not fun for me to sit in line 3 times just for one order!  After Holiday Spice flat white goes away I may go to Dunkins. And I tipped every day like an idiot... until today
name: Starbucks

text:
I make the drive from Southern Highlands to this specific Starbucks at least 2-5 times a month do to how SLOW, rude, and dirty the Starbucks in Southern Highlands is. 

This review is for APRIL in the drive thru today! Super bubbly, smiling, and just absolutely WONDERFUL personality! I made sure to tell her than she was great before I drove away. All Starbucks need an April!
name: Starbucks

text:
came to Starbucks here today because it is conveniently located by my place, but I have to say, this is the dirtiest store, there is always a wet floor sign out but no one mopping, out of napkins, a mess all over the counter where you walk in, 30 minutes sitting there and no one is cleaning 

Update- the store has been much cleaner lately and bumping rating back to a deserved 5 star
name: Starbucks

text: Not my normal Starbucks, but service here is great just like virtually all the Starbucks I have hit.  The dining room is on the small side and if it's busy it is tough to find a seat.  Drinks always come out fast and correct and the staff is always nice to me here. A+ spot to grab some joe, work, meet someone or hang out.
name: Starbucks

text: Can't believe they're remodeling the only Starbucks in the area. Annoying. Ill find coffee elsewhere
name: Starbucks

text:
I used my app to do a mobile order so I wouldn't have to wait. I ordered my two drinks. 
I arrived about 10 minutes later, expecting them to be ready by now, however, they weren't. 
So, I assumed they'd be up shortly. 
Another 10 minutes go by, and I see the barista finally initiate the drinks. 
This location is a pretty busy location, so I'm sure they were just a little behind.
name: Starbucks

text: As a former baristas hired by the manager from this store, we were APPALLED at the service we were provided with today. At the register we apologized for having a large drink order and we're given attitude because of this, and when we got our drink order 3 of the 4 drinks were not made at as requested/standard. I am not one to complain about bad service but knowing what the drinks are supposed to come out as has made me frustrated.
name: Starbucks

text: Normally I don't have problem with Starbucks, but this location sucks. I wish I can put none star. I order my one coffee drink at 3:00pm. People come after me all get their drinks before me. I waited around 30 minutes to ask where is my drink? The cashier completely forgot to put a sticker on the cup or for whatever reason, my drink wasn't even made. And it was slow around that time. I don't know what's wrong with them, the girl who made my drink heard me saying I have been waiting for a long time. She just throw the straws to me. Ok, this is what's called customer service? Once I got my drink I checked the time on the sticker, it was printed at the moment when I was asking for my drink instead of actual ordering time.
name: Starbucks

text: Not sure why this Starbucks says 24 hours. I was in here tonight to study. I got there around 9, and at 10 they said they were closing and kicked everyone out. This should really be changed. How annoying. I had to pack up all my stuff and go somewhere else and study.
name: Starbucks

text: came to Starbucks here today because it is conveniently located by my place, but I have to say, this is the dirtiest store, there is always a wet floor sign out but no one mopping, out of napkins, a mess all over the counter where you walk in, 30 minutes sitting there and no one is cleaning
name: Starbucks

text: Stopped in for a white mocha and and a breakfast sandwich at 2 : 15 today and wow, it was even made to order and not freeze dried. This is why Starbucks that it is fantastic that you serve breakfast at all hours of the day. This Starbucks is upbeat and not as friendly and outgoing as some of the other Starbucks but in the middle of the afternoon; throw care to the wind. In fact, have a cappuccino to wake thee brain up .
name: Starbucks

text:
This is usually first stop on my way to work. Sometimes I go through the drive through and Becky is always on point. She's very sweet, friendly and patient.

Sometimes I order via the beta app and pickup inside. 
Mario and/or Zoey usually take care of me inside. 
Both are always amazing. They remember my name and always have my order ready when I walk in. I feel like they take that extra step to ensure they provide a quality experience. They make my morning caffeine run much easier. I used to sometimes stop at the Starbucks closer to work but because of these employees I've pretty much made this location my exclusive stop. Yay for good customer service! It has taken me a while to update this review because I wanted to make sure I had their names correct.
name: Starbucks

text: I come here every time I Vacation in Vegas. This trip I went through the drive thru & LOVE the service from Jordan & Ramsey! They were very fun, happy & helpful... they brightened our day multiple times
name: Starbucks

text: This is seriously the slowest location I've ever been to. I actually spent 30 minutes in the drive thru once.
name: Starbucks

text: Baristas aren't friendly and they did bad job of making my iced coffee twice, not the way I wanted. Does not even come close to how the other Starbucks makes them. I could not finish drinking it and it is my favorite Starbucks drink. My suggestion is just get iced water!
name: Starbucks

text: I go to this Starbucks a lot but the last few times I've gone I'm left a little confused...I always ask for light ice and I've never had an issue with it in the past but all of a sudden light ice is equating to less ice and less of drink??? I'm going to give them another chance but If it happens again I'm not leaving until they fix it.
name: Starbucks

text:
They still suck
I cant believe it
I went in today stood there a minute or two no one said anything they just took tags from mobile
They left the tag off my coffee byw
I waited went to my car to make sure i ordered at right store
At 47 i got my coffee i ordered at 534
Terrible in every way
And to top it off no extra whip and my coffee tasted like water... i cant place whats missing but im thinking everything

Maybe they should have filled the beans before they made coffee
It could have at least been better if anyone there. ANYONE would have said ONE WORD to me...
name: Starbucks

text: Not sure what all the complaints are about seems clean and fast.ordered a ice coffee and it was perfect.The cashier was nice l.I amij this are often and will be back.
name: Starbucks

text: I love this Starbucks location it's on the way to the strip from the airport and next to a Walgreens to load up on pre-gaming liquids.  My favorite Starbucks drink is the Caramel Frappuccino tall, or the Chi Tea latte tall.
name: Starbucks

text:
Ethan, Ethan, Ethan!!! I was welcomed (after waiting in a decently quick moving long line) with a kick ass positive personality...which is HUGE when you've been caffeine deprived. lol. He made my complicated, annoying order seem not even a little bit inconvenient for them and I love that. When I reached the window, the sweet girl (I forgot to grab her name) accepted my payment. While waiting you could hear Ethan telling all his co-workers how fabulous of a job they were doing and continued slaying his job one Drink at a time. I'm telling you, what an amazing personality to have with grumpy coffee addicts as your guests. I'm absolutely coming back here and only here, if possible. Give Ethan a raise!!!! I am going to have a good day now because NOT ONLY did Ethan share his positivity with me, but my drink was PERFECT!!!! 

If you EVER want a drink Ethan, come to The Palm in Caesars and I'll take care of you!! Thank you for making my day!
**visited on 10/19 @ 9:17am!
name: Starbucks

text: Best baristas!! I drive extra far just to go here!! I know coffee and this is place to get it!!
name: Starbucks

text: I feel like the girls here are so rude, I left a bag of clothes here and I didn't expect them to guard them with there life granted it was in a black trash bag but I had all blazers for work given to me and I had my usual Bebe black blazer that was $120 given to me and when I called they said they would hold it for me but girl ran out and told me it was tossed out with the garbage and it's cool it was in a trash bag baristas don't open bags to confirm but she wasn't even apologetic about it and said it with such a straight face I just didn't appreciate how the approach was when she came back to tell me all my given to me blazers were tossed out. I went and continued with my order and she was going to charge me for a wrong order I had to ask the manager to honor a discount if some sort. It's always something for us bank tellers in this shopping center. The hospitality is sad towards one another
name: Starbucks

text:
Been visiting Starbucks a lot in the past month. Why? I've had the Starbucks app for a few years now, but only just recently have I opened the app and see these mini-game like challenges that promise to reward enough "stars" to make the effort worthwhile.

So on a recent challenge to make back-to-back-to-back daily purchases for bonus "stars" I visited this convenient 24-hour location near the Las Vegas Blvd/Windmill intersection last night. Placed the order via the mobile app, so I wouldn't have to explain any customization I want on my order (Iced Coffee, no ice, 1 sugar in the raw, and Trenta, the largest size it comes in) and save some time in the process. I think it is a pretty easy order to prepare.

I only waited like a minute after arriving. The place was dead, only one guy on his scooter ordering from the drive through window, 3 people reading or on their laptop at their individual tables, and at least two baristas on staff. So A+ for the friendly & speedy service. But it was prepared with "regular" ice, which I didn't bother to have them fixed. Since I was still debating about picking up dinner at a nearby restaurant that would be closing in another 30 minutes.

Anyway, mistakes happen. Iced coffee is still iced coffee. I still scored 75 bonus stars. 50 more if I buy something today. And in spite of this location needing an update to their current 24-hour business on the Yelp listing, it is still a super convenient location to stop by on the way home from work or wherever. The location is a decent size too, with plenty of parking.

3 stars.
name: Starbucks

text: Standard Starbucks.  It was busy when I came here probably because it's located on LV blvd and is one of  the closest drive thrus to the strip.  Or the most convenient if you're leaving LV (sad face) and you're headed to the 15fwy.  There isn't a massive amount of parking but I had no problem finding some.  They were out of the strawberry acai refresher but it's probably because of the high traffic and the summer approaching.  the staff was real nice and they made me another drink super quick.  Good to know where this is if you are driving in/out of Vegas. There are some located closer to the strip.  These are inside the malls, shopping centers, grocery stores but these are not easy to get to or find.  I'd def come here instead!
name: Starbucks

text:
I've learned my lesson. The only consistency I find at Starbucks is they are very inconsistent. For the great variety they offer, I kept trying the company and going to different locations but they suck. For this specific trip, they couldn't properly pour water in the oatmeal. They filled it with such a small amount, it wouldn't get all the ingredients wet. I walked up to the front for more water but nobody would help me. They didn't want to deal with any issues so I left a note and my oatmeal on the counter.

I will now frequent Einstein Bagel more and hopefully they will continue their consistency as they expand there offerings and market share.
name: Starbucks

text:
I wish this spot had some comfier seats instead of pub/stool seats. I have a difficult time getting on the chairs. The music is extremely loud - so loud that you can't hear several baristas recite the bathroom code.    After asking to lower the volume level several times, I realized it was futile. Nobody behind that counter gave a crap. I ordered my usual drink plus the crystal ball frapp. What a weak tasting frapp - I was very disappointed. Since Starbucks has the guarantee, I asked them to remake it. The gal advised me that this drink was "made the way it's supposed to be" instead of remaking it. Peaches and cream - not.  It tasted like cream with a hint of peach! I was very tired already and just wanted to head home. Honestly I'm not sure if I'll be back to this location. Las Vegas has so many locations I'll have to try more of them.

Not the best experience for a Starbucks.
name: Starbucks

text: Oh boy anybody who knows me well knows that I have a great deal of zeal for Starbucks! I love trying different locations every now and then just to switch things up. I was in the area filling up for gas to make this 4hr drive to Los Angeles when I realized I didn't have my coffee for the day! This Starbucks just happen to be on my way to the I-15. I was a bit confused at first by the set up of the drive-thru but eventually figured it out. You know when they are located in these shopping plaza strip malls the drive-thru set ups can be a bit bizarre! I was apprehensive at first because the amount of cars that were sitting however they moved very quick. The barista that was taking orders was super cool and joking with me thru the intercom I thought it was funny. Upselling with a bit of sense of humor was cool. I ordered a Venti and he was like "Ugh just get the Trenta size you know you want it". The Starbucks app just happened to be down and I couldn't do a reload. The barista took the extra steps to help me reload manually and made an effort to say that I needed to earn my stars. Little things like that can always create a memorable experience for a customer. I appreciated the level of service and my drink came out made exactly how I wanted it! No complaints at all!
name: Starbucks

text: This location has a 24/7 drive thru, which makes it so convenient for early birds and late owls to enjoy a refreshing tea or coffee. This location is compatible with mobile rewards cards opposed to some other places. The drive thru goes on for a while but it ensures that each customer is leaving satisfied. They're really nice here, so far I have not met any mean people. Lol
name: Starbucks

text:
Dale was great in taking my order. He knew I was in a hurry yet the credit card machine wasn't working well. He was very apologetic.
Thanks Dale!
name: Starbucks

text: Out of all the Starbucks I visit in Las Vegas, this is the slowest one. Drive though always takes forever.
name: Starbucks

text:
I usually pass by this Starbucks to go to another, but they are open some convenient hours. I noticed they did a remodel inside and really cleaned the place up. I ordered via the Starbucks app a couple times in the last week and my drinks were ready when I got there and they were made correctly. It seems they have some new team members. They seem to be better trained and a little more upbeat.

This location is a lot better than it used to be. Don't be afraid to stop and get your coffee here.
name: Starbucks

text:
I'm updating from 2 stars to 3. The last 2 visits were after 8 AM and during busy periods. My mobile orders were correct and reasonably timely. Because I have trouble walking (never mind walking and carrying things) I'm still stuck with drive-thru (I have hand controls) so coffee is still not as hot because it is made while I wait in drive lane. At least items were correct. 
Suggestion may be to do curbside like McDonalds. Another suggestion is to give a bag for multiple food items so I don't have to order a bag. And a drink carrier when I have (as I always do) more than 1 drink
Still only 3 stars because had orders wrong or delayed more than half of the time
name: Starbucks

text: Starbucks is always my go to place for coffee when I am traveling. You know what you are going to get when you order. Their bathrooms are usually the cleanest, but not this one. The floors were dirty & paper towels on the floor. I understand that some people are slobs, but this restroom needs tending to. This place is close to where I am staying, so I will be back tomorrow. Let's see if you can improve the cleanliness so I can edit my review!
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks located off Las Vegas Blvd. in the same plaza I visited for Farmers Market Hawaii LV came here to pick up a drink and wait for my Uber since this is in plain sight off Las Vegas Blvd I figured the driver would have an easier time finding me. This is a nice SB same set up as most the staff here was friendly and fast.
name: Starbucks

text: I usually wouldn't think of reviewing Starbucks but this store has a special employee April always smiling and always goes the extra mile!!!! I own two businesses and I wish I could have all Aprils working for me  great job Starbucks you need more Aprils at every Starbucks!
name: Starbucks

text: I come to this store probably 3-5 times a week. The store is always busy but they get you in and out! Customer service could be better though. Rachel at the register is the only one who is bubbly and energetic. She smiles and sometimes even gets excited seeing regulars come in. When ever I'm waiting for my drinks the people barely say the name and don't even smile or shew you away. I think they are more concern about drinks rather than the actual customer. That's what you get for a fast pace place like this one though. Besides that, friendly cashier, clean inside and out, good music and speedy time.
name: Starbucks

text: I've stopped by here during the week and everything is good. But the weekends not sure what goes on but it's not good at all. The order didn't changed but the quality did. Pretty lame
name: Starbucks

text: I've been coming to this location everyday for the past week because it's on my way to work and literally every visit I've had here they have messed up my order. Like for instance I would ask for something light and tall, but they would give me a regular sugary version and size venti. Or I would ask for a particular sandwich, and they would give me something totally different. It's very frustrating
name: Starbucks

text:
staff was super friendly. but the music they play feels as if I'm at a bar rather than a coffee shop not to mention it is playing extremely loud. I moved away from the wall as I thought it bounced back and forth. the playlist is either top 100's from the late 2000's. they do have passcode locks for their bathrooms, I'm guessing to prevent the homeless from using it, as it is near popular shopping centers.

nearly can't focus due to this music. unsure if I should ask them turn it down or if they can even do that.
name: Starbucks

text: If you are a fan of cold brew, this store easily has the best cold brew out of any in the area. And their barista JC at night is such a ham. He tries and tries and makes me feel welcome and actually cares about his customers. He is always suggesting different variations of drinks and just seems to genuinely enjoy his job. He is very accommodating and welcoming always. :)
name: Starbucks

text: I spend quite a lot on Starbucks, more than I probably should , but with that being said I want my 6$ coffee to be right. I have been going to this star bucks off and on over the last few months and I'm pretty much done with it all together, if it wasn't the only one with a drive through with in my area I would never have gone back back after the first couple errors. I'm tired of ordering having it repeated and it still being wrong. The sticker on my cup saying my order and yet it's the complete opposite of what's in black and white.....it's making coffee, not rocket science. I get that it's busy, mistakes happen, but when I'm the only car in the drive thru and you still can't get it right? Come on....someone needs to either pay attention or maybe they need to drink the crappy coffee they made to realize it's not fun getting it wrong. I really at this point, doubt I will go back. Looks like the Dutch brothers that is opening by me can't open soon enough.
name: Starbucks

text: Great service at this Starbucks as they move through the drive though line quickly....they made a mistake in my order but provided me with a free drunk for next time.
name: Starbucks

text: Never been inside but have always used the drive thru. Staff is friendly just like all Starbucks. Sometimes the line is a bit longer at certain times of the day.
name: Starbucks

text: I honestly don't know why this location has such poor reviews, out of every single Starbs location I visit often, this one has NEVER disappointed me. They are always efficient, timely, and friendly. My vanilla cold brew sweet cream is always the perfect mix and my Pike roast with cream and sweetener is always just right. Other locations I often visit (215 & Eastern, Windmill & 215, one near UNLV) always doesn't put enough sweet cream in my cold brew, forgets napkins for my bagel, spills my coffee on my hand due to overflow, and sometimes gives me a spoon instead of a knife for my spread (when they are out, they do tell me). So I will be coming to this location more often. Keep it up team!
name: Starbucks

text: I am typically a Starbucks fan. Service is overall good wherever I go. I must say today I was very disappointed with both service and quality of product.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks is very very slow.  I don't recommend going through the drive thru.  It  took them at least 10 minutes to get one drink ready.   The frappaccino was good, just way too slow on the service!
name: Starbucks

text:
This is the 3rd time I've gotten coffee from this Starbucks where the barista lines up the fold of the cup with the mouthpiece of the lid and my coffee has dripped onto my shirt while drinking from the cup normally. I know that this Starbucks does this constantly and yet foolishly forgot to check the lid today and had coffee ruin my shirt. 
It seems to me anyone who has used these cups should be aware enough to not do this to customers..
name: Starbucks

text: This location is always very busy. It's Mother's Day and line is unbelievable. At one point 3 people working.
name: Starbucks

text: 2nd time at this Starbucks and very displeased. Last time they screwed up my entire order had to pretty mug beg for them to fix it. This time i had a mobile order, its Sunday they weren't busy. I was the only one waiting for a drink i still waited 10 minutes after the order was placed while i was still at my home up the road. Got my order handed to me and i was confirming drinks the young lady didn't know what i had or what the drink was that she handed to me. Oh and not to mention crispy breakfast sandwich anyone? Ill post a picture of my burned sandwich . The whole staff was chatting and bickering while i was in the store not a good experience. Take the extra 5min drive to Carolina place mall.
name: Starbucks

text: The young lady at the window was nice. My drink was abit lack luster.  It was ok, but not the best I have ever had either.
name: Starbucks

text:
As others have said before, service is more often than not horrible! I see some new faces and think perhaps this one is better..NOPE! Have only met one nice guy. This location is unfortunately closer so when I have to come here I try to order things they can't mess up....hopefully!
No smiles, greetings or thank you...if it wasn't for the sign you would think you're in some cheap place where you get what you pay for!!!
name: Starbucks

text: Longest drive through line ever. Took over 15 minutes and it didn't "look" long. Save your time and walk into a different location for faster service.
name: Starbucks

text: I really hate leaving bad reviews but I have had only a handful of times where they actually get my order correct. I have been a barista and I understand drinks get messed up, I usually just drink it and go about my day. But seriously it's pumpkin season and I look forward to this time every year... Not only did they make me a hot one when I asked for a iced one, when they remade it they didn't add enough pumpkin. Very upsetting that I can't go a full week without getting the wrong order. On the other hand this team does a great job at being very friendly in the morning. They just need to work on listening better to drink orders.
name: Starbucks

text: I don't know why I continue to give this Starbucks a chance. I can't remember the last time I went through that line just order one drink but it takes at least 10 minutes to go from the speaker to the window to finally getting my drink. I'm not joking when I say I can't remember. The employees laugh and giggle and stand around after scanning my phone, but not one, "you're drink is coming right up" or "sorry for the wait." Instead the guy behind me is thinking i ordered the whole menu and it's my fault.The drive thru has never been fast at this Starbucks, but it's the closest to my office. Ugh!! Oooooh! And I just took a sip and THEY GOT MY ORDER WRONG!!
name: Starbucks

text: The staff was Gery pleasant. The coffee good just wish it did not cost an arm or a leg. But the free wifi is great. I can update my APPs while I wait for my brew. The parking is a bit odd as it must be a very old starbucks
name: Starbucks

text: Slowest Starbucks in the world. Unfortunately it's right outside my hotel and I have painfully been here most days. When I have more time I go to the one out of my way down the street. Currently waiting in the drive through writing this. Been 8 minutes. Third car in line still.
name: Starbucks

text: This place has improved after remodel.  Everyone seems to have a happy attitude and coffee come out pretty quick and hot and yummy!  Yay!
name: Starbucks

text: Some of the friendliest staff i have ever encountered at a Starbucks.  Order was accurate and they even confirmed how many sweeteners I wanted before they made my coffee.
name: Starbucks

text: Of the hwy so yo can grab, sip, and roll about our day your way. I love the mobile app and its rewards. Great way to collect stars and free items.
name: Starbucks

text: Decent location. Easy to get in and out of. Went through the drive thru to get a few drinks. I didn't wait that long at all. Once I was at the window I noticed one of the drinks was the wrong size so I mentioned it. They changed it and made a new one quickly. The drinks were good and we were overall happy with our order.
name: Starbucks

text: Slowest Starbucks ever this is the second time in last two months I've come here. Waited inside for almost 20 minutes last month for one latte. Today I've been in drive through line for over 1/2 hour. Person running order system couldn't hear me. Was guessing at my order for a flat white and a cheese danish. Not too difficult to understand. Avoid this one if you're in a hurry  I'm still in line writing this. We'll see what I get!
name: Starbucks

text: Worst Starbucks location in Charlotte! For years now, CONSISTENTLY BAD! I lose my head after a year of staying away (again) and decide to give them another shot....shame on me! The drive thru service is awful! The drinks are awful! The staff can't muster a smile or hello, and couldn't care less about getting your drink right. I spent $8 on a drink, that was made wrong, TWICE, and ended up with something that tasted horrible! Such a waste of money, STAY AWAY from this one, it's worth it to make a drive elsewhere!
name: Starbucks

text: We ordered 5 drinks. They were all terrible. There was a coffee sitting by the trash untouched as if someone took a sip and ditched it. While we were waiting , multiple customers were unhappy with their drinks. When it was brought to the barista's attention she asked for an explanation why it was wrong. The trash was overflowing, the tables were not wiped and the floors were littered with trash.
name: Starbucks

text: This location can be very busy on a hot day. It is so frustrating when they get your order wrong and that has happened to me twice here. However, it's in a convenient location!
name: Starbucks

text: Possibly the worst Starbucks I've ever come across. Extremely rude employees who would rather chat amongst themselves than be productive. They are consistently low on food inventory so be prepared to have at least 2 backups when you order. The drive thru constantly takes at least 15 minutes to go through- and that's IF it's open. I thought I was stuck settling for this location and was going to give up on Starbucks completely until I found another location 2 miles away on Rea Rd. Do yourself a favor and travel there. Corporate should be ashamed of this branch and its inability to represent the Starbucks name.
name: Starbucks

text: It was my birthday, so got my free coffee drink, Caramel Machiato-barista was really nice.  Also gave  my friend her coffee for free, which was very nice.  Good location near the Carolina Place Mall, and the place was full.
name: Starbucks

text: It really does take 30 minutes to go through the drive thru as the other person mentioned. The service is terrible and EXTREMELY slow. Most staff is really rude and often get orders wrong or don't understand what you're trying to order so ask multiple times what you're asking for. If you do go here, definitely avoid the drive thru at all costs!
name: Starbucks

text: I've been coming to this Starbucks for about 5 years! I've never had any problems with the location, food/drink, or staff! I mean, I'm not saying that every visit to this Starbucks made me walk out skipping and whistling, but you know what I mean. Like most Starbucks locations, a lot of the desserts in the pastry case sell out a lot, which is not good when you have a 9:30 pm craving for lemon pound cake. The staff are always respectful, quick, and friendly which is great because in some locations I've had staff members scream at me that they don't have the secret menu. Speaking of the secret menu, I recommend "The Pink Drink" (now not so much of a secret) which is a strawberry aÃ§aÃ­ refresher with coconut milk instead of water. Quite delicious! Another tip is that if you have a dog (Or a kid or a craving) you can ask for a free puppuccino! What a puppuccino basically is, is a cup of whipped cream with caramel sauce. Now that I think of it, I don't think you should really give that to dogs but oh well!
name: Starbucks

text: This location seems to be consistently understaffed. A simple latte takes upwards of 15minutes. Customer experience could be significantly improved by properly staffing the store during the morning rush.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks has been consistently understaffed for years. It takes 30 mins to go through the drive through line. I even had to say "...hello?" When trying to order because there was no one there for several minutes. Come on Starbucks, these poor Starbucks employees must be so stressed! Hire more people!
name: Starbucks

text: A little hesitant to come to this Starbucks after reading reviews but as soon as I walked in this location was clean and barista, Tara, was happy to see a customer and very friendly. Service was great hardly any wait on my drinks.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks location does not hold up to the customer service of any other Starbucks I have visited. The drive thru line is always long with slow and unreliable service, and the baristas inside are argumentative when they make mistakes on the orders. I would recommend skipping this location for a faster, friendlier, and more reliable location.
name: Starbucks

text: What happened to the morning rush hour? 18 minutes for a hot latte at 8am? I don't think so
name: Starbucks

text:
This is the messiest I've ever seen a Starbucks. Food display looked empty and what was there didn't look at all appealing. Garbage (napkins, straw wrapper, food crumbs) everywhere. Not nasty but nothing that you expect from a Starbucks. Sugar container looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. Usually love this place, but a huge disappointment today.

Edited to add: We've been back many times and I think they've made some changes?! We do really like the size of the location (and the drive through).
name: Starbucks

text:
Service is very bad here. 

I stepped outside to the patio and when I went for a refill. I was told that I could not get a refill once I leave the property. This is the first time this has happened to me. 

I don't think I will be back to this location. Since they do not know the rules them selves. If they will not honor people going to sit in the patio and take that as leaving the property. Then you should not have a patio all together.
name: Starbucks

text:
Every time I come to this Starbucks, I ask myself why I keep coming here. The only reason is because there isn't another Starbucks nearby. The service is consistently awful...from me having to explain to a barista how to make a drink to the ridiculously long wait times...this place is a mess.  Half the time, the drink isn't even made correctly. But each time, I just have to deal with it because I don't have the time to wait for them to make another one. Oh, and the drive thru is no quicker. 

Also, the baristas all seem absolutely miserable. Don't expect to be greeted with a smile.
name: Starbucks

text:
The Starbucks nearby my apartment and hospital,the staff was friendly.
Outdoor seating and free WiFi.nice location for meet friends or work
name: Starbucks

text:
This used to be my favorite location and I'd come every day. I try to avoid it now. The drinks are inconsistent so I never know if I'm getting what I actually want. The parking lot is an absolute nightmare now because there is no clear drive through path marked. There are 2 lines and half the people in line just block cars into the lot. Plus the wait is sometimes very long now. Unfortunately I only see it getting worse if something isnt done due to more stores being built. I've tried online ordering to avoid the fiasco of the drive through, but they run out of stuff and dont tell you, so you end up standing there waiting for it and then have to get in line for a refund only after you ask them for what you ordered and THEN they tell you they are out after you've already paid.
   I'm saddened and disappointed by how much this location has gone downhill.
name: Starbucks

text: I never like the customer service here. The staff rarely smiles to customers, but I come here because of the location. Today I ordered 2 of Caramel Macchiato, and they turned out 2 different colors. I asked her and she said just because the other one had more milk. I said ok and feel like they do not make the same quality even at the same time. Yeah, I tried my 2 orders, one is so light and one is more bittter.
name: Starbucks

text: This store has probably given me the worst Starbucks experience of my life. The employees especially the manager don't smile nor give off the good, considerate vibes that Starbucks is supposed to have. I don't recommend coming here even just to study or even get your daily dose of coffee. They take forever to get your drinks and don't care about wasting your time. Go find another Starbucks.
name: Starbucks

text: Excellent place for a latte and a pumpkin scone. The staff is very friendly and the scone is excellent. If there is one thing I would change that would be the new seating that corporate put in the restaurant s. I loved the big cushy chairs. Corporate changed most of those out for hard wooden chais.  not the staffs fault I would still stop here again
name: Starbucks

text:
This is probably my favorite Starbucks in the valley. I never go through the drive thru - park and walk in and you have your order in half the time. 

Baristas are friendly and my order has never been incorrect. I like the layout and interior of this particular store, plenty of seating inside and very large seating area outside. Plus it's right beside tsp. Baking Co so you can grab a fairy roll or cookie to go with your coffee. 

It's also located near my gym so I can stop in for my standard spinach egg white wrap and venti Pike Place after my morning workout. 

Clean, friendly, and efficient, what more can you ask for from a mega-chain coffee shop?
name: Starbucks

text:
It's Starbucks!! I drink coffee and from everywhere!! They are semi friendly (not like Dutch bros thats for sure).  
It's kind of dirty inside and out.  
I wish they'd fill my cup with more coffee and less
Foam though!! 
Again it's Starbucks!! 

This particular Starbucks is always super slow!
name: Starbucks

text: Awesome location! The servers work super fast and efficient and with a smile. I came inside to hang out and use wifi use wifi from 7:30-9am. It was not crowded inside, but the line for the drive thru was very long! Anyway, I'm coming to this location whenever I need to kill time!
name: Starbucks

text:
I LOVE Starbucks, but this location gave us the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE ever.  The employee (Alana) behind the counter did not greet me, nor have any of the outstanding customer service that Starbuck typically has. She did not even thank me for the purchases we made. She honestly really looked like she rather be somewhere else. One of the other people in my party noted she did not greet or smile to any of the customers who came after us. Bleh, bleh, bleh! The rest of the staff seemed to be enjoying themselves with each other, but even when we picked up the drinks, the girl who gave us the drinks did not say enjoy your day or thank you as they would have in another location. WTH. Geez! Come on people. 


However, on the positive side, this location is huge, lots of seating inside and out and two huge bathrooms.  Hope this location figures out what customer service means, I won't be back to this location any time soon despite the great little bakery (TSP.) next door that has delicious baked good that need to be enjoyed with great coffee. I will head across the street to the Target Starbucks to get my cup of Joe.
name: Starbucks

text: Lot of attitude at this location. I ordered a vanilla frap b/c I needed a little caffeine. They gave me a vanilla bean frap. Told the girl this was not what I ordered, got a whole lot of attitude and mumbling under her breath bc she had to remake it. Starbucks has always had pleasant employees - not here!
name: Starbucks

text: This is my favorite Starbuck's by far! I love the friendly workers and ample room for seating. I can only give 3 stars right now due to how dirty the bathrooms always are. Also, the tables and counters aren't wiped off nearly often enough. If the cleanliness were better, I'd give this location 5 stars for sure.
name: Starbucks

text: I have to give a shout out to my favorite Starbucks! I actually go out of my way to visit this Starbucks. They have exceptional customer service. I have a very complicated drink and not only do they make it correctly, but they remember me! I never have to wait longer than 5 minutes in the drive, which is fantastic! I used to work at In-n-out Burger, so I know how hectic drives can be- yet I am always greeted with a pleasant smile and genuine hello!
name: Starbucks

text: One of the trashiest Starbucks I have ever been to.  Trash overflowing behind their store.  Told the manager did not even care.  If they care so little about the visible just imagine about the areas we can't see.
name: Starbucks

text: This is my favorite Starbucks. I live close by but that doesn't justify my reasoning. It's always busy in the drive thru but that goes for all Starbucks. This one is busy because it's off the freeway, on a major street and shopping centers near by. I like this location bc they have lots of tables in the front, the back of the store, and in the patio. I tend to bring my stuff to study and I always have space in the back and has power outlets at every chair. The employees are always nice and remember my order even though it's simple. I'll definitely be back.
name: Starbucks

text: The only thing that was missing from the now closed Starbucks location in the Walmart (215/Decatur) shopping center was a drive-thru. When that location closed they opened up this brand spanking new Starbucks (near Del Taco and Greens and Proteins) with a drive-thru, score! I noticed some of the baristas from the other closed location here at the new one, so it was nice to see friendly and familiar faces. There are tables with umbrellas outside on the patio and that area is dog friendly. Inside has decent space with high-top tables and stools, low-top tables and chairs and a half-booth seating with tables option along the wall. My drinks have been consistent and the bakery items I have purchased have been tasty. They take Starbucks rewards with no problem and if you haven't used the mobile pay on the app you should because it's so nice to just show up and have your order ready without the wait! Some locations have your order out and waiting for you and others keep it behind the counter, so don't forget to let them know you are there for a mobile order so they are aware you are there for it.
name: Starbucks

text:
This review encompasses two different visits. One on Christmas Day. I couldn't believe that they were open but for coffee-aholics such as myself, I guess Starbucks wanted to steer clear of harmful detox issues. How humane. 

With that being said, the girl at the front counter was hardly the usual chipper cashiers that I have grown accustomed to. This one was clearly not amused she was working on Christmas day. I call it the "stunning personality, get out of retail syndrome". It's my karmic relief from having worked in retail/retail management for over twenty years. On days such as a holiday, when you work for the MAN you show up and put your best face forward. Your time-and-a-half/double time is your master. Your happy to be employed, dammit! Pigtails was having none of it. I asked about if they no longer carried the larger sized water. Dunno. 

Good stuff is that these guys are some of the hardest working people in town. The coffee is usually consistent.  I hate getting a Cinnamon Dolce Latte that tastes like glorified water. Not here. 

More negatives is as others have reported, the trash is usually overflowing outside and in the back area, which it was today. There was also a stack of supplies in the corner which seems to be the place to put the overflow supplies due to insufficient room. Nonetheless, not too aesthetically pleasing to say the least.

More good stuff: Colton was a rockstar barrista in and out of the drive thru. He will be missed. There is usually room to get some quite time in at this location without being disturbed that your loitering. Being gold status allows for free coffee/tea refills. Score.
name: Starbucks

text: I have never experience rude service here until recently....... it's always a gentleman at the drive thru window who provides excellent customer service....... However recently it has been a young lady working the drive thru worst customer service ever..... pulled up and hear in a dry voice what can I get you..... pulled to the window no smile, she states the price of your order and handing you an order (never once repeating the order)..... and when asking for my receipt their out of paper and was unable to print one, then slam closed the window (WOW) !!!!!!!!
name: Starbucks

text:
I was really impressed with the design of this fairly new Starbucks location. 

It is very spacious with tons of seating both inside and out. It had a modern decor with flushed in wall drinks displays, a secluded study area in the back and a large counter area for the employees. 

I wish all Starbucks locations were designed like this location.
name: Starbucks

text:
Blonde haired guy made my drink so hot that it burned my mouth. 

I took it back, they remade it and it was drinkable but still quite hot to enjoy fully.

They need to go back to using thermometers here so no one gets 3rd degree burns!
name: Starbucks

text:
This location is conveniently located across the street from the (LVAC Gym).

One Saturday afternoon after working out, I stopped by for a venti pink drink and warm blueberry muffin. This location is bigger than the one I go to on Flamingo and the 215. There is plenty of open seating for all customers and the store was nice and clean. Upon entering the store I was greeted with a warm hello, and went right up and placed my order. The women who took my order even complemented my purse and my nails, and she took my order with a smile.

After getting my name for my order, my drink and muffin was ready in no time. It took me less than 20 minutes to order my food and receive it. The staff was super friendly and fast.
name: Starbucks

text: Super nice location and the staff were extremely friendly.  I ordered the Green Tea Frapp and it was excited perfectly.  I also like how it's never super busy so I can go there and relax and read without feeling overwhelmed.
name: Starbucks

text: So I give this Starbucks 5 Stars today because I've been there a few times before I only go to this one if I am close by Target or what not but I went to go because I love their new iced coconut milk macchiato which I never thought I would like it but it was very very good it's not too strong because I can't like my coffees a little bit on the sweet side but I do ask for extra white chocolate anyways the line was like super long and the drive-through I don't know what they were doing but by the time I came up to pay I went to hand the guy my money and they comped it for the long wait cuz my drink had been ready since 8:30 and I can tell that my drink was ready like as soon as I said it because the ice was pretty much almost melted but I really appreciate that they were just being considerate and I didn't even really have to say anything cuz I wasn't because I was just like you know it's a long line and it's a Sunday morning so I was going to trip but I did appreciate that
name: Starbucks

text: This location is perfect for studying! I love how spacious it is and there is plenty of seating always available outside and inside. The orders come out fast and the people are so nice. I wish they would turn down the music a tad bit but other than that great locatio
name: Starbucks

text: I love the service and my baristas at this location. They are always busy, but rarely wait long. If I had other coffee choices, I would not chose Starbucks, but I'm glad I have this location near me.
name: Starbucks

text: What a phenomenal experience at Starbucks! First class customer service and excellent visual presentation of store. I highly recommend this location to everyone!
name: Starbucks

text: Worst service I've ever experienced at a Starbucks. Waited over 10 minutes before 2nd batista asked what I'm waiting for. Really?! 2 rounds of customers served before me. Was told my receipt didn't print, asked if I was charged. So much attitude! Was 30 minutes until closing, entire staff already checked out. Should just close up..
name: Starbucks

text: Easy access to the drive thru and plenty of parking.  Located on the south side of CC215 and Decatur makes it a convenient location for quick stops.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks replaced the one that used to across the north side of 215. It's new so it is beautiful. I use the drive thru (almost daily) and they are quick. Coffee and food is always good. My only complaint is that they are stash when handing out napkins. If you want one, you'll have to ask for it. They won't automatically provide you with one, minor detail
name: Starbucks

text: My boyfriend and I go to this particular location every single morning to get iced coffees expecting good service. We are greeted by the same lady every time and all we get from her is poor service because of her attitude. It never seems to be different and we don't know why..... We professionally spoke to her about it and trust me, we understand that employees have to be at Starbucks way before they even open. We just think that people shouldn't be greeted with an awful attitude when they are the customer spending $5-$10 on coffee every morning!
name: Starbucks

text: Love the energy from the staff in this Starbucks! Good looking staff, excellent customer service and great drinks! Also some of the best seating in town.
name: Starbucks

text: They totally slaughtered my order here lol. I ordered one venti caramel frappe with a shot of espresso and almond milk. I at first received a grande caramel along with a grande java chip. When I spoke out about it I then received a java chip frapp with caramel. Worst experience here so far
name: Starbucks

text: Decided to come inside to check out the full menu and try something new.  Well they only have a partial menu up and it's stuck in the back left corner by the kitchen.  It's not even in a good visible spot behind the registers
name: Starbucks

text:
Out of every Starbucks here in Vegas, this is probably my favorite. The previous store was simply awesome, it had lots of room with tables and the staff were always nice and attentive. So when they made the move this February, I was a bit sad, but the change has been for the better.

So far, the new location is great! It's spacious as their previous location and now includes a drive thru. The decor here is really nice and offers a nice, relaxing, and Eco-friendly feeling. They have a lot of tables where you can sit down and chat over a cup of coffee or just study for the night, which is what I tend to do, lol. 

Everything that I've ordered here has always tasted great and never disappoints. This is one of the reasons why I continue to come here, but the primary reason is because of the employees. 

I go to a lot of Starbucks around Vegas to sit down and study, but the employees here have been the friendliest. Their service has been consistent since my first visit and are always nice and welcoming. 

However, the only issue I've experienced at the new store is that the wifi can be pretty slow.

Overall, I love this Starbucks. The new store has been better than expected (except the wifi) and they have kept all their previous employees, which is why I continue coming here.
name: Starbucks

text: It's a really friendly place and smells great! The atmosphere is homey and if you're taking a while to decide like me, they don't hover. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5: the first time I had the Horchata frappuchino was delicious! I knew I had to get it again. I came in another day and ordered the exact same thing, but it tasted watered down. I hope this was only a one time thing
name: Starbucks

text: Failed to make cold brew yesterday. My daily addiction today was not satisfied. Booo!
name: Starbucks

text:
While this may be the busiest Starbucks around, the staff is always friendly when I come in and gets my drinks right every time. 
I use the order ahead and my drinks are always waiting for me on time which is amazing.
I definitely recommend the order ahead at this location because the drive thru is almost always full.
name: Starbucks

text: Very disappointed. I feel like I threw away $6 after ordering my usual go to, the Strawberries and Creme Frappuccino. Initially it was more like watered down pink milk. The consistency was unacceptable. So I go back and ask for a remake after showing them how watered down it was, then the unimaginable happens. They make it again super watery. I am certain that a Frappuccino is made to a thicker standard than what they gave me twice! I shared with the girls that I was limited on time. I go to Starbucks close to daily and have never felt so let down. I spent the money and did not get to drink the drink. It went straight to the trash. Something should be done to make things right.
name: Starbucks

text:
So even being a non Starbucks employee I know their driving through time is supposed to be 4mins. 
I could understand "if" it's morning rush to be backed up but when there are two, 2 cars in your drive through and it takes almost 10mins, what is taking so long? 
The young girl at the window didn't even say sorry for your wait. Asked for payment, handed us our two tea's and that was it. Didn't even offer a copy of our receipt. 
This location needs better training on customer service and a little speed in their product. Disappointed customer won't return to this location.
name: Starbucks

text: Friendly and fast service is what we've always gotten at this Starbucks location.  I've been told it's one of the busiest in town, but it's not like that when I've come by because that's usually in the afternoon.  I can imagine that it's slammed in the mornings, though, with commuters who live in the neighborhood.  This is a bigger location with ample seating room as well as a community table in the back corner that looks good for meetings.  It's easy to access this location since it's close to the 215 and has a drive-thru, so if you need your fix, stop by here.
name: Starbucks

text: I'm Really glad there are so many other Starbucks to choose from. Its Unfortunate for EVERYONE when the register girl treats clientel poorly, because then, not only does the store lose money, but also the other batistas (bc if she were just "nice" people would probably shop AND tip ;) instead of just go to the next SBUX so they can be treated nicely. I will be sure to avoid this store all of the time just in case Kylie is working any of the time! (Not worth it to buy a $7 coffee if it comes with a side of rudeness).
name: Starbucks

text: Stopped by for breakfast n coffee..l paid with a $100 bill n she was rude about it..the sandwiches were very gross. .my son really enjoyed his coffee n chocolate croissant. .buuutt..they forgot to give me my coffee..that was 20 minutes ago..been trying to call, since I'd be running late if I went back, I just want them to remember tomorrow so I can go pk it up tmrw morning..but can't get a hold of anyone..not a good start to my monday:(
name: Starbucks

text: When I haven't even taken a drink yet... I love this Starbucks the staff is so nice and sweet but I feel like when I pay for a venti I shouldn't get my drink filled with only a grande amount -_-
name: Starbucks

text: Not sure what's with the low ratings. I think it's all about the company you're with, people! Mine was a friend and her kid - my kid's friend.  It was raining and we just had tiny adorable cupcakes next door.  We've had a blast.  The room is not that big so it's kind of cozy. The service was good.  The location is convenient too, so no need to circle around looking for it either.
name: Starbucks

text: Update, I contacted the corporate office who said they would get with the management of this store to do some much needed training. They indicated this was not the 1st complaint against this location on North Decatur and the 215. They also refunded to my card the money I spent at this location, which was not my intent. I love Starbucks and enjoy going to their businesses and expect the same level of great service I receive at other Starbucks. Hope they turn around. I might try them on my next visit to the bakery next door.
name: Starbucks

text:
Stopped in for some fuel during the somewhat early morning hours.  After getting off of the 215, I looked a head through the windshield and discovered a line of cars, I was getting ready to flip around and disregard, but as I passed I saw this was an optical illusion.  Given the windows position and the layout of the drive-thru it's a tad short on the front end.

Like the good little lemming SB expects me to be, I rolled in and waited.  Not a long wait, but a wait just the same.  I ordered what has been my drink of choice as of late.....a grande, iced, dirty (insert shots of espresso here) chai.

The line moved quickly and when threw my phone out the window to get beeped, the grande was a venti.  Unknowingly and unwittingly up-sold......damn it.  But after the first sip, I was immediately nullified and rolled out of a long backend from the window just like SB expects me to do.

This SB is A-OK......after all......what other option do I have?
name: Starbucks

text:
Went early afternoon,  ordered grande chocolate frappuccino & banana nut bread....after hours of consumption I am really sick...regurgitation & the other stuff...constant. ..non stop. ...called & spoke with supervisor Pauline since no manager is not there & explained what happened...she said, " we will refund your money. " I feel such nausea & irritability from this...not a pleasant feeling at all...my stomach continues to rumble....
They need to check the temperature on everything they serve to prevent bacteria from setting on food, mixers, etc....this is serious...I am one thought from going to a clinic. ..I feel very very bad.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks sucks! They  are always out of things. No flavored syrup and now no napkins. What's next? Coffee? This location is also not the cleanest.
name: Starbucks

text: If there's only girls there in the mornings you'll be lucky to get your order the way you want it.  More than half the time if there's only the girls in the morning there's something wrong even with the simplest of orders (asked for no ice in cold brew, get ice...)  This store's only saving grace is Colton.
name: Starbucks

text: Great new refreshing location with a  drive thru replacing the one at Walmart plaza.   Fast friendly service that gets orders right.   Very nice patio area with umbrellas and northern exposure. Update:    a few months after their opening,  this store has lots of business so if you go during peak hours you might not find a seat inside. Most Starbucks are smaller than they should be.  WHY? Also,  many come for the wifi and hog the tables for hours
name: Starbucks

text: This location needs new employees. I come here multiple times a week because it is close to my house. However I notice that the line moves faster when the man with blonde hair is working the drive thru. The others are not that interested in doing their jobs really. I wish the manager would read the reviews and make changes. Unless the manager is the problem. â€�
name: Starbucks

text:
I get that I had a very difficult order. I'm super happy tho that I now have the chunk of change to pay off my credit card debt. I provided the proof in the pic below 29k plus! Windfall!! It's no wonder the cashier couldn't get the ticket correct. I is 7:00 AM and there is loud cackling, a soliloquy about grades and teachers on a loop from another employee and I just want to get the heck out of here! I don't blame the mistake due to the loudness of the din. What I am however, is now I feel uber entitled to the 29k at this point (not!).

I'm going to sneak out hopefully but I'm on my way up the cash cage to collect on my funds first. Hey it's Vegas baby! It's worth a try!
name: Starbucks

text:
I came through the drive through yesterday afternoon; and the other girl who was working the window, was so unnecessarily rude... I asked for the almond milk and the cocoa protein powder, for the new vegan drink (which I highly recommend).  When i tried it, it was with the almond butter ...so I reminded her, that I like the cocoa powder please... just her whole attitude was shockingly rude, as she sarcastically said "thanks" and slammed the window shut - I was worried she may have spit in my drink.  That's a messed up feeling, when I'm treating myself to a $7 coffee!! Lol.  Seriously though, I'm a very friendly person, so for someone to act that way towards me, is so un-called for ...maybe she was having a bad day, or I reminded her of someone she doesn't like ?? But, it left a bad taste for me.  Just saying....  customer service is so important, when working in the food and drink industry... if that is not possible for someone, they should reconsider industries.  
Just wanted to say, that the girl who helped me out TODAY, was very friendly and cheerful!!! I really appreciated that extra smile and positive attitude!!! - what a turn around.  Wish I could get that same positive service every time.
name: Starbucks

text: This is how all Starbucks should be.  Friendly staff and outstanding customer service.   Service is fast.  They always, no matter how busy they are take a minute to great each and every customer.   First class staff with first class service.  Everyone who works there takes pride in what they do.
name: Starbucks

text: Placed a customized drink order for my husband and got charged twice for the caramel drizzle but seems like I only got half of the amount of drizzle I'm supposed to actually get. Really disappointed because the baristas clearly look at the ingredients attached to the cups before making the drinks, but whoever made my drink wasn't generous enough to fulfill my order and whatever extra I paid for :((
name: Starbucks

text: Rude as hell employees.  Corrected at drive thru for saying "pikes peak" instead of "pikes peak place."  Rude girl working cash register,  doesn't  say thank  you or offer any kind of greeting.  Also, don't  know how you can f up a plain coffee with splenda and half and half, but they did.  Since there are Starbucks on literally every  square inch, don't  go to this garbage location.  Time was 1:26:53 pm, Register 4, 12/27/17.
name: Starbucks

text: This is the worst Starbucks I've been to. The drive thru is always super slow and my drink is rarely correct. The only reason for two stars instead of one is because the staff are (usually) friendly. I've given it several attempts over the last few months hoping it would improve, but no such luck... I hope they make adjustments. It's unfortunate because the proximity to the 215 makes the location ideal for my daily commute but instead I choose to go to another location even though it is out of the way just to avoid this one.
name: Starbucks

text: Do not recommend this Starbucks. Always in the drive thru for over 20 minutes, no one here is ever in a rush and I've been late to work multiple times. Baristas don't listen and get my orders wrong every time.
name: Starbucks

text: My wife and I frequent this store because the baristas are fun, polite and always professional. Shoutout to Chris, Sydney & Nicole.
name: Starbucks

text:
This used to be the best starbucks in the area.  Over the last year it took a sharp decline.  The drive through situation is awful now.. you will have 4 cars branching out into the parking lot blocking cars from leaving.. and another line branching the other way where nothing is blocked. People have no common sense and will cut off cars in line the correct way.. now with sprouts coming soon it will only get worse.  The quality of drinks have gone way down since colton(sp?) left.  Its usually wrong 60 to 70% of the time.  If you order online and the item is out of stock (which seems to be half the items on the menu) they will just steal your money... they dont refund it they just put your cup up there without your other items and you still pay for what they were out of and you gotta actually ask for your money. 

As previously stated this used to be the "go to" location for the northwest since they opened up... now its a very stressful experience... they need some way to remedy the drive through multiple lines crap and they need to bring in some better baristas with a better sense of quality control.
name: Starbucks

text:
I avoided this Starbucks for the longest time because of their long lines, both inside and at the drive thru.  I was also told that this Starbucks is one of the busiest locations in Las Vegas outside of the strip.  I started coming back to this Starbuck after downloading their app.  It's simple...place my order online, pay through my app, walk in, and grab my Americano.  Done!  Finito!  I don't have to wait in their long lines anymore.  Thank goodness for technology.  Starbucks is really consistent with their Americano and that's my go-to drink.  The service is great and their baristas are well trained at handling the volume of people here. Another thing to add, this Starbucks is spacious and very clean.  There's plenty of seating and enough outlets.  Starbucks is great for keeping me charged up. 

TIP #1:  tsp is right next door.
TIP #2:  Blaze Pizza is right across the street
TIP #3:  Greens & Protein in the same parking lot

2017 Yelp Review #123.  Another couple of hundred to go. 

Sent from my iPhone
name: Starbucks

And the third and final thing that I really enjoyed about my Subway experience, other than the food was perfect, is that the owner of this store actually works here in his behind the counter. text: This subway this relatively near me so I stop by for a quick meal on my way home. A sub is a sub pretty much so I can't complain about a sandwich. It's not a good look to have food all over the containers you keep supposedly fresh food in.

text:
Sometimes it's the little things that mean a lot. Take for instance, a Subway 6-inch. When I am in the mood for food to carry me over for a few hours, a 6-inch Subway sub does the job. 

   Lately Subway is a fantastic value. This is the era of the daily $3 6-inch Sub of the Day. Corresponding to each day of the week there is a feature sub for $3. With a 21 ounce drink it comes out to around $5.20. 

  This is the closest Subway to my residence. Over the years that date back prior to the birth of my Yelp profile I have caught this Subway's act.  It is more than the subs that I enjoyed. It was also their fountain Strawberry Fanta. Before the Coke Freestyle machines were around this was one of the few restaurants in my neighborhood that offered strawberry Fanta. Throughout the years my experiences here were three stars. The common denominators in my experiences were one or two people working in the restaurant and consistency in good subs. 

   In recent times during the Daily $3 Sub of the Day Era, my experiences here continue to be three stars. My most recent subs were the meatball marinara and tuna. They are so clear in my conscious that I could talk about the past two visits in more detail. 

   Before I even describe my recent experiences inside this Subway, there are a few words about outside. The shopping center it sits in is poorly laid out. The Subway parking spaces are in a poor location where vehicles back up to the traffic signal at Green Valley Parkway causing the parking spaces to be blocked on. I always park further away by Green Valley Grocery or Bank of America to avoid being blocked in. 

   Inside Subway there are plenty of tables. Finding a table has never been a problem. Fast service on the other hand is a slight problem. 

  There has been one or two people running this Subway. Today there was genuinely one person running it because the woman doing all the work was training the new guy. The upshot is that during peak periods the woman running the business still has two hands. When she is both sandwich artist and cashier, speed slows to a crawl. What could you do? If there were three people working here, I doubt they would see $3 6-inch Sub of the Days. These employees have always been pleasant and hard working. 

    Today I ordered the tuna fish sub on Italian bread. I requested that the sandwich artist toast it in the microwave. As a sandwich artist, she did not hold back on the toppings. I requested every topping with the exception of pickles and banana peppers plus extra mayonnaise. For a quarter more than you'd pay for a cup of coffee nearby at Mothership Coffee, this sub was $3 well spent. Going back a few weeks prior I ordered the meatball marinara. This meatball marinara was similar to the one I recently ate in the Pebble Marketplace Subway, where the bread crumbled causing the meatball to fall out and consequently turning into my version of dirty dining where sauce gets all over my hands. Besides that it was a tasty sub with a sporadic serving of meatballs sharing the Italian bread with provolone cheese, onions, olives, and tomatoes. 

   The $3 Sub of the Day Deal really fits the catchphrase of Subway making it your way. When I am in the vicinity of Green Valley Parkway at Subway Road and want something to fill me over for a few hours, this Subway hits the spot.

This makes it a great place to pick up some McDonald's comfort food if your hotel is close such as the Monte Carlo itself, the Aria, Vdara or even the Cosmopolitan. I chose (4 stars) "Yay! I'm a fan" because I think that this is a convenient and affordable place. And, it's open 24/7, which is another positive!

text:
Open 24/7. Came here for breakfast before a convention conference, the line was long but the service was great. Didn't have to wait too long for breakfast once the order was placed. Ordered Sausage McGriddle combo with hash brown and orange juice!

Long lines ALL the time! Be prepared to wait a while and not know where the line starts/ends!
address: Monte Carlo Food Ct, 3770 Las Vegas Blvd S

name: McDonald's

text:
Breakfast was here as their Cafe is closed and there was a 25 minute wait at the Pub (which looked half empty, but maybe the lounge/bar section I was looking at was closed).

It was a solid, cheap breakfast (especially compared to some of the sky-high prices at places like Caesar's cafe).  I'm disappointed they don't give credit towards the mLife card though.

The vinyl seats of the food court chairs are cracked and look really bad.
address: Monte Carlo Food Ct, 3770 Las Vegas Blvd S
