name: Subway

text:
We ordered basically three 6" (one 12" and one 6") toasted steak & cheese sandwiches with meat, shredded cheese and black olives - that's it. 

Look at the photo of what our $25 delivery order bought us: pretty much nothing!! All three sandwiches were this pitiful. This is a little six inch sandwich, don't forget!  

The chopped meat was limited to a little strip in the middle, not even covering the bread. We ordered shredded Monterey Jack, but there wasn't enough cheese to hold the meat to the bread - even toasted. Black olives? Ha! My sandwich had only ONE slice on it...

Maybe it isn't much to some, but we're grandparents raising a teenage grandchild on a single fixed income. This was a mistake we simply cannot afford to make again. Shame on you for such a crappy effort!!!

name: Subway

text:
One of the worst Subways I've ever been to. Note to everyone considering a franchise: if you can't afford to run the business correctly, DON'T DO IT! 

Although there were three annoying things that  happened at this Subway, I wasn't going to make a public complaint until I opened the sandwich at home.

1. I was about to get the last bit of tuna in the tub, so I asked if there was a fresh one. The guy says "It's from today." This was now 4:30 pm. But, he did replace. 

2. I asked for swiss cheese. "I don't have that today." 

3. I asked for cup to get water. "I don't have water. The machine is broken."

I bought the sandwich. When I got home and took sandwich out of the bag, it felt wrong. See photo. Yep, the supposed 6 inch sandwich was just 5 inches!

name: Taco Bell

text:
To the Blonde in the drive-thru, you totally made my day. I can't thank you enough for stalling the cops order behind me, because you even saw me cut him off to get in line. My kid was hungry, oops! 

I'm not a fan, but my kid loves the cheese roll ups. I just made a quick stop because it's right by the gym & she was hungry from playing at the kids center for 2 hrs. I typically DO NOT fork out any money for fast food like this, but I needed to get some change & feed my kid. Killed 2 birds with 1 stone. Yay me!

Anyway, if I ever do come, it's only when it's extremely hot and I need to get a freeze slushy drink during happy hour 2-5, just so I can take it home & mix it with some liquor to forget the fact I was just at Taco Bell. 

All in all, the girl at the window was really the main reason I did this review. She was just so helpful!

name: Taco Bell

text:
Worst Taco Bell experience ever. My wife and I went through the drive through around 3:15 on Monday afternoon. Order two meals with drinks. Nothing complicated, no weird modifications. When we returned home not only was our order wrong, all the food was cold. Probably because we waited 25 min in the drive through to have our food tossed at us when it was done. I order a Mexican pizza meal which comes with 2 taco supremes. The mex pizza was good but the tacos were cold and broken. My wife's burrito was cold completely, and her taco was missing cheese. Also ordered a cheesy Gordita crunch my her brother. Got a cold piece of flat bread with barley any meat and a torn wrapper. The cheese wasn't melted and there was no hard taco in it. I worked for Taco Bell for 3 years as a GM in Colorado. I know what everything should look like. Very disappointed.

P.S I'm a diabetic and they gave me Pepsi instead of plain Ice tea. Now am taking double insulin to counter act the sugar

text:
Ok, I had to calm down before I write this. There's a reason why I don't come here. I wish they could have gotten my order right. I ordered they repeated back to me. I checked my bag and low in behold, my order is wrong. 

My order was not properly sealed so I had sour cream and tomatoes in my bag. Most of my food was in the bag instead of together in my tacos. I guess the manager was taken my order. $26 I paid, that's it no more. I'll visit Del tacos or another place. 

The positive was the store was clean. Staff was somewhat friendly. They did greet me upon me walking in.

name: Taco Bell

text:
I know you cant expect a lot from a fast food restaurant but this one is so horrible that is deserves an equally horrible review. Our chalupa was soggy and wet, lacking the robust golden crunch that often accompanies this amazing dish. The highlight of taco bells chicken quesadilla is its crack like sauce mixed with moist chicken and rich melted cheese. This experience fulfilled no such desire. It was almost apparent that no chicken was included in our chicken quesadilla and that the sauce factory began their strike at 11:59 this saturday night. I pray that no other soul will ever have their hopes crushed in such the way that mine was tonight. God bless, and goodnight. 
P.S. omw to del taco.

name: Taco Bell

text:
Not my normal eat spot by any stretch.  I was out and out and while cruising west on Warm Springs during rush hour traffic, I needed calories.  Starting in the are of the 15, I would eventually stumble on this spot.  

Why does it seem that when I pull into any drive-thru the first four cars in front of me pull into the same damn I am?!  This TB was no exception.

While waiting for those four cars to negotiate the squad box, when I pulled up, I found the clerk to be friendly enough.

Eventually I would make my day to the window to pay and pick up my chow.  

Some 15 minutes later, I was back out on Warm Springs. I laid waste to floor boards of my vehicle leaving traces of the A-OK chow while I only sought calories.  My lack of discipline sucks.  TB is not a staple and by no means a favorite.  Generic at best.  One would think the staff would be on point during rush hour.....but it was not.  

Trust you, me....I will exercise more discipline in the future and eat the petrified protein bar in my center console.

text: This location is across the street from where I live, so I've been going only to this location for about 2 and a half years. A year ago, I would have given this location 1 star, but they have REALLY improved on everything. The food, obviously, is the same as all the other stores, but here they seem to give larger portions now. Rarely dine in, but the people working the drive thru are so incredibly friendly! A lot of them recognize me and carry on a short conversation, other than the "do you want sauce" question. Tortillas are almost always soft and fresh. I'm moving this month and that Taco Bell better live up to the standards this one has set. :)

This place is hit or miss. Sometimes they're super friendly and get everything right in your order and then there's days where they mess up everything in your order. So make sure you check your bag before you drive away. 

Taco Bell is probably my favorite fast food joint. Just wish this place was better at checking there drive thru orders. Not convenient to drive back to get what's missing so I never do but I feel like I'm just giving away my money at this point. Not cool.

name: Taco Bell

text: This Taco Bell has always been great until today when they rushed so fast that they didnt even bother to make the food right. How do you mess up something as easy as a regular taco. By the time I got home and down to the last taco in my potato rito box, I noticed my taco was kinda small and all it was was a shell with a little bit of meat on it. So I tried to call them but no one ever answers the phone and they dont have an answering machine. Im leaving this review cause im not satisfied and im not about to waste my gas to go back there just to replace a taco that would cost approx the same amount in gas just to make the round trip. Some advice, check your food before leaving the window and dont bother if it waste their average drive thru time cause getting the meals right is what's more inportant.

name: Taco Bell

text: Poor management and inadequate employee training. The manager Jared Warn is very unprofessional in handling issues with employees/trainees. Instead of letting them know what they may be doing wrong, makes them clock out and sit out (without giving a reason why) and then fires them the next day without providing a real reason, warning or a chance to improve, when none of the other managers had any problems. No one goes into a job, especially a minimum wage one, already knowing everything and being able to multi-task, and 7 hours is definitely not enough time to learn all the skills and perfect them. If you don't really want to take the time to train, you need to let the employees know up front and maybe someone with a few years of experience will sign up!

text: This location is ok. I go to this one because the next closest one is by the mall and it's hard to get in and out of that place. It seems like this place the drive through lines are always long so it's best to go inside. Every drive through order I have made here something is missing! Fries, a sammich, nugz. They also never seem to give enough napkins. The food when you do get it is always hot so that's a good thing. Now when you go inside and order you get the best service! The staff is friendly and food is never missing and is perfect. So it really is best to go inside. Less of a wait as well compared to the drive through. The inside is always clean. Tables are never sticky either. The counters are clean and wiped down. Their bathroom are clean as well. I don't use public restrooms much but when I did have to use this one it was very clean! Was impressed. I will probably fight the mall crowd and go to the other location. They don't seem to mess up drive through orders.

name: Wendy's

text: It's Wendy's. I didn't walk in expecting French cuisine or a five star restaurant experience. If the food had been freshly prepared it would have been a good Wendy's meal, and I would have given it five stars---for being my favorite fast food, done well. Unfortunately, I ordered the four for four. It's a helluva deal; junior bacon cheeseburger, small fries, four piece nuggets and a drink. First the good. One half of my four by four was flawless! The nuggets were warm, and crispy, and the mix your own drink setup they have is great and allowed me to have a raspberry coke! The rest of the meal was atrocious. The fries were not just verging on cold. They were dry, flavorless, and hard. The junior bacon cheeseburger, that little tight  wrapped bundle of all the perfect burger trappings for so cheap was bound together with a foot long dark hair. The hair was matter on the top of the nun but then inextricably wove its way between the burger patty and the toppings and then back around under the bottom. To their credit I asked for a replacement for the burger and they provided it. Corporate fast food is biologically and psychologically constructed to taste great, and it can if its done well. This Wendy's failed.

attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': False, 'casual': False}

name: Wendy's

text:
The service here is always friendly and never forgets your order. As for food quality, it's all over the place as one would expect for fast food. Sometimes the fries are salted, sometimes they are completely dried out, other times they are mushy. The burgers are similar, one day soggy, another day too dry, then no condiments, etc. The one standout food item is, and has always been, the chicken nuggets. They are always great.

My main gripe with this location is that there is a 20+ minute wait for the drive-thru at all times of day. So do not stop here if you are in a hurry.

Overall, it's been a consistently good Wendy's and this is the first one to get my order correct over 95% of the time.

text: I'm a regular customer here.   I'm very disappointed with all the new staff they have working.   I ordered three Carmel fraps.   Workers made my drink taste like a ice Frap.  Then the worst part was them not even wiping my cup down with the left over spill that they put on the cups.   I had to take a napkin and wipe it myself and got coffee on my work shirt. I am furious!
name: Starbucks

text: It's unfortunate this location has completely gone down hill since the remodel. On multiple occasions I've experienced several problems not only with poor customer service but inconsistent drinks. The first time I contacted corporate to bring light to the situation and for it to hopefully help the store but clearly not much has changed. There are many other locations close by that I will gladly take the extra few minutes to drive to receive a 5 Star drink and 5 Star customer service.
name: Starbucks

text: Phyllis was super helpful when she patiently explained to my half-awake self the differences between the nitro and regular cold brew. The cafe itself is open and cool, a nice respite from the summertime sun.
name: Starbucks

text: First they gave me a cap that was dented, so my coffee ended up spilling all over me and when the lady went to hand me my coffee through the drive-through apparently it spilled on the outside of my car but she didn't tell me so I didn't find out until I got to work. THEN on top of it, I asked for soy milk which I didn't get and I'm lactose intolerance so that was great
name: Starbucks

text: I hate when I'm made to feel bad because THEY messed up my order. I ordered an iced drink, even made sure my receipt was correct and it was. Barista made my drink and I noticed it was hot. When I told her it was supposed to be iced she looked at me like I should've said something earlier. After she gave me that look, I even showed her my receipt to prove it. She said it's fine and went to grab another cup to make it iced but her body language showed how annoyed she was. I just said forget it and took the hot drink...last visit to this location.
name: Starbucks

text: Like what everyone said here, crap service. I've done mobile orders here a few times and they always seem to be late. I had hoped they would change but nope. Today, I went in to pick up a mobile order and it wasn't made yet. There was no one in line and everyone was just standing around until they figured out that I was waiting for my drink. I literally saw them make my drink from scratch when I ordered it 15 min ago. Almost got into an accident rushing to go back to work.
name: Starbucks

text: Very poor service. I've been here multiple times and my request for a cooler temperature has been ignored every time. The staff was unfriendly, and only seemed to acknowledge the regulars.  I drive out of my way to go to a different coffee shop now.
name: Starbucks

text: I Love Starbucks...This one isn't too busy right off a major street..good parking lot...Employees are friendly..Just wish they were open later.
name: Starbucks

text: My beverage was completely wrong. To spare you, go to another Starbucks down the street. The guy taking my order didn't even know the drink and the barista on bar clearly did not either.
name: Starbucks

text: Typical Starbucks. Overpriced for what you get but I was in a hurry and couldn't find a specialty coffee house. It was clean and organized which is a nice feature for most locations.
name: Starbucks

text: Crap service. Ordered online stood at the pickup spot being ignored until pink hair finally handed over my drink without a hello have a good day or anything. I guess talking to her coworker was more important.
name: Starbucks

text: My normal Starbucks was remodeling so I decided to try this one...mistake. I'm okay with the non smiles cause I'm not a morning person.  I placed a mobile order said it would be ready in 4 to 6 minutes which I was ok with since I am 8 to 10 minutes away I get there and had to wait another 5 minute I had iced coffee not a fancy drink
name: Starbucks

text: There are currently 3 other customers in the lobby, one of which came after me. I waited 15+ minutes for a tall vanilla bean frap and iced water. I wasn't given any sort of head up about a potential problem until I got up to request status of my order, thinking they had forgotten about it. Apparently the label maker was jammed. Um, I'm the only one in here waiting for a drink at the moment. Are labels necessary? Especially after the wait for a simple beverage. Not cool. I won't frequent this place.
name: Starbucks

text: Very rude people work in this Starbucks, they don't want to take my discount for today 3-Mar-18 happy hour even with my code, bit that was not the problem, the problem was because I'm Hispanic and they noticed my accent. No cool, no fair, no Starbucks for me
name: Starbucks

text: I really hate when Dutch bros. is closed. It's Christmas, not once did the girl at the register ask how I was, or return when I asked her. She threw the change I was giving her (just to make it even, I wasn't paying in change) on the ground when I gave it to her even though I told her it was there. Instead of giving me my whole change since SHE dropped the change, she gave me broken up change - fine. But then dropped my change. All at the drive thru window...really? No merry Christmas wish back. Just all around rude and not very intelligent. Ever since this location reopened the staff has been horrible. I was told it was all NEW employees of Starbucks when they opened - it still shows. Learn some customer service and how to make an easy drink.
name: Starbucks

text:
Crap service. Ordered online stood at the pickup spot being ignored until pink hair finally handed over my drink without a hello have a good day or anything. I guess talking to her coworker was more important.
Visited on 7/14. Used mobile app to order the new steak and tomatillo wrap. Order wasn't ready when I arrived though it should have been. Steak wrap was not good. Doesn't look anything like the pic. Ate about 1/3 before I got to the meat so the egg part was dry. The tortilla was more like the pastries in hot pockets. Usually their food is good. I luv the egg white wrap. It is made with tortilla unlike the steak. The steak mixture was very bland. Huge let down and waste of calories and money.
name: Starbucks

text: Just like any Starbucks they're always fast and friendly. The Starbucks is very clean. It does get very packed as well. But I love the online ordering app. I order it on my way there walk in pick up and keep going on my way.
name: Starbucks

text: My go to Starbucks when I need coffee before work. The staff is friendly, service is fast and the store is always clean!
name: Starbucks

text: The line is insane and although a line is normal at Starbucks sitting in the drive thru for 20 minutes is bad. The last 3 weekend trips were torture, Even mobile ordering doesn't save time. They never have it ready. The drive thru is a new feature but it seems to be a hurdle to large for this group to handle. Hopefully someone can get in there and show leadership. Efficiency is something this Starbucks is not, so unless you have a chunk of time on your side, go to another one. Side note the employees are pleasant, amateur but polite.
name: Starbucks

text: I used to love this location but they ruined it by adding the drive thru. There used to be a nice large patio that I enjoyed. It's half the size now and you have the cars driving thru right next to it.
name: Starbucks

text: Love Starbucks! But the crew here is the not the friendliest so we go elsewhere. Kinda sucks since this is the closest location to us.
name: Starbucks

text: A friend who was in from out of town and I were in the one comfortable spot in the store (next to the door) and at 8:30 on a cold night the employee just propped open the door right next to us and said nothing. He froze us out of our chairs but he was bundled in a warm coat. There was another door but honestly if he had just approached us and said hey I have to bring in the patio furniture is it going to bother you? Or been smart enough to use the other door it would have been way better service. Come on... Common sense anyone?  The store just got redesigned and the furniture is super uncomfortable and laid out weird.
name: Starbucks

text: gross they made my coffee wrong the first time they forgot the flavoring and it tasted like roasted almonds but not the good honey roasted one, more like burnt. PSA it's not like they used almond milk so who knows where that taste came from. they remade my mysterious almond tasting , supposedly white mocha coffee, and let me tell you it still tasted like crap. honestly i will never stop at a random starbucks ever again, y'all let me tell ya it was nasty. disappointed... no no more like DISGUSTED
name: Starbucks

text: If I could leave negative stars, I would. We ordered 3 sandwiches and paid for them. I was told that the one I ordered was no longer being offered after the fact and picked something else. My wife waited for about 20 minutes and went up to ask what was going on and the barista looked at her like she was stupid for ordering those 2 sandwiches that are no longer offered rather than apologizing for not telling her and refunding her. She had to wait in line to get a refund, and the manager only refunded what she didn't get as if he was doing her a favor. I always go to starbucks and have never gotten this bad of service at any other locations.
name: Starbucks

text: Total first world, gold-plated problem...but how do you run out of Earl Grey AND breakfast tea by 8:30am the week of Christmas?!  Really disappointed...to add insult to injury I had to wait in an endless drive-thru line and drive away empty-handed.
name: Starbucks

text: Most of the time my order is always complete. Today I had ordered my food from my mobile with plenty of time.. neither of my items were ready.. when I asked for my items.. they couldn't find them and the lady asked me to make sure that I ordered from the right location.. so I had to go to my car and show her that I did order from that location. They were apologetic and another barista that I first came in contact with, offered me a gift card for my next drink.. very thoughtful. Although there was a little inconvenience.. I would still order from there
name: Starbucks

text:
Two out of two, in as many days, of my Mochas have been far from extra hot as requested.  
And a Snickerdoodle Cocoa on Monday night was the same.  Tasty, but not extra hot.  I chalked it up to she may not have heard my request.
But three times in the same week?!
So sad that I specifically request this and what is put in my hands doesn't even need that special cardboard, protective wrap (collar, sleeve, clutch, zarf, cozies, hot cup jackets) meant to keep your hands from burning.
Seriously, if I can pour myself a coffee at Circle K and doctor it up (24oz cup, 4-5 count half & half, PLUS 3 of the flavored individual creamers) and still walk away with a coffee that is hotter than what I request here, that's just wrong.  Wrong!
Baristas need to start using a themometer and/or quit wasting product as well as my time and money.
Okay, that vent is done.  
The staff is courteous, timely and professional.
name: Starbucks

text: This is a WONDERFUL Starbucks. All of their employees are extremely friendly and my order is always done fast! I only go about once a week and it is such a treat to go. The drive thru line is never long either. Everything is wonderful!!!
name: Starbucks

text:
Brand new Starbucks in Pleasant Hills on Clairton Blvd near Century III mall.  Its a welcome addition because the other nearby locations are too far away due to South Hills traffic.

They're going through a couple new store growing pains but nothing serious.  My Americano tastes great and was ready quickly.  The indoor seating is nice with small end tables between the chairs, plus some counter seating.  The outdoor seating is very nice today - the weather is fantastic. There are about 6 two-person tables, and two umbrellas.
name: Starbucks

text: My go-to Starbucks! Every time I order, my drinks have been perfect. I don't have to worry about buying a $5 glass of milk when I order a chai latte. The staff is really nice and fast, so the drive thru moves quickly when you're trying to grab a drink and go.
name: Starbucks

text: Starbucks trains their employees well. I always get great service and great coffee. I'm over the moon that I have a Starbucks closer to my home now. I'm stoked that they have a drive through and tables to sit at outside. This location has Gender Neutral Bathrooms. It also has a section that is kind of walled off that has a little communal table and some chairs. The employees are very friendly and were patient with the two 7 year olds who gave their own orders today. It's the holidays and that can bring stress but our time at Starbucks was stress free and enjoyable. Cheers !
name: Starbucks

text: Constantly out of cheese danishes. Of all the ones I have been to all over the country this one is constantly out of them. I should have drove to the one down at the waterfront and parked and got out of my car since that is what I had to do anyways. Had to buy them at the market instead. I only stopped at this one because they have a drive through. Whoever manages that place needs to get their shit together. It's been 3 times now since they have opened..
name: Starbucks

text: The pleasant hill's Starbucks is my favorite Starbucks. The staff is really good and so friendly. They make me feel welcome every time I am there. Love going there.
name: Starbucks

text: I go to this Starbucks alot and always have a good experience with the employees and establishment. The drive thru definitely makes it easy for quick morning and lunch trips to Starbucks. All the staff is always really friendly and fast.
name: Starbucks

text: I was thrilled to discover Pleasant Hills' recent addition.  I love Starbucks and this location does not disappoint.  Beautiful store, convenient location, fast and friendly service.  Welcome to the neighborhood Starbucks!
name: Starbucks

text: I have yet to venture in the actual store and this is because the drive thru is so convenient when toting around 2 kids. I love that there is finally a Starbucks in the Century 3 area. My drinks are always good. The line for drive thru can be long and it is kind of weird driving all the way around the building twice jus to order, pay and leave but it's worth it. He employees are always very friendly and helpful over the intercom to order.
name: Starbucks

name: Starbucks

text:
Ended up going to this particular one since we were waiting to pick up my brother's girlfriend from UNLV, so we decided to chill there.

My boyfriend and I just ordered a large fries and one of the Happy Meal toys as well as two ice coffees. The food and drinks are the same as any typical stuff you would get at any other location. 

There was free Wi-Fi, but it was super slow, so I ended up switching back to using my data on my phone. 

Their play area was closed due to repairs needing to be made, but somehow two kids were able to slip through the doors leading to the play area and started using the equipment for their amusement. The staff should have seriously made sure those doors were locked or there could have been a lawsuit if the kids got hurt.

I've never had this really bad food at any MCDonalds....Management needs to Retrain their Employees.

text:
I like to consider myself a healthy eater, but like most people, I give in to my junk food cravings. Who can resist those delicious, hot and perfectly salted McDonald's fries? 

Here's my 2 cents about this location. It's not in a good area of town, so there may be some transients hanging around. The drive thru moves at a snail's pace, even with only a few cars ahead of me. There have also been a few times where I've received old and soggy french fries or hash browns. 

Otherwise, everything else is fine. I haven't encountered any rude employees and the one time I've been inside, the restaurant was clean. I don't really order anything else off the menu except for my occasional chicken nugget Happy Meal or a sausage breakfast biscuit. Those have been up to par as well. This location is located conveniently close to my work, so I'm sure I'll be back whenever my fast food craving strikes again.

name: Starbucks

text: One star because the drinks are good. However, the service here is terrible. When they released their chorizo sandwiches, I asked the barista (in the drive thru) what kind of meat was in the chorizo. He replied with "uhh chorizo?" Like I was the biggest idiot. I said "like is it pork or beef or what?" And he simply replied "pork." No apology for the attitude. I then went there a couple of days later and asked for an iced caramel macchiato with coconut milk to the second line (they fill it up to the third), she rudely replies with "To the third line?" With the worst sarcasm and attitude in her voice. I cannot clearly write how bad their attitudes were but they were unacceptable. I will not be going back to this Starbucks.
name: Starbucks

text: DONT LEAVE THE DRIVE THRU BEFORE CHECKING YOUR DRINK!!!!!  I order a Hot Venti white Chocolate Mocha and not all the time but most of it. Is  just half of the drink and the rest is just whipped cream. When you go back to tell them they give you a look  like your just trying to get a Free drink. JUST MAKE IT RIGHT THE FIRST TIME.
name: Starbucks

text:
Convenient location and great service.  The place is clean and inviting.

My barista CC, made a small error with my order, probably because I have a thick accent when I speak English.   She was very sweet when she corrected the error.

Thank you CC!
name: Starbucks

text: This is probably the only Starbucks that I go to. It's in a convenient location and the employees are always great! I'm usually there around 5am and even that early, they are still enthusiastic!They even wake me up! I'm also a college student, so I have spent some time inside as well doing homework. This Starbucks is a great location thanks to the employees!
name: Starbucks

text: Cody and his associates are wonderful. They remember me, every time they know what I want, always friendly with smiles on their faces. Suggesting all the latest drinks, offering to supply another if I don't like the newest creation. I am very lucky to work next door to such a lovely Starbucks. I am not the most friendly person before my coffee, but they take care of me and set me up for an amazing day at work. Thanks guys. Much love.
name: Starbucks

text: I've come to this Starbucks more times than I could possibly count. It's the best in the city - with the most awesome baristas and the manager there, Dina, is INCREDIBLE. I've been to a great number of other Starbucks (not just here in Las Vegas, but in California as well), and I've NEVER seen another one this well managed and organized, always clean, well stocked, and FAST! There are times when my drink is waiting for me before I even get to the counter. Get that? FAST!! And, the people ('partners') are all so genuinely kind and conscientious, words can't even describe. Clearly, this is all the result of both incredibly intelligent hiring practices and awesome training. Which again, I'd have to only be able to attribute to the manager here, whose name is Dina, and she most certainly does deserve personal mention. She also is always very friendly and makes sure that not just mine, but all the orders going out, are done quickly and correctly. My orders have always been just that - perfect! I am very grateful that I found and can frequent this fantastic Starbucks store. Again...it's the best I've ever patronized. I can't imagine that it gets any better. In fact, I'd give it 10 stars, but Yelp only allows 5. Most definitely a FIVE STAR Starbucks!!
name: Starbucks

text: I don't frequent Starbucks as often as my wife, but I have never had a a rude associate or bad service. Unfortunately, Michele was the exception to this. When I asked for my first drink I did not get any response. After about 45 seconds or so, I simply replied, "hello?" She came back at me with, " I heard you! I asked if you want whipped cream!" in a rude tone. I told her no thank you and the speaker must be broken because no noise came from it before. She told me it was the car wash next door. That fine, but literally no noise came out of the speaker and she repeated it was the car wash next door. She proceeded to be rude the rest of the visit and when asked what granita flavors they have, she responded with, "all of them" in a sharp tone. I understand everyone has a bad day or has miscommunication, but maybe don't take it out on the customer? The funniest part is that after being rude the whole trip, she kindly gave me my drinks in a cheerful way and told me it was Yelp day and to leave them a great review, so I am leaving one. Sorry, but 10 seconds of good interaction doesn't change a bad visit.
name: Starbucks

text:
This used to be my favorite Starbucks but now it's like they can't seem to figure out how to take an order, slowly explained to them. We get the same drinks every single time at every single store, usually twice a day at the same stores. It comes out to the same price every single time at every single store , so I don't know why we have to argue the price every single time. Last week my fiance got so mad he just left without the coffee because the manager/kid was so rude. 
 
Today, my drink had so much ice in it, I couldn't even get the straw in! I'm pretty sure the manager / kid recognized my fiance and that's why I had so much ice in there. I know for a fact that if you use the appropriate scoop for each size drink, that's not an issue. I worked at Starbucks for four years, I have no idea why it's so difficult for these stores in Vegas to have some consistency!! Really sad. And the so -called manager at this store needs a serious attitude adjustment.
name: Starbucks

text:
Awful. Waited in lobby for 12 minutes for 2 drinks and was second in line. Meanwhile, 6 cars went through the drive thru. I asked who was making the drinks inside and the 2 gals were very rude and said that its first come first serve. I call BS. I saw the car I would have been behind go through 4 cars ago. Side note, the people who ordered before me were all done with their food items before their 2 white mochas even arrived. To say they were also frustrated would be an understatement. 
I will also be emailing corporate this afternoon regarding their attitudes. Never been treated like this in a Starbucks.
name: Starbucks

text:
The reason for the five star is the staff, all except the Manager that is. Cyndi and Brodrick are just amazing people and are always helpful and friendly. The coffee is always perfect and if it's not I just let them know and it gets fixed. Everyone is always very fast and just simply put this is one of the best locations I've been to! Now for the bad. *insert dramatic music* I visit this location alone at least three times a week and always spend at least 15$ so when I ask for no water in my cold brew that doesn't mean put extra ice... Why do you have to try and skimp on your iced coffee! I could just ask you to remake it but I'm not like that... I know you are the Manager for the Cheyenne and MLK Starbucks and you are trying to save that extra 2 ounces possibly to cut back on cost, make sure you have enough for the other customers, or maybe even just because you've never seen me in that store and you think I wouldn't notice. I pay 4-5$ for some coffee that I could easily make at home I sort of expect it to be made right. Very sorry for the small rant but all your other baristas make my drinks the right way why can't you when you are Manager. 
PS I love Yelp an Facebook reviews because they usually get noticed. #Starbucks
name: Starbucks

text: This is hands down my favorite Starbucks in town! I use the drive thru service at least twice a week and the baristas are always cheerful and always get my order right!
name: Starbucks

text:
The new tea infusions are fire emoji times 10!! 













Try the new pineapple black tea infusion!
name: Starbucks

text: This location gets my order right and in a timely manner about 98% of the time. That's enough for me to always come back to this specific location. Customer service is also excellent.
name: Starbucks

text: The staff at this Starbucks are always extremely friendly and courteous!  The manager (Bryan) is always the first to say Hi when somebody comes in.  This is by FAR the best service I have ever had at a Starbucks!
name: Starbucks

text:
If I could rate them without any Stars I truly would! 

The customer service at this particular location is absolutely terrible and I would know given that it's also my line of work! I've been in customer service for 18 years and going and the employees at this location just don't have it in them which is quite sad! 

There has been numerous upon numerous times that my order would not only be given to me with having to wait anywhere between 20-35 minutes but it would always be made wrong with the exception of my oatmeal which only needs to have water added to it. 

Before I go on, Yes! I can go to another location but this specific one happens to be the only one convenient enough for my morning route. 
I could've submitted this entry long time ago but I stopped getting Starbucks for a little while. Today of all days makes it my first visit within the past 3 weeks and today did it for me. 

I normally go through the drive thru however I decided to go inside instead in hopes that my experience would be better in which wasn't. 
After placing my order I attempted to pay for my items with my Starbucks app but when I was handing my phone to the cashier he just stared at me with a confused look on his face. He proceeded to ask his fellow coworker for help and when she arrived she looked at me with a puzzled look as well which made me feel awkward so I asked, 'is there something wrong?' and she then pointed to a scanning device and said 'that's where you're suppose to scan it!'. I then apologized and said 'I haven't come into your location, I normally just go through your drive thru so I'm sorry I didn't know.' and she just walked away. 

The gentleman who originally helped me then asked if I needed anything else and I asked if they wouldn't mind breaking a $50 bill for me. The gentleman looked at his coworker (the same one who helped him) and asked if he had enough in his register to change my bill and she began to tell him that he did but I would need to buy something. I said, 'Thank you, and handed them 2 chocolates that would've cost $1.80 for both and she then looked at me and said, 'You are going to need to buy more than that!'. I'm not going to lie, I chuckled because I'm thinking to myself - you just said that he had enough money in his drawer to change it and if he didn't, a simple 'No' would've sufficed! 
To bring humor into the situation I asked, 'How much exactly did you want me to spend when all I am looking for is change that you said he had enough for?!' and she said 'More than that!'. 

I began to laugh and said, 'Never mind, thanks anyway!' and moved to the other side to wait for my drink. 
When they handed it to me, I thanked them for it and normally with great customer service; you thank the customer and invite them to come back in which the barista who handed it to me did no such thing. All he did was walk away! 

The biggest problem about this entire occurrence which is my fault is that I failed to get their names which will not be a problem for me to retrieve. Getting their names will be the last and only reason why I'll be paying this Starbucks location on Cheyenne & MLK a visit once more!
name: Starbucks

text: Always friendly service.  I appreciate the personal connection the staff makes with me when picking up my venti latte every morning.
name: Starbucks

text: I went to this location today and waited sn excessive amount of time in the drive thru.  They couldn'tgget the drink right and when I requested extra mocha drizzle, the Barista, and I use that term loosely with this individual, said she'd never heardof extra and was going to have to charge me extra.  I let her know that I wouldn't be back.  She was tacky and not the sharpest knife in the drawer.  I love the one off Camino Al Norte because my favorite Barista is there and the majority of thd employees know me.
name: Starbucks

text: It's always a pleasure coming by this location for my morning coffee!! The staff is always courteous and can probably make the grumpiest of morning people have a smile on their face.
name: Starbucks

text: Starbucks, this location is great. Clean and inviting providing great customer service and great drinks consistently.
name: Starbucks

text:
Since the change in management at this particular Starbucks, I wouldn't consider going here again - ever. It's over-run by ghetto people and panhandlers, and a couple of the "partners" there I wouldn't trust to make me a glass of water. Best advise I could offer: go elsewhere! Anywhere else, in fact. Since the management change, this is not a Starbucks I'd ever go to again. Actually, I'd avoid any of the Starbucks stores under the present District Manager's jurisdiction (her name's 'Mitzie', I believe). She's some flunky from the Coffee Bean Co. who is striking out severely as she attempts to step up to Starbucks' level. Ain't happening - so, avoid the area, basically! Wow. Sad this one went down in flames so terribly. It was a very good place  at one time....
NO MORE!!
name: Starbucks

text: The lady at the drive Thur was rude ..i normally go and always ask if they can split my venti drink for my kids into 3cups.(which everyone has always done for me) she said no they couldnt do that..she said she can give me the cups and I can do it myself.. What would have been the difference for her to do it for me?! At the end she didn't even give me my cups.. She needs to learn customer service because obviously she has None!!
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks is on my way to work.  I have been late twice because I was stuck in the drive thru for 20 minutes.  The first time I mentioned it to the cashier and she looked at me and said well we are busy. No I am sorry you had to wait she could care less.  The 2nd experience I had one car in front of me, 15 minutes.  Not acceptable. They are not staffed to handle the customers. I decided I would give them another try, same story.  I will not ever go to this store. I get much better service at Camino Al Norte or the corner of Craig and Losee.  Why is it these other stores can get you thru the drive thru with 6 or 8 cars in front of you in less than 8 minutes? Maybe they need new management,
name: Starbucks

text: Some of the employees are really awesome. There is a really nice red head, and a nice asian guy who I think is the manager, and a few baristas that are nice.. but I tell you what, the inconsistency of the drinks is appalling.
name: Starbucks

text:
They are great! Everyone in the drive thru is friendly,  This location is busy busy busy as well. I am a fan of the Raspberry Pomegrante canned refreshers and it has been frustrating that they never seem to have them. But a few evenings ago when I drove through for coffee and requested them again, they said that while they hadn't really carried them but that they would have some ordered. I'm hoping on my next visit through that I'll find they made good on that. "If you build it, they will come" really is a truism. If you order them....I will purchase them!!!!

Pumpkin spice lattes rule the day and they make them great!
name: Starbucks

text: Literally the worst drive through service ever. The lady who was taking my order was so rude. I asked her one simple question to clarify & she literally gave me the meanest response. Chill out. It doesn't matter what position you are, treat people with some respect.
name: Starbucks

text: Thank you Bri for hooking me all the way up with my specialty ice chai drink, assuring me the almond milk verses fat free milk would satisfy my crave and is a better fit for the drink.
name: Starbucks

text: I recently moved to this side of town, my old stomping ground was Cliff Shadows Starbucks. The drive-thru is always quick, I can order 4 drinks and they will be ready by the time I get to the window. EVERYONE is really friendly and I have been there almost everyday since we have moved ! Thank you to my new baristas at this location!
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks has always been my go to and everyone has always been very friendly but the girl (pixie short haircut) that made my coffee today had a very bad attitude and was very rude, she got mad and complained to her co workers how she had to remake my coffee w/o any creamer in it because they asked me at the window if I wanted creamer in the coffee or on the side (I said on the side) so the barista started complaining to her co workers as she threw the coffee she already made away . I would've gladly taken it if they would've simply communicated w me about how it was already made. I felt very offended on how she was complaining about me to her co workers as if I'm not watching or hearing everything she's saying or doing. It was not a big deal to me if the cream was in the coffee or not . And they didn't ask me when I was ordering they asked me at the window. The young lady that was taking my order was very friendly but that barista needs a real attitude adjustment.
name: Starbucks

text:
I actually work in the hair and nail shop in the same shopping center and the entire shop visit this location daily. I went to the drive thru this morning and ordered A Venti White chocolate mocha ,customer service at the window  was great , 
then I get to the shop to see that it's half empty. I walk back to to Starbucks to show  them what was given to me, I believe it was the manager Asian decent bald guy was not nice at all in fact he questioned me as if I was lying with no apology he walks off(like I went around the corner and took a big gulp out of this hot coffee and brought it back like look) his employee had to actually step in and help me which he was awesome. The manager however showed very poor customer service and should be reevaluated..very upset about how I was treated by that manager
name: Starbucks

text: Thanks Bri for hooking me all the way up with my specialty ice Chai drink. You assured me that the almond milk would not only satisfy my crave but definite is a better fit for my drink. Yum!

text: I was handed the wrong sandwich and drink then I was asked to pull forward and wait, I didn't realize that Starbucks started practicing acts like McDonald's. 6.00 for a coffee don't ask me to pull up because you don't have your act together.

text:
Love going to this Starbucks drive thru, probably the most visited Starbucks in Vegas. If you don't like your coffee too sweet and iced coffee, I recently tried their blonde ice americano with cream and sugar, delicious! 

Fast and friendly service :)

text: I usually go to this Starbucks. It is always clean and the staff is friendly.  What push them to  5 stars are they are very accommodating.  My app wasn't working correctly and they still gave me my drink.  How embarrassing on my part.  I appreciate this in any business.  Thank you.
name: Starbucks

text: Seriously understaffed took forever to get 3 simple drinks , so that you know I'm not exaggerating the car in back of us honked at us . Not to mention they forgot the heat protectors on the hot drinks ....ouch

text: The managers at this store are the worst. There's a female named Cindy who is really ugly to her employees. name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text: I've been coming to this Chipotle location for over 3 years and I'm still in love with their food! In my opinion Chipotle's food has more flavor than Moe's, Qdoba's, & Salsarita's food (Even though Qdoba comes in a close second). You can choose from a bowl, burrito, salad, quesadilla, or tacos. They have kids meals as well that are quite big. The chips are crispy and perfectly finished with a squeeze of lime and sea salt. The salsas and guacamole are divine as well! Most of the staff are kind and helpful but there is a good handful of staff members that are rude and unprofessional. Overall, I will continue to come to this Chipotle location because of their flavorful food!

text:
I'm just always happy after eating here I mean I love Mexican ya know anything so a place I can go in and get fresh all natural ingredients for a burrito/salad/bowl is always a win in my book. I must say I do prefer this place over moes or qdoba as the ingredients always seem to be a notch above in flavor and quality.  I adore their honey jalapeno vinaigrette on their salads and I cannot guarantee that I have that salad dressing name right all I know is that its delicious and when they ask if I want it I say heck yeah.  I think my only complaint is that its a bit pricey and nothing comes with chips and I don't know what kind of salt they use on their chips but I'm addicted so yes I'm upset that chips don't come with my meal but yes I will still pay for them :/ 

This particular location is my favorite as the service is always super fast and friendly and parking is always easy.

text: If you like cold food, terrible service, a disgustingly dirty restaurant and ridiculously long waits than this is the place for you! Came in to to eat today around 3pm. After the staff wants to give us an attitude (like its my fault they suck) I can't even find a damn table to sit at because every single one is dirty. Floor looks like it hasn't been swept in over a week. Best part to top it all off? I bite into a chip that's so stale it barely crunches. Last time I ever waste my money at this location. From now on I will drive the extra 15 minutes to go to stonecrest because their store makes this one look like a joke.

text: We are here over the weekend for a late lunch and I've got to say this place is the pits.  The food was cold but the service was even worse and incompetent.  I have a large family but when I order 3 kids quesadilla meals and I get just one quesadilla,  there's a problem.  When you make me go back through the long lines because your servers take forever to make a burrito, to correct YOUR error, that's an even bigger problem.   To top it off, I used a gift card to help pay the balance and your worker didn't apply the balance of the card and simply threw it away.  This place was great when it first opened but today, it's a dump.  The bathrooms were disgusting, the seating area was messy and your staff are rude.  I will never go back here again.

text:
I will always give these Golden Arches four stars:)  
Mcnuggets, fries and that classic bbq sauce.  
Indeed I dip both into that succulent barbecue sauce, one of my favorites since I was a kid.  
Nope, never cared for the McRib.  
Don't know it, google please;)
Now, the Happy Meal.  Yes, enjoyed them or actually the toys probably more so and I still collect those Happy Meal toys. I admit it.  Now, you can have apple slices in lieu of fries.  Hell, I order both.  
There, that's it the whole truth.  
They have chicken tenders now, yes I know I can hear the comments regarding the McNuggets. I don't have them on a regular or daily basis, but I still enjoy them:)
I never stray and have a Big Max or anything, Happy Meal with a four piece McNugget and I make sure I collect that toy;)

name: McDonald's

text:
Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 - #25/100

I only eat McDonald's when I'm in Vegas and at this very particular one. Not because its over the top, sound the gong good. Not by a long shot. I go here because it's quite accessible when we're checked in at Stratosphere.

Back in the day before the stories of the pink sludge, I could down a 20 piece McNugget meal without breaking a sweat. Nowadays, I only like the sausage, egg, and cheese McGriddles. Syrup already in the pancakes that serve as the buns, juicy sausage patty, fluffy eggs, and melted American cheese. Want to boost the flavor some more? Try strawberry jam or hot sauce or both if you're weird like me. 

Customer service was always fast and efficient. Last time they gave us bacon, egg and cheese McGriddle though for one of our orders. No biggie it was still good. Can't say the same about the person in front of me for the visit on Sunday. He was pissed because the lid on his breakfast tray wasn't closed right that the Canadian bacon decided to jump ship and landed in the plastic bag with all the utensils and napkins. Whoops! The employee calmly replaced his meal but the damage was done. The customer was inconsolable and wasn't too shy to let them know his displeasure. There was a line of customers forming too. My order was finally announced and I couldn't wait to get outta there. This time our order was perfect.

text: I ordered from this McDonalds and I wish I didn't. When my order number was called, I went to pick it up and take it to my table. After taking the contents out, I realized it was the wrong order and brought it back. The manager herself was in denial that her and her staff didn't make a mistake and said "If that is not your food, why would you take it?!" I took it because my order number was called and I took it to the table ready to eat. The manager didn't bother to listen to me and rather insisted on helping other guests as well as ignore me. I was trying to explain to her that I wouldn't bother to take food that wasn't mine, had I known. She was very rude, scoffed, and walked away. She didn't give me my receipt, said they don't do refunds (at this point I didn't want the food), and wouldn't bother to give me her name after we called back. For someone who is considered the manager, she sure should learn better customer service. I hope she gets taught a lesson or two since she considers herself a "manager."

text: Their fries are about a dollar more than the BK at 59th and Thunderbird. 1 large fry was $3.46 (give or take a nickel). And then they don't fill it all the way, even though they're giving out stale, old, tear-with-your-teeth fries. And when you go back in to say "uhhh..." they give you more gross, old fries to shut you up. Oh, and you can't do the bk review website thing because the center of the receipt, top to bottom, is missing a lot of digits. So no complete store number/transaction number, etc. I should've known it was bad when it's about 4:30pm on a Monday and only one other person was in the drive thru. I worked fast food for years and management tends to get stuck in their own, gross little world. Dude needs to snap out of it.

text: I had a US Starbucks Gift card that I wasn't able to use them on the Strip as they didn't take them, therefore, used the cards to grab some salads and sandwiches on the plane for my best friend and I. I did the self serve and picked from the fridge, therefore, the transaction at the til was smooth. I did observe, however, the service for coffee for the other patrons being slow especially for people possibly trying to connect or catch other flights at the airport. Service was friendly.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text:
Had they done their due diligence prior to the opening of their FIRST location nationwide, they would have been aware of what USA residents call, the "FREE REFILL."  That's why I visited this location only ONCE, and never will again.

In Australia, it is referred to as the "bottomless cup," and I won't patronize ANY coffee establishment that does NOT offer them.  No wonder they don't have as many customers as they would like!

The coffees, as good as they may taste, are not to be enjoyed by me, ever, unless FREE REFILLS are included in their outrageous/unreasonable prices.

Marie Callendar's sells pastries/desserts similar to theirs, too, and at much more reasonable/lower prices.  I mean, $5 for ONE candy bar?  Give me a break!

They cater to the "Wall Street" & "Beverly Hills" crowds who can afford what they're peddling, and Mr./Mrs. "Joe Average" aren't welcome in their establishment.

Forgive my saying so, but their executives really need to "Wake up and smell the coffee!"

Let me know when you have reasonable prices and FREE REFILLS, and I might again stop by for a visit.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text:
I stopped at this Starbucks just after clearing security in terminal 3. It has become a tradition of mine to get Starbucks every time I take a flight. This one was conveniently located just after security, and I'm flying United Airlines, which is now handled through Terminal 3, even though flights take off out of D gates. This convenience was very nice, considering in Atlanta, I had to take the tram all the way across the airport, and into the international terminal, just for Starbucks. You'd figure they'd be everywhere.

Anyways, as others have said, this location just dosen't measure up, The quality is lacking compared to other locations, but then again, when you're in an airport, past security, what do you expect. They don't have to give you the best, you're trapped, and are going to take what you can get, but you should be prepared for that, not just at Starbucks, but everything in the airport. My Carmel Frappuccino, wasn't horrible, but I've had much better. I wonder if it was rushed because they were busy, and it affected quality. I guess I'll have to give them another try the next time I fly out, they're not exactly right down the street.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text: Worse customer service ever and made me the wrong drink. Rather throw the $6 drink away than deal with them again!!!
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text: This place was slow and rude.  Obviously there's always a long line because Starbucks is popular, but these people weren't in a hurry to service anyone.  Didn't mind the long line because we had time before our flight, so we waited for about 15-20 minutes.  We placed our order and then waited another 10 minutes for it.  My husband told the lady repeatedly that he didn't need the lid.  She placed it on there anyways.  He took it off and placed it on the counter and told her again that he didn't need the lid.  We start to walk away when she came from behind the counter and started yelling at my husband that he was rude for leaving the lid on the counter.  She yelled at him in front of all the customers.  Then proceeded to yell that people aren't his servant.  This infuriated me that not only is she the one being rude, but that there's also still a long line of customers and she ignores all of them to come and make ignorant statements.  My husband ignores her but I told her to shut the hell up.  That girl was very unprofessional and also ridiculous to stop serving people over a lid.  I still like Starbucks but this location is horrible.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text: Ordered a toasted coconut cold brew, sweetened. Heard the cashier say to the barista while writing the cup, "It's already sweet enough". No sweetener added.  The cold brew tasted almost soapy. Only upside being that it was quick. Condiment bar was neglected as well.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text: Slowest service ever.  Very small store in terminal with lines that block traffic flow.  This is an airport and people have to make flights. Hello?
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text:
While waiting for our flight, the boys went for a caffeine run. They stopped by Starbucks on Saturday, May 13th around 3:15pm.

I actually didn't ask for a coffee, but one of them was sweet enough to grab me a triple espresso. I'm a coffee purist, so this was the perfect drink for me. No milk, no sugar. (Though sometimes, I do like a machiatto as I don't mind a touch of foam.) I'm not a huge Starbucks fan as I find their espresso weak, but this did the trick as I needed a pick me up. That last day in Vegas was slightly painful.

Convenient if you're in Terminal 3. We took Virgin America out, so this location was close to our gate.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text:
While waiting to catch my flight home on Hawaiian Airlines, I was lucky enough to find this little Starbucks Coffee joint in Terminal 3, near gate 35 (the gate I was flying out on).

I gotta say, when you need a little "pick me up"........... a hot cup of Joe is the perfect item to have when your feeling a little bogged down from not getting enough sleep. 

Besides hot coffee, Starbucks also sells an array of other drinks like - teas, blended drinks, smoothies, and cold bottled drinks. 

Hungry?  

They do sell snacks, and sandwiches so there are other options should you be a little hungry while you are on the go in the airport.

While I stopped here this past week to get some coffee, I was kind of surprised at how reasonable a cup of coffee was at this store in the airport. 

I got two small cups of coffee for just $5.82 (with tax) which comes out to just $2.91 per cup of coffee..........I gotta say it's a pretty good deal considering the convenience factor of buying coffee at the airport.
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text:
Not busy. Location is right in front of the security gates. 
Nice to be able to chill if your pick up is running late or you show early. 
Ladies were polite and coffee was Starbucks quality. 
Airport price so abit above average. 
For it being 12:15pm their food selection was full. 
Just remember you can't take drinks through security. You can food!
address: 5757 Paradise Rd., LAS Term 3, Concourse D Rotunda, MacCarran Airport Term  3
name: Starbucks

text: I spoke to one of owners Shane, this morning who refused to cancel my credit card transaction that I submitted to through the website and the one closest to me was not listed so the order went to the wrong one. I was told to contact Subway immediately and you can only email so I did. I also called the store and they said to call back in 10 minutes to have a chance to ask the "manager's manager." I did and they said to come in within 24 hours and she (the I store manager) will refund it. I get an email the next day from Subway saying it is up to the store and I also get a call from Shane who says they threw out the sandwich and got charged to run my card so they would lose money so they cannot refund it. He said they called 45 mins after it was made to see if I was picking it up which they did not. I told him now I have to dispute it through my credit card company In 4 days if it posts. If I was on this side of town I'd rather go to Jersey Mikes with fresh sliced meat, cheese, and AMAZING bread (it is across the street near Teharu sushi (and inexpensive) which is also very good).

text:
Ok so the first time I went to this location all their meats and food in the hot case looked old and not rotated it was disgusting. 

I walked out. 

Tonight I was craving Chipotle it's the worst fast food I can buy for myself.  Well I get my bowl because the food looked edible. 

I order chips and guacamole. I get home ... no guacamole 


I'm literally the only person ordering food. I'm literally the only person In line. 

I call and the girl says do you want to speak to a manager and I say sure. 

I speak to ericka and Eticka says you can come in and get your guacamole next time ..... ok so no chips just the guacamole. So sh wants to put me in the same situation I am in now ? 

So I ask for the name of the GM then she proceeds to say I can have a complimentary meal next time I go to their store.  

She says "just say you spoke to ericka ". So she doesn't ask my name. Basically this p rain has ZERO business putting the word manager alongside her name. 

Look Ericka you wanna be manager.  I don't want food replaced I just want what I paid for replaced that's not edible because I don't have it's counter partner to enjoy them with. 

Holy moly listen to your customers. Speak to them Not at them. If you are just the on shift manager then explain that. I understand not everyone knows how to de-escalate a situation or problem solve. 

Quit hiring subpar people to deal with food and customer service period who do not want to be bothered by having accountability for their own mistakes. 

At least hire people with common problem solving sense or an understanding of how to amend their errors. I dislike wasting my time. I dislike wasting my money period. And I've wasted my time twice here. 

Once by going there and then twice by having to endure an idiotic conversation That left me just as ousted with ericka the manager

text:
I spoke to the cashier about my bill.  She didn't do what I would have done if I was in her position working in the food industry.  It was a technicality for over charging me.  It doesn't even come out of the store, it's Chipotle company deals for members.   I came in today, because I wanted to use my BOGO before it expires.  I also have been waiting to try out the online order.  I normally order in person two entrees with guacamole on the side with the meals.  When I did the order online, it asks me if I wanted my guacamole on the side, I clicked on it.  When I came into the store, I noticed I was charged a little more with my BOGO.  It wasn't half the bill.  She charged me for 2 entrees with two side orders of guacamole instead of guacamole within my entree.  When I look online on my order receipt, it's shown the guacamole is within the entree not a side order.  I told her that, she said I can't order like that.  Next time order with the guacamole and side note to type there I want it on the side.  I told here there isn't a section to do that.  She kept telling me there is one.  I can't be crazy....I just checked before writing this review... there isn't a section for that.  All of this for $1.95 guacamole.  I told her ok whatever.  It's a simple fix, it's a technicality charge.  What pissed me off even more, when I got home, one of my entree was missing cheese.... I would say the communication with the online order is not good experience.  I was overcharged more  for technicality and my order isn't correct.  Good thing, she checked the order again before handing it to me, because there was a missing guacamole.  

That's one.... now a week ago I was here again.  I came in with no one in front of me ordering.  But right after I ordered one burrito and a bowl, the line started to build up.  I can tell the server started to get irritated while she was doing me order.  It was the fajita veggies on both entrees that got me.  It was old looking and empty, the girl literally grabbed one bell pepper and 3 onion stings for the burrito and the same for the bowl.  I even asked her can I have a little more and she just added 2 onion stings... can't she just grab a fresh one?  Then she turned around and yelled at her coworkers, "I need help!"  Every ingredients they had were low, they made my two entrees really light than usual, I didn't bother to keep asking for more for every ingredient.  

I'm going to go to the other location on Rainbow to try it out.  It's too bad that this location is convenience because it's by our mailbox.  But you go where it makes you happy.

text: I have been a loyal fan of Chipotle for many years. I am a vegetarian and their food suits my needs for what I like to eat and the fact that I am able to choose what I can put in my order.When they started having difficulties with their food safety numerous times I even continued to be a loyal customer. However the last few times I have been there have not been a good experience or value. I generally have rice, no beans, vegetables and lettuce. When I asked for extra white rice I was told that they were only allowed three scoops and that was it, when I asked for extra lettuce (one of the cheapest items of the selections), they gave me a very small handful. I had to come home and cut up my own lettuce! I was treated rudely when I asked for extra vegetables, because that's all I eat. I was not allowed to have a tortilla on the side as I usually am. My vegetable Bowl costs within a few cents the same as a bowl full of meat and high-cost items. My daughter-in-law ordered a baracoba bowl and and the meat was all fat. I'm having a very hard time to continuing to be a loyal customer to Chipotle when there's no value in my food choices  anymore. I hope they fix this the right way , instead of hitting the customer in the food quantities and in the pocketbook. it's not a good way to keep your customers coming back.

text: As far as chipotles go, this is a good one.   The staff is friendly and the place is clean.  I think their burritos are tasty.   They always make them pretty fat and the food seems to be fresh to me.  There is always a respectable amount of meat in the burrito and you get a nice bang for your buck.   Does it feel like authentic Mexican food.... No, but it's very good and they load it up with whatever you want in it.   They charge you extra for guac, but I think most people know that comes with the territory.

text:
I wish I remembered this gentleman's name. I went back to this Chipotle in the day time as both my evening experiences were horrid. 

My daughter and I made our order. I ordered guac and chips and I said to the gentleman "please please make sure I get my guac, the last time they forgot it and I raged and Ericka was no help" 

He said "Ma'am I'm going to take care of that right now for you " and he didn't charge me for the guac and Chips. 

I told him I did not need it for free I just wanted to make sure I got it.  He said here is one for this order and here is another for the one you missed last time. 

And you know what he didn't get the 5 star review because he gave me free guac n chips. 

He got the 5 star review for Chipotle because he understood why I was upset he acknowledged it with the "oooh she is still mad about that guac missing " 

And I was. And he saw right through it and handled it by making us laugh, feel comfortable and then accommodating me. 

It was excellent management skills. I'm going go to Chipotle tomorrow just to get his name. 

And he never once made me feel like I did something wrong. Or that I should have to do something extra to get what I was ousted on. Thanks kind sir

text:
I've eaten at Chipotle all over the USA and love it.  However, I've had two occasions now when I've ended up with stomach pain, cramps, diarrhea, intestinal pain, and general not feeling well. I ate at this location 9-1-17 and had severe cramps that night in addition to the aforementioned symptoms.  I am in great health normally and rarely have issues.  I had not eaten out anywhere else.  The person I was there with did not have any issues, but she did not have the salsa (I had mild and medium) nor did she have rice and beans, which I did. Three days later I'm still in pain.  I'm not saying Chipotle was the cause 100%, but most likely, in my opinion. I am wondering if anyone else has had this issue there.

Overall, they've been great. However, they're still burning the Chorizo.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
Small parking lot, so there is an illusion of being busy, but this one seems to be one of the ones 'less traveled' (just a few customers, noticed more "to-go" orders). We've been here a couple of times, and both times were really good. The front counter area is well-organized and fully stocked with items (chips, boxes, catering supplies). Chipotle is pretty much a staple for our family, and we usually visit a couple weekends a month. If we miss it, my hubby gets withdrawals. Yes, really.

The food trays were filled halfway or more (a good sign, more fresh). More food prep and cooking was under way (sizzling, mmm). The staff is nice. This is a clean restaurant overall. Music is playing (twice, one type for the customers, one type for the employees making the food). We've chosen the same booth for both past visits, near the counter. This location is sort of bare-bones (but that's ok) with overall decor, not much is hanging on the walls. Most locations are industrial- feeling with exposed pipe type ceilings, a mix of metal and unfinished natural wood (the one @ Decatur/Sahara is a good representation of most restaurants in this chain). 

My favorite bowl is composed of: white rice, either Chorizo or Chicken, depending on my mood, black beans, fajita veggies, corn, some cheese, some sour cream, and lettuce. I used to get salsa but I split the bowl with my son, and he said it was "too hot." Sometimes, I get it on the side. I was just thinking that my son must be growing up because he hasn't been saying "Mum-mum" which is his code phrase for "More, please." But I heard it yesterday, so, it was a highlight, to hear it. He loves Chipotle. Once he hears we're going, he thinks we're going right then and there. It is a joy when our picky eater can eat something with such ferocity and enthusiasm.  

Also does online ordering and catering. I'm trying to figure which one will be our go-to in our new area, so this could be the one. It's a good thing, it's not super busy.

I checked my mail and low and behold a coupon for a FREE burrito or tacos! YES PLEASE! I came on down and was excited to eat whatever literally. The staff were all pleasant to work with I was greeted immediately and helped very quickly! The problem I usually have with Chipotle is the small portions of meat they try to put on your food. Well without asking I was served with a decent amount of the barbacoa on my burrito and the rest of the items to follow weren't lacking! No complaints at all! If I was a serious chipotle person I wouldn't mind coming back to this exact location!

Less rice, less meat/chicken etc.  Even the weight of a bag of chips has declined. You must ask for a knife, salt, bottled hot sauce.  Clear signs of desperation.

Our return visits are becoming less frequent.  You're doing it to yourselves Chipotle.

text: I wish I could give negative stars! Horrible service. September has a special that kids eat free on Sundays. We were there because my nephew wanted to eat chipotle for his birthday today. We ordered one for our child that was in her stroller and was being watched by my mother-in-law.  The lady said we needed to be charged for the kids meal because we didn't have the child with us. Then they had the nerve to speak to each other in Spanish about the kids meal ordeal. Just because I'm of different ethnicity, don't assume we can't speak Spanish and don't talk s*** in front of customers in a different language. As we were at the register they informed us that we had to pay for the kids meal. We showed the child and asked if there was a issue, they told us no and said that the kids meal is normally for older children, granted the child was a little over 1. I don't see anything wrong with feeding mashed beans to a 1 year old. Also I didn't see that there was a stipulation to the age of a child to qualify for a kids meal. After we settled that issue, the guy at the register came up to us and stated our card was declined so we showed our receipt and cleared up that issue. I observed if he was going to ask the customers before and after us but he didn't. Very rude and very unprofessional. I don't know how this restaurant is ran but it clearly needs its staff to be retrained or let go. This our first and last time coming to this location. Very disappointing.

text:
My first time eating here! And I am very impressed! What a delicious burrito. Love how they make it right in front of you, and its so big and juicy! Very cool spot for sure! Nice employees and super clean.

Now, I have to write this only because it was a bit disturbing...Me and my sister probably were there for about an hour eating, talking and having a good time...in the time we were there we witnessed at least three homeless people come in and fill up their mugs or whatever container they had with the soda machine, use the restroom facilities and casually walk out without paying. Ok, I understand its hot outside and they are thirsty, but when you are a paying customer its a little disturbing to see this happening as you're eating. We even told an employee, and they said, its ok, we know they are doing it and they dont mind. Im sure the owner would mind! 

Anyway, still an awesome burrito and yes I am a FAN!

text:
After the chipotle scare in Oregon, we were not looking forward to coming but we did. It food is the same, hot, fresh, but it seems like the customer service takes a back seat to the food. I hope the employees don't think that because they can't make a mistake on the food 98% of he time that they can't be friendly and polite. 
They wrapped all our food to go, but if they were to ask us hey would of known it was for here. We got a burrito and a bowl, both were good but when they places my husbands burrito in the bag, all the juice and heavy parts few to the left side of his burrito, so now that they wrapped it evenly, it was now pointless because they put it sideways in a bag. I always love chips and guacamole, but why is that ever chipotle I go to, my chips are stale? Do they not make the chips there are bag them each day, not just whenever they run out of bags? Besides that, there was no smile from any of he employees, there was a thank you from the cashier but it was like a thank you and I don't care kind of thank you.

One huge complaint I have is the new queso is terrible.  It's lumpy and not very flavorful.  It has almost like a grainy consistency to it.  I was so excited to see they offer queso but it's a huge fail in my opinion.  Ask for a sample, it's awful.  For a quick bite of Mexican, Chipotle is a great choice.
