I could hear the car in front saying they messed up their order too... and you have to check since you've waited this long.  They were still mixing my drink when we got to the window.
name: Starbucks

text: So I wanted to review this Starbucks especially because it has pretty bad reviews. We came about 40 mins before closing and they didn't have cold brew. Which was very upsetting. The girl was very accommodating and made some suggestions on drinks I could order instead. I got a triple shot decaf macchiato. She then offered to change it if I didn't like it. I normally get this drink but I wanted something not too sweet. They made it perfect and the fact that she wanted to make sure I was happy and satisfied made the biggest difference.
name: Starbucks

text: Worst Starbucks in AZ. They ask for your name but never call it when your drink is ready. My drink was ready for 5 mins. When I found out it was stting there and she was proud to tell me that it was ready 5 minutes ago. Won't be coming back, losers!!
name: Starbucks

text: I usually go to this location out of convenience but i do not recommend it! They always have and extra charge for a drink i get that i never get charged anywhere else. They constantly give me regular milk when i order soy i cannot drink regular otherwise I wouldn't mind but they are super rude about it every time they do that.
name: Starbucks

text: I went through the drive thru expecting it to be fast but it took forever (about 12 minutes) to get my drink and croissant. My order was right but I'm curious to why it took so long. Either the cars in front of me ordered a lot or ordered really complicated orders and kept having them fix it. Who Knows. Otherwise decent Starbucks near school!
name: Starbucks

text: This location is convenient because it's a drive through BUT the service makes it hard to want to come back. The baristas are often rude. The place is d i r t y. The one time I decide to give the drive thru a chance, I'm in the line for 30 minutes on a Sunday afternoon.
name: Starbucks

text: Went there with my boyfriend last night, they refused to serve us because they had already closed the lobby, but yet they didn't even lock the doors!
name: Starbucks

text: 10 minutes for a latte, with only two more cars in front of me?! You've gotta be kidding me!!!
name: Starbucks

text: I love this Starbucks. The staff at this location are always pleasant and prioritize getting your order correctly. Though, they are always packed! I rarely wait in the drive thru for less than 10-15 minutes. When I am in a rush, it can be disappointing, but I have ordered ahead a few times and it's ready by the time I arrive. Really nice location with lots of indoor and outdoor seating!
name: Starbucks

text:
Spiced Sweet Cream Cold Brew - pretty good
Service - good
name: Starbucks

text: I'm going to make this short, if you are running short on time and you see a some what long line on the drive thru, don't go through it! I've gone through the drive thru at least 3 times already and they take at least 15 minutes! The one star is for the coffee since they seem to make it better than other Starbucks locations. That's why I still go to this location.
name: Starbucks

text:
Honestly slow, but nice people at this Starbucks!! 
If you're short on time, do not come here!
name: Starbucks

text: Slowest Starbucks on the planet, like to the point where you just want to give up on life. By the time you realize you're never going to get served, you're boxed in the drive thru and you just have to sit there and suffer.  Then when you reach the window, you get to wait again after receiving your Luke warm greeting.  Why do I come here?!?
name: Starbucks

text:
Came here to get a drink and do some work but internet is terrible. Don't expect to get anything done here.

When I used to live in Phoenix I would always come here to study and work but WiFi was much better back then. I am visiting for the Holidays and wanted to spend some time here to reminisce old times but it's not the same. Service is terrible and they forgot to make 1 of my drinks. It's super loud and noisy and wifi is so bad. I cannot get anything to load. One tip I would give is to be very careful of your belongings here because I have witnessed a laptop being stolen here. Someone just came into the store and grabbed a MacBook and ran out. They called the cops and the MacBook owner even ran after the thief but nobody could catch him.
name: Starbucks

text: Very poorly managed. Each time I have been there, it's been at least a ten minute wait and they aren't that busy. They have to remake drinks frequently. Staff could use more training.
name: Starbucks

text: Caroline rushed us through our order today... so we kept it short and didnt order everything we came for.  Other times we've had good service from the drive thru but the staff hardly looks happy to be here.  At least the drinks are always on point.
name: Starbucks

text: Worst Starbucks I have ever been too. Drinks taste nothing like they are supposed to. Terrible customer service. The other day one of the employees came in after smoking a cigarette, watched her come in, not wash her hands and put a lid on my drink. The whole lid stunk of cigarettes. Another time an employee acted completely rude when I had asked for a green tea and replied saying "we don't have green tea" just because I didn't say "emperor's cloud and mist green tea". Terrible customer service when asking anything at all and I'm never one to care enough to write reviews.
name: Starbucks

text: This is not the same Starbucks I walked into 6 months ago.  I believe they did get a new manager and he obviously knows how customer service should be.  This place has completely changed.  Better customer service.  Less wait time.  Delicious drinks and charged appropriately.  Well done!
name: Starbucks

text:
I love when I can update reviews and add stars! 

I think there might have been a manager change or something, but this Starbucks has improved so much. The service is faster, the employees are nice, and the store is clean.
name: Starbucks

text:
Have been here twice. First time they messed up my order. Second time, my soy latte just had the weirdest after taste. Not sure if it was the beans, if the soy milk was burnt or what it was. Costumer service is also mehhh at best. 

I'm a loyal gold card member and have been for a few years. I've been to better Starbucks locations... I'll avoid this one in the future.
name: Starbucks

text: Worst Starbucks drive-thru ever! 17 min wait ! The orders in front of me were small and simple just like mine I do not understand why it took long!
name: Starbucks

text: Definetively the worst drive thru service of any Starbucks in Phoenix Area !!!! Way too slow and always packed !!!!
name: Starbucks

text: Great service. Staff is always helpful even though they are very busy every time i go in. Coffee is always fresh. Only thing I dislike is the price but that's a corporate concern. Drive thru is always fast. One time I was ordering early in the morning and wasn't awake yet, the lady taking my order guessed my drink and I didn't have to say anymore. That is great service to me. Can't wait to go back.
name: Starbucks

text: Woke up in the mood for some coffee. I decided to go with my cousin through the drive thru. The cashier was very short, no eye contact and in addition didn't have active listening skills. We gave her dollar bills and told her to wait because we had the change ( we didn't want more change ) she ignored us and when she came back we told her we had the change and she said it was too late. Then she gives us our order and she forgets one of our drinks. She doesn't apologize for forgetting our drink. Once she gives us our drink she doesn't say anything to us but hands us our drink. I've gone to plenty of Starbucks and they are usually very friendly , helpful and all around pleasant. I don't appreciate starting my morning off like this when Im on vacation and all I wanted was to enjoy my coffee.
name: Starbucks

text: My grandma and I went to Starbucks for a simple coffee treat. Only to have rude Justin ruin our time. Without a smile he huffed and puffed while taking our order and my grandma made a simple mistake of ordering the wrong thing and even though she OFFERED to pay for it Justin and the other two girl baristas made comments under their breath while one of them slammed the replacement on the table. While Justin slammed everything like the blender and cabinets the whole time he made the drink. Shame on you Justin. You suck and you're pathetic.
name: Starbucks

text: PLEASE change the barista! WORST Starbucks I have ever been to. The girl was extremely rude.
name: Starbucks

text: Waited about 20 min in the drive through and when pulled up to the front to order out me on hold then forgot about me for 5 min. In a hurry don't come to this Starbucks. If you know you're understaffed then should hire more employees.
name: Starbucks

text: Best, fastest, friendliest staff of all the starbucks i go to! I come out of my way to come to this location
name: Starbucks

text: By far the worst Starbucks I've ever been to! I couldn't hear the guy on the speaker and when I was getting ready to order my drink he rudely cuts me off and pretty much yells at me telling me "to hold on" um? Okay. Has me waiting literally like 10 minutes at the speaker to order and after telling him my order three times I said "venti" really loud! And he kept saying "the medium"? I mean....is that what venti is? Get this Justin guy a new job if he doesn't like his current one because there is no reason to be rude to customers just cause you're not liking your job. The ironic part is that at the window there was a sign asking about service and to let them know if they didn't go "above and beyond" so here is my way of letting you guys know you had the worst service of all Starbucks I've been to.
name: Starbucks

text:
Literally just waited in the drive thru 15-20 mins for 1 coffee. Lots of cars in line with me. Never got an apology at least or a coffee on them for next time
 I know things happen but man zero zero zero customer service!  Will never return here
name: Starbucks

text: Came in for an eggnog steamer and the barista tells me "you mean latte?" No I mean steamer, and you know which one the guy gave me? Not what I ordered. #newemployee #knowyourmenu #thecustomerisalwaysright #mondayblues
name: Starbucks

text: Horrible experience and will never go back to this location. Waiting nearly 20 min for your coffee is ridiculous
name: Starbucks

text: By far the SLOWEST Starbucks in the valley. I don't come here often but always wait 20 monutes, even at non peak hours. Currently waiting as I type, took 14 minutes to even order! Two stars for friendly service.
name: Starbucks

text: On my last visit here a girl named Norma was working the drive thru window and was extremely rude. I understand sometimes it's hard not to give a customer an attitude when they're being rude to you, but that was not the case. I work at a coffee shop so when I visit other shops I try to be as kind to the staff as possible. I was astonished by the amount of attitude she gave me when I told her my friends and were paying separately for our drinks, such a simple thing that she was so bothered by. Then she handed me my drinks and one didn't have the lid on right and spilled in my car. She had already walked away so I waited for her to come back so I could ask for napkins and she saw me waiting and kept ignoring me and even though there were cars behind me she had to attend. When she finally came back to the window she just looked at me really annoyed and said nothing until I spoke. I've never taken the to write a review but I was really annoyed by this. Love this shop, just bad experience.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks always takes FOREVER to get you your drinks. Especially in the drive thru.
name: Starbucks

text: For many years, the "Slowest Starbucks in The World" title-holder was held by the store outside of Ft. Leonard Wood (aka Lost in the Woods) but this store has eclipsed them thanks to their ill-trained staff and store's unique ability to attract customers who have never ordered a cup of coffee before.. During my wait counted at least seven people who just walked away.
name: Starbucks

text:
Horrible customer service.
Ghetto attitude to match the ghetto neighborhood it's in. Very dirty with trash and flys everywhere outside.
name: Starbucks

text: This is the slowest drive thru ever! 2 days ago I was waiting in line for 34 minutes, I learned my lesson and never went back, never again.
name: Starbucks

text: It's a little dirty but speed of service has improved. It's the closes coffee shop to my house and it provides a good atmosphere to get homework done. It does the job, nothing extraordinary.
name: Starbucks

text: Oh I completely love Starbucks, can't go a day without it!!!! Every morning I brew my self a cup of coffee lol!, but at this Starbucks workers are super nice even though they are fairy usually busy.. I ordered a cinnamon macchiato it was fabulous
name: Starbucks

text: Friendly staff and busy. I wish more employees were as good as the gals at 35th ave. Bethany. NICE WORK
name: Starbucks

text: Unfortunately I need write a review because this Starbucks really needs to improve and I hope corporate takes action. Aside from a few drinks that have been wrong and slow lines, what's lacking at this location is the customer service. They are openly rude when you ask for your drink remade or even what comes in a drink. They will take your drink, smell it and look at each other as if you're a liar like they did with me. The baristas seem annoyed to serve you as a customer. I have been a barista and manager for over 14 years and this Starbucks in my opinion needs either new management or a new team to check their attitudes while on the job.
name: Starbucks

text:
Probably the worst Starbucks I have ever been to!

First, I visit a Starbucks at least 3 times a week. So for me to stop at a random shop out of my neighborhood isn't unheard of for me.

Went through the drive thru on a sunny Tuesday afternoon. Only 1 car in front of me. Placed my order, iced Venti coconut milk caramel macchiato. As soon as I pulled up to the window my drink was ready. 1 star for the pleasant girl at the window, 1 star for the speed. As we all know sometimes Starbucks is as slow as waiting for drip coffee at home. 

Paid my $6.35 and drove off.

This had to have been the worst espresso ever. Bitter with a horrible aftertaste plus my drink was void of any caramel, not a drop in the bottom, not a drop on the lid, not a drop down n the side of my glass. And I did not taste any of the normal vanilla syrup they usually use. It was unsweetened, or it tasted like it was. If I wanted black coffee I would stop at Circle K or QT and pay $5 less.

So much for my afternoon caffeine buzz.
name: Starbucks

text: By far this is the worst Starbucks I been too :( and I am a loyal Starbucks costumer.  The barista has not too friendly I asked her for a Bacon Gouda and she said we don't have that, okay give me a chocolate croissant and she said I don't have that. There were 3 cars ahead of me and I waited in line 15 minutes. Damn. This was quite a disappointment luckily I don't live around here and I will never be coming back.
name: Starbucks

text: The service was fast and smooth, it was easy to order and go. Stay thirsty my friends
name: Starbucks

text: I have been there a few times and I love this Starbucks. Its close to GCU and they must hire the students, they treat you wonderfully and are kind, patient and thoughtful. Great place to make yourâ€‹ neighborhood coffee place.
name: Starbucks

text: I don't usually leave reviews but this guy Steven was pretty awesome!!! He subway was FULL of customers and it seemed like he was solo which sounds weird for a Friday ..... but he was awesome! Super friendly and apologized for the wait once we were up.... anyway!!! He was in good spirits which was great!!

name: Subway

text: At one end of the counter I was told I can use the coupon I brought, at the other end when going to pay I was told I couldn't.  Lame!!  No more business from me!!!!  Cheeba Hut is much better and a couple buildings to the East!  This location has gone down hill; used to be very busy years ago and hardly has anyone in it now.
categories: Restaurants, Convenience Stores, Sandwiches, Food, Fast Food
name: Subway

text: Great experience!! I for the breakfast wheat flat bread and the flat bread was the freshest I have ever had at any Subway!!!! Delicious. My husband got the tuna on wheat flat bread and said the same thing!! Kendrick& Tristan - servers are both very friendly, efficient, and precise. Very good experience!! We will be back for sure. The restaurant is also very clean and the music not too loud. Great jobs guys!!
categories: Restaurants, Convenience Stores, Sandwiches, Food, Fast Food
name: Subway

text:
I went to this location today and the man helping me with my sandwich and to check out was very unkind to us. We honestly said nothing wrong and he was so unprofessional and rude in how he spoke to us in line, like he didn't want us there and we were an inconvenience to him. 
Then we left our baskets on the table we ate at, i guess we didn't realize it... we threw away our trash and mess though. He seemed to get angry about that too and shouted at us as we left "Thanks for leaving your baskets!" I was shocked, as I have worked in food service for many years and I've never seen someone treat customers this way. I wish I got his name. Please teach the employees some good manners.... :(
categories: Restaurants, Convenience Stores, Sandwiches, Food, Fast Food
name: Subway

text: Horrible customer service. I didn't get the girls name but she had a lip piercing and spikey gauges was so rude! She and the other male worker kept arguing about who was going to stay and cover and who was leaving. They just kept bickering and when I told her my order she kept slamming the bread door very loudly, almost to make it known she was mad. She made my sandwich wrong which I corrected her and she proceeded to say no I was wrong she heard differently what I said. Finally she's checking me out and is shoving everything into the bag very angry like. She did not give my my receipt I paid with cash and as I was leaving she decided to give me the receipt which I didn't see and all I hear behind me is " OH OKAAAY". Very rude customer service , horrible experience!!!!!
categories: Restaurants, Convenience Stores, Sandwiches, Food, Fast Food
name: Subway

text: As I walked in nobody was in there I waited for someone to come from the back 5 mins later another customer came in so I yelled out hello twice before a girl with headphones in her ear came out with wet hands pulled the headphones off grabbed gloves then stated let me just dry my hands then put the gloves on as she puts them on I seen a gnat hovering over the meat I wanted so I stated to her never mind because I see a gnat she stated back to me there isn't any gnats in here kinda sarcastically an I looked back cause I had already walked away and pointed right at it she saw it a started swatting at it I just walked out and I heard her yelling as I got out the door already "WELL HAVE A NICE DAY" I took it as sarcasm because of her totally attitude prior. Maybe she was having a bad day but I didn't feel as a customer her customer service was friendly at all. I don't know her name she didn't have a badge but she was Caucasian, short, dark brown long hair and a piercing on her face. Ended up just walking to cheba hut in the next parking lot... if reading this and interested.
categories: Restaurants, Convenience Stores, Sandwiches, Food, Fast Food
name: Subway

text: Unfortunately they dont leave a name on the receipt...the cashier with the lip piercing and bad concealer for her acne gave very upsetting service. Ignored the person behind me and slapped together the sandwich like a true "artist." I mentioned that we were on a timer since she was shooting the breeze with her coworker. That began the descent of her shoving the sandwich the sandwich, napkins, and receipts in the bag. Followed by storming off to the back. Yea it's a subway but they're sort of everywhere. Go to a different one. Not always appetising to eat a sandwich after it's been created with spite (not spit) but I'm sure she would if she didn't make it right in front of us.

text: All I ordered was a small coffee. The service person rang me up for a small soda. Then he proceeded to give me an empty drink cup (which I thought was a coffee cup). Then I had to ask for cream and sugar. I went to the drink station expecting to find the coffee and there was none. Then I realized that I had a soda cup. I went back to the counter and asked for my coffee. He looked at me and took my drink cup and finally poured my coffee in a coffee cup--no apology and he had a smirk on his face.  I looked at my receipt and realized he charged me for a small soda. When I brought it to his attention he said "oh it's the same price anyway." I left and went to the drink station to get a coffee stirrer. There were none. Went back to to counter and had to ask for a stirrer. Again no apology. All the while the manager was at the counter in plain view and hearing range. But she said nothing.

text: I don't normally do reviews unless it's bad and I don't expect a lot with fast food but this time was horrible. So I got off of work and came to this McDonald seeing as they are always open. Always have the full menu available. Well at this time they did not, they only had the breakfast menu available. So I go ahead and order the sausage egg with cheese biscuit. The person running it, when ordering they ended up going to their fellow coworker and saying "I'm done". First of all I found that very disrespectful Second of all being as somebody who associate themselves with customers all day I expect nothing more then 100% regardless if you're about to go on break, if you're about to get off of work it doesn't matter to me, what matters to me is customer satisfaction. (If you are about to get off work or going on break, finish the customer who u handling and then go to break or whatever). So besides that I went home and I unwrap my sausage egg with cheese biscuit and I find myself with bottom bread, cheese and sausage with no top bread nor egg;  as you'll see in the picture I am highly disappointed in this and I doubt I will ever come back to this McDonald's. I wish I would've gotten the kids name who was disrespectful to me so I can properly talk to him but seeing as he left so quickly I wasn't able to but I will be sure to tell my fellow coworkers and friends not to come here again seeing apparently to this McDonald's customer satisfaction is not what your guys goal is to obtain. Very disappointed.

text: This place is a JOKE!!! Everytime I go they don't bag my cinnamon twist. Got me three times in a row. She points to a heat lamp rack with nacho chips and cinnamon twist pre-bagged on it and says " sometimes when they ain't on that rack we be thinking there out"..........WTF?

text: Sometimes the food is good sometimes its not I dont know to each is own. Service is slow sometime could do better. Honestly

text: Lame. Got takeout, got home, they forgot part of the order. I had to go all the way back (because who doesn't want what they paid for??) and the manager gave me nothing extra for their screw-up. In fact, they messed up part of the order, too, and they didn't even let me keep the incorrect one! They threw it away! I never ask for extra stuff, but when you mess up that much, it's just a given you do something nice for the custimer. This manager was awful. She was a super overweight woman with dark hair who wasn't nice at all. In fact, she wanted to argue with me instead. I didn't feel like arguing or being mean, so I just left. And now here I am, letting everyone know how crappy of an experience I had.
name: Taco Bell

text:
My favorite TB in Gastonia, food is always freshly made, and served with  smile. They do not add on at the window just an FYI. Which is cool with me cuz when people do it, it takes longer for everyone else. Also, they limit your drive thru separate orders to two depending on who you get. If I have more than two orders, which happens, I go in, cuz I don't suck at life. 

Most taco bells have the same thing so the menu is basic. This one just taste better than the other two in Gastonia. It could be me. 


When dining in, I hardly ever see the restaurant a mess. It does get trashed by local jerks, but someone is always out to pick it up. Bathrooms are normally clean. The rare times they weren't, I mentioned it, and someone went to clean it up right away. 

My only complaint is the nacho toppings are getting light, but if I dine in & say something they correct it. 

Other than that, this Taco Bell is awesome.
name: Taco Bell

text: I will never be back to this taco bell in gastonia. They did not have the change that i needed and where Rude. Lazy People that work there

text: Normally, this is my go-to on my way home from a late night at work. Normally, they get everything right, with the exception of the occasional missing sauce. Tonight, however, they screwed the pooch.  I ordered a 4 for $4 meal with a Jr. Bacon cheeseburger AND one extra JBC (that's two sandwiches).  Imagine my surprise when I arrive home to discover only one sandwich. I check the bill, and sure enough, I was charged for two JBCs. To add insult to injury, when I opened the sandwich, I discovered a double cheeseburger. So not only can the staff not count, they apparently can't tell the various sandwiches apart. Morons. From now on, I'm apparently going to have to thoroughly check my order before leaving.

text: If there is a no star option, I would give it a NO Star!  So I have ordered twice at this place from to be delivered at my job so, we can enjoy Papa John's. At first I thought the pricing was a little bit much with a 30% Off Large Specialty Pizza. I get there is a delivery charge and paid almost $25 with tips included.  I called to ask for a prize and it was way less than the one I ordered that had supposedly the 30% Off.  I spoke to the "General Manager, Tim" and asked why would they send fliers of discounts if there are really no discount.  I wanted to speak to someone who is in charge of this location and he said that they are in the east coast. I ask if there is someone who is in charge in their region and said no one is in charge of their region...BOLOGNA! Needless to say, I am never ordering here ever AGAIN or possibly not even eat Papa Johns EVER as well!

name: Papa John's Pizza

text:
My family and I have ordered hundreds of pizzas from this papa johns location as the years go either for parties or dinner/lunch.

Their management and employees are what makes this location one of the best in the area; very polite and willing to work with the customer, I always feel comfortable ordering here.

I'm the one customer that is very picky on making the pie's I order well-done. They do it when I ask, and the pie is delicious every time. Perfect crust.

The coupons, such as the 40% and 50% off ones are amazing; always available it seems like which is perfect. I love the rewards program they offer and I've gotten several pizzas for free through that program, I recommend signing up for that if you are a consistent customer like how I am!

I usually pickup my pie's at the location but sometimes I chose delivery when I cannot commute. The delivery is very fast and the pie's are PIPING hot and fresh when they arrive. The delivery drivers are friendly as well.

When I do not commute to my favorite Italian pizzerias, which are miles away from my house, I will always order at this papa johns. 

I recommend this location...!

name: Papa John's Pizza

text:
Stay far away from this location.  The management has a "we have enough business " attitude when they screw up.  

I spent way too much time waiting for my pick up order that was never made.  (35 minutes)  When it was finally brought to the manager's attention, he did not offer an apology or even to make it.  I finally told him to cancel it. Without ever looking at me, he said "ok" and walked away.  

I contacted customer support and reported my experience.  I was told someone would be contacting me to follow up.  This email is their entire idea of "follow up":

Dear Thomas,

Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. I would like to apologize to you for the late service that you have recently received.  At Papa John's, we strive for best in class in everything we do.  One of our core values at Papa John's is constant improvement.  

We want to make it right. We do not take these issues lightly and your feedback will be used to improve our ability to serve you in the future.

Sincerely,

store 1686        
General Manager
Round Rock Restaurant Group

I replied to the email and have never heard from them again.  There is way too much competition out there for this place to stay in business.  Help shut them down and show them that people will not accept such horrendous service.  

Tom Murphy

text:
My wife and I live right behind this location, so we always order online then just walk over and get our food.

We absolutely enjoy the "John's Favorite" pizza, the seasoning they use on this is to die for! So if you're having a hard time trying to figure out what to order...GET THIS! 

The one thing I have noticed is the staff isn't always the best at greeting the customers. Now I do understand things get busy and maybe overwhelming, but a simple hello, just to acknowledge that you are happy that your customers are there, definitely goes a long way. So that's really the only reason I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5. 

I'm not saying the staff is rude or mean or anything like that, I personally, would just like a "hello!" when we walk in.

But overall great place! Get the "John's Favorite"!

text: OMG. Been seeing the ads for the "Naked Chicken Chalupa." Wanted to try it. I haven't been to Taco Bell in a decade or more. Walked in on Saturday at 5:30 and there was a line of 8 or so, but I expected that. Unfortunately, as soon as I got past the door I was overcome with an overwhelming stench of raw sewer gas. Something obviously was working its way the wrong direction in the plumbing. I actually started to feel nauseous. Quickly calculated that the amount of time in line I would have to intake this noxious, putrid odor would poison me faster than the food would. Quickly exited. Maricopa County Health Department...Hey, when you have a chance, maybe you could wear some HazMat gear and check it out? Thanks.

text:
The food was as expected.

My real problem was the customer service. My girlfriend and I walked in and it was practically dead. There was a girl working drive through but no one was up front to take our orders. We could hear people talking and laughing in the back having a good time. After a few minutes of waiting, more people walked in behind us and also waited. I understand that drive through is its own job so I didn't expect her to help us, but she didn't even bother looking over to check if there were any customers until a few minutes after the people behind us arrived. When she finally realized we were here and waiting, she walked towards us and had a little back and forth with people in the back. She arrived to the register and didn't apologize or even greet us. As we ordered, she muttered something under her breathe about her co workers in the back. We sat and waited for our food until she called our order. I went up to get it and she was gone. We left with no goodbye, have a nice day, or anything of the sort.

text:
This is the first time I have ever asked for my money back from Taco Bell. After waiting 10 minutes with not a single car moving in the drive thru, I figured I'd go inside and get my meal in a jiffy. Wrong. I waited about another 30 minutes. Finally gave up and got my money back from the manager who could absolutely care less. No "sorry". Just a silent robot handing me some change.

Oh, and I don't think I have EVER gotten a fresh, hot, tasty item from this location. Anyone that has had fresh GOOD taco bell food knows what I am talking about. 

Dont waste your time here. You will wait a good 30-40 minutes for lousy food prepared by a staff who could care less.

text: I've come to this Taco Bell a lot, multiple times a week most of the time, and I've never had such a terrible experience. They took an unusually long amount of time to get us our food in the drive through, and when we got our food we had barely any sauce even though we had four people. When we asked for more sauce she literally gave us ONE more packet of sauce. Even her co-worker questioned what she did, as it was terrible customer service, saying "That's it?!," and she replied "If they want more they can get it." Seeing as the other employee seemed nice, we didn't want to be rude so we pulled around and I went inside and grabbed more sauce. But it doesn't end there, once we got home we realized that we we're missing a burrito that we had PAYED for. We called the restaurant to make a complaint and the supposed manager picked up and it was the same lady who gave us one packet of sauce at the drive through, "Dory," if that's even her real name. She wouldn't tell us who her higher up was, probably because she knows what she did wrong, and when we asked for her last name she wouldn't tell us that either, "just Dory," she said. We asked who her district manager was and she was hesitant but gave us the name Mark, just Mark. No last name again, so now we asked for his last name and really hesitantly this time, as if thinking, said District. Mark District... I'm not sure if that's a real name or not, she gave me plenty of reason to believe it isn't, but I plan on finding out. After that we had had enough and simply hung up. Haven't had such a poor experience before.

text: This place has you order yourself on a kiosk.  Not sure how new it is but not a single customer could do it without an employee helping.  The line was outrageously long. The food took forever to get and I didn't get my drink cups. Same employee said I was supposed to grab my own cups.   Apparently telling him I have never been inside and done the self ordering qualified me to know everything.  I also noticed that some orders were being taken to the customers and others were not with the manager shouting out the number.  Maybe that's why my order took so long. The employee told me he would bring my food so I didn't listen for a number.  This location needs to get their act together and provide better training to the employees so they can provide better customer service.

text: Avoid this McDonalds especially during lunch hours. Today was my last time to go to this place. I waited in the drive thru for 10 minutes and did not move one inch. The place inside was clearly very disorganized with some workers just standing around, and others bumping around and into each other. text:
Really!!!  Hopefully this gets somewhere with you guys...this is the only way maybe you get your act together. (forget corporate number putting you guys on blast in front of everyone)  When a customer goes in and the place is not full in after hours (after 6:00 pm in last visit) or whenever you are not so busy. I get it...you get for what you pay for but if I had a choice between Jack in box and you guys I would probably choose jack in the box(I rather McDonald's)...I myself just got out of work and wanted something from you guys...I've had it before where it was all hot and fresh so it fucking infuriates me when I tell this to cashier...I specifically said I'm not in a rush...to start stale frys Simi Luke warm chicken nuggets and again Simi Luke warm quarter pounder with cheese...I'm not someone who eats burgers everyday but the day I do especially getting off from work I would like it hot and fresh....I wish In N Out was near thus location because I have seen what In N Out does to you guys on flaming and Fort apache...no comparison you would lose...
Again if someone tells you they are not in a rush...Please listen to them 
I've had it before in this location...let's see if someone in upper management sees this

text:
This location needs new supervision. I'd say about 8/10 orders I receive from this location is wrong or they just don't put the order together completely. Last 3 orders have been missing something. On one order, we ordered a fairly large order, about 8 different burgers. Of those, we asked for one Big Mac with no cheese. They didn't put cheese on ANY of them. In fact one we got ended up being a quarter pounder with just the bun, patty and pickles, nothing else. Nasty. 
The other complaint I have is half the time, the attitude is far from friendly. I wouldn't say rude, just that couldn't be bothered kind of attitude, and that probably contributes to the messed up orders. 
Some people think that this kind of work deserves $15/hr. Those people are delusional. It's not the type of job that deserves that. Most people working at McD's are kids or students. Some management positions maybe, but not the average employee. Paramedics, paralegals, and other more important type of jobs don't pay that much.

text:
McDonalds...McDonalds.. Where do I even start? Possibly at the fact that I very rarely even visit them. I just don't understand what happened to the good ole' days when McDonald's was actually priced fairly and they didn't have all these issues but I get it.. Supply and demand type of thing I suppose? But geezee like I brought my friend and her baby here last night for a Happy Meal and an ice cream cone. 

Drive thru- was PACKED and not moving.. We literally spent a good 15-20 minutes stuck all for it to result in us getting to the ordering window to be informed that they were out of ice cream (per usual) and that the orange HI-C that was suppose to go with the Happy Meal couldn't happen because it was too "Out of Order". Sad to say but it's just really aggravating that no matter what McDonalds location you visit you are bound to experience some sort of issue that is deemed as an uncontrollable circumstance. 

The whole corporation should just stop offering ice cream because it never fails the damn machine is ALWAYS BROKE! The High Prices, High Blood Pressure and High chances of an ordering not being able to be fulfilled is enough to continue to keep me away from visiting any location... Not just this one.

text:
We purchased drinks at a different McDonald's location a couple of hours before. My wife and I were running errands in the Summerlin area. We dropped by the McDonald's at 10290 W. Charlston Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89135 for a refill. I went into the McDonald's for refills for my wife and I. As I approached the drink area, I was confronted and informed by an African American male employee that I was not allowed to get refills. He was very rude and abrasive. He indicated that he was the Customer Service Manager. I explained to him that I had never heard of this policy. My wife and I have been buying drinks at McDonald's for years and always get refills. He let me know that a customer can get as many refills as they would like while in the building but once they leave the building then they cannot get a refill. I explained to him that if that was the policy then the other locations are not following the policy. His location is the only one. He said that he did not care what the other locations were doing. This was the policy and he would not let me get refills. 

As I left the McDonald's, I told the manager that he just lost my business. He said that was fine and did not seem to care about that. Yet, he is the Customer Service Manager which is poor customer service. I went down the street to another McDonald's and got our refills and no one bothered me. McDonald's is not consistent in their policy. 

I placed a complaint with McDonald's Corporate. They had a Director of Operations give me a call about the complaint. She apologized for the experience but was very vague about their policy. At no time did she offer me a free meal or coupons, nothing. Based on the way I was treated at this McDonald's, I would not recommend this McDonald's location to anyone.  

Roy K.

Not only did the drive thru take a long time to put together my relatively simple order, while I was waiting I got to listen to the employees working the drive thru talk about calling in with vomiting,  diarrhea,  and coughs. I also got to hear two employees discussing how much one of them makes, $8.50 an hour apparently. On top of all that, they messed up my order. Maybe if they weren't so busy discussing bodily fluids in front of customers they could take the time to get orders right, especially after they repeated the order back to me correctly multiple times. This is one of the reasons I avoid fast food most of the time. Kids working there that don't care and and have no pride in their work.

text:
I've never felt so compelled to review a fast food chain!

Look, I'm not perfect. I occasionally find myself short on time or low on groceries and pop into McDonald's for a quick Egg White Delight.

My expectations for establishments such as this are LOW. REALLY LOW. Virtually nonexistent.

To my surprise, the bar has been raised. There is one employee in particular who is responsible for this. I didn't catch his name but he was working the register but seemed to hold much more responsibility than that. He is younger, bilingual and has another job elsewhere, clearly a hard working kid headed for success. 

We had an issue with our app order and this employees customer service skills were something you would find in a high end restaurant. I was taken back.

Thank you for being you, I hope you see this and continue on your path to success!

Five stars to this McDonald's for SERVICE 
Five stars for cleanliness 
And five stars for making a fresh egg white delight at 10:31.

text: Experience on July 13th, noon-ish: upon reading other yelpers' reviews, I should known the drive through is bad. Maybe it was my 38 week prego hormone too. I ordered a   large hot coffee, 5 sugar and 5 cream. That was it. The older lady in cashier window told me the MCD app doesn't work which is obviously a lie, because it actually did went through after she scanned. Got my coffee black from window #2. I got back in the drive thru line, cashier lady yelled at me and told me that black coffee was my order. I don't even know what to respond. In silence, she just waked away and got another guy to come tell me to go get my coffee at the next window. I know I wasn't purchasing a bottle of vintage Don Perignon from a club, it was just a 20oz coffee from a drive thru; but after that attitude, I am not going to drink that returned coffee. The hassle is from 20 minutes wasted there I have to hunt down my daily dosage elsewhere. Yuck!

text:
This location needs new supervision. I'd say about 8/10 orders I receive from this location is wrong or they just don't put the order together completely. Last 3 orders have been missing something. On one order, we ordered a fairly large order, about 8 different burgers. Of those, we asked for one Big Mac with no cheese. They didn't put cheese on ANY of them. In fact one we got ended up being a quarter pounder with just the bun, patty and pickles, nothing else. Nasty. 
The other complaint I have is half the time, the attitude is far from friendly. I wouldn't say rude, just that couldn't be bothered kind of attitude, and that probably contributes to the messed up orders. 
Some people think that this kind of work deserves $15/hr. Those people are delusional. It's not the type of job that deserves that. Most people working at McD's are kids or students. Some management positions maybe, but not the average employee. Paramedics, paralegals, and other more important type of jobs don't pay that much. 
Still have problems. This is a complaint for July 21, 2016. Ordered a few things. One was a plain fish filet, then a couple Big Macs and a couple mcdoubles. 
First the filet. Specifically ordered a plain Filet o Fish, even saying to them 'all I want is the fish and the bun.' Got everything, tarter sauce, cheese etc. 
So I asked them to fix it, again saying specifically how it should be- just the filet and the bun. Nothing else. So this time it had cheese on it. Really?!??!!! Luckily, the third time was the charm. 
Next the Big Mac. They forgot that middle piece of the bun when they were putting it together, so they just put it on top, then put the 'lid' piece on top of that. Wow. 
It is clear that this location will never bother to fix their employee problem. I went back and read other reviews about this location, and it is staggering to me that after numerous complaints about the same reoccurring problems, they still haven't fixed the problems yet. I figured with a big company like this, all of these complaints would have made corporate management step in and make the necessary changes. A lot of corporate chains have stipulations where corporate HQ will fine the franchise owner, or if bad enough, force them out of the company. 
CORPORATE, if you are reading this, I would advise you to step in and fix this location. It is a complete and utter mess.

text:
I really like this store. 
I don't honestly feel like every Starbucks is the same,  sure same products for sale.  
But some feel cozier than others.  

This one is a great spot to read and be quiet. 
Every guest sat reading,  sipping, and enjoying their personal space. 

The one over on Alma School, totally opposite.  
Everyone brings a game,  and people sit in groups chatting and trying to beat each other with words and dictionaries.  

Starbucks,  the same. But different.  
I like both options.

text: I have always loved Starbucks! Ever since they got the app and you can load money and earn point on there, it's made paying so much easier. I love the rewards, I just love it all. Well today I used the mobile order for the first time. Wow, just wow! I was actually able to get a coffee before work and not have to worry about being late to work. The best part I didn't even have to leave my house any earlier then I usually would. Let the same time, made my mobile order, went inside and grabbed it and continued heading to work. It was amazing! I will definitely be using the mobile order more often now! I'll probably get to enjoy a Starbucks coffee more often during the week now. Thank you Starbucks! You have of course upped the standards again!

text:
This is probably one of the worst Starbucks I've ever been to. It's worth it to drive 10 minutes to another one or even to just go into the frys.
The first time I was here I ordered a basic caramel frappucchino. When I came out white I tried to ask about it. The worker practically yelled at me "Next time you need to order more flavor shots." I was so embarrassed I left. Mind you, this has not happened since and was over a year ago.
But now, every time I have come, they don't have the syrups for and make it wrong, or, don't even know what the drink is even though it's on the website. I know that it gets backed up, having a drive thru and everything because I used to work in fast food. But it's just depressing to pay $6 and watch your drink get made wrong 3 times. They gave me what was basically a mocha frappucchino (the drink I ordered didn't have mocha in it!). I finally just took it because I had somewhere to be.

name: Starbucks

text: It pains me to write this review. I used to go to this location when it was further back in this plaza, on the end next to the Mexican chain eatery (whose name escapes me at the moment). I loved that location, knew everyone in there, the regulars, the baristas were the best - nice, personable, everyone knew everyone and it was a real neighborhood place with comfortable seating, a really nice pleasant environment. Then they moved it to the front of this plaza, right on the corner to enable a drive through (this was done to the Starbucks that was at Gilbert Rd and Baseline, too). Both of these upgrades unfortunately resulted in less comfortable, less pleasant, less hospitable experiences going inside into the Starbucks. Yeah, I get it, Starbucks does way more business in the drive-thru and that's clearly their main concern. But for those of us looking for a place to sit down, enjoy conversation or do work on our laptops and use the internet, it totally sucks. Whoever designed these two new locations' interiors did a terrible job on creating a nice place to come into and sit down. The environments at both of them are just unpleasant; there's no comfortable chairs like they used to have, and something about the places is just cold, sterile, totally unappealing to come in, relax, talk or even work on a laptop. If they just wanted people to come in, buy coffee and leave, and that was their modus operandi, then they've succeeded. This location on Warner and Stapley was by far the nicest Starbrucks in the whole area (for miles and miles) to sit and relax and enjoy some company with the regulars. It was just a great spot: 4 comfy chairs all together to relax in with friends or just talk to other regulars. And now? No comfortable seating, no ambiance, just a very sterile, impersonal, not very appealing, indoor space. The baristas seem new and just don't seem comfortable in there either. Sucks all around. The one star is aimed at Starbucks corporate who took a great Starbucks and made it a totally unappealing, sterile environment to be in (the outside patio, in decent weather, being the sole part of it that's ok), either because the new designer sucks or they did this for more profit at the drive-thru and to keep it physically not conducive to patrons staying a while and hanging out (it's the same with the new Gilbert and Baseline location - super uninviting inside that one too). Needless to say, I've moved on and gone elsewhere. I just can't bring myself to go back to these locations "post-op".

text: Horrible experience, first I was rudely told by the woman in the drive thru that she couldnt hear me. I raised my voice and she repeated my order.  I paid for it and drove off.  2 miles away I discovered I had a coffee I didn't order.  Drove back and went inside. They had 5 employees working,  I was able to go right up to the counter and tell the cashier. He took my order again and I waited and waited. 10 minutes of which all this time they were talking and laughing. I, very frustrated asked If my order was forgotten. The girl told me the coffee machine was broken.  Unbelievable!! So at this point more upset I said why wasn't I told.  She made my drink, and said in a very snotty tone sorry about that.  I said, "no I'm sorry, sorry I ever came here". Never again!  I had to give you one star because it wouldn't let me continue with zero stars. This place deserves no stars, very poor customer service.

text: I've never visited this location, I was in a different route today. I love the Starbucks in usually go to. The strangest thing happened today. I began to get grossed out after I ordered and got closer to the window and saw the man handing out food in drink with a long beard and very greasy hair, all uncovered. I tried to stomach past it. When I got to him I laid him in cash. He said he had no change and was going to pay me in $10 worth of quarters. I told him that was not ok and he needed to get me cash, no coins. He left the window, cane back and said the quarters were all he had. I said I wouldn't leave where I was without cash. He then produced two five dollar bills almost immediately. I'm still so confused by the whole transaction. I've never been handed $10 worth of quarters for change in my life. He next gave me my food and drinks. The drinks were good, the food tasted as if it had been sitting for hours which I didn't eat because I suspect he might've given me an old sandwich for making him get me change.  I'll drive the extra couple of miles next time to avoid this Starbucks.

text: Consistently outstanding customer service at this location which is fortunately only a couple of blocks from my house.  Many of the baristas show genuine friendliness and kindness.  My only complaint is that they aren't open later.  Sometimes when I need to work or study late, I have to go to other locations further from home that are open later (like Williamsfield and Val Vista, or Warner and Val Vista).  Another thing I like about this Starbucks it it's nice mix of seating options which include outdoor patio, an indoor padded bench, 3 separate high top tables with stool seating, and lots of standard tables and chairs.

text: I am going to have to give this one star even though they do not deserve it. For years I have been incredibly hesitant to go back, as each time, I receive very poor service. THIS PLACE IS BEYOND HORRENDOUS for any kind of positive people service. This past Saturday at 8am, while getting on the road for a weekend trip, I stopped by this establishment again, thinking I would give them another chance. Well, the male employee at the register just finished with a transaction then decided he just had to make a pot of coffee at that moment as I stood in line. I mentioned to him "Is making a pot of coffee right at this moment more important than helping the next customer in line?" He turned around dumbfounded and came up to the register and said "What do you want?" I was like WOW...no apology, no empathy, just complete void of any kind of service recovery. I stopped the transaction and spoke directly to a manager--she could have cared less. She just looked at me, provided a very insincere apology. I looked at her and told her I was done. I can go to the McDonalds at Glendale/16th Street or Indian School/9th street and get exceptional service. I even had the feeling before I opened the door to go in there...and again, I predicted the very bad service I was going to receive...and it came true! This McDonald's location will never get my money or time ever again. Yuck!

text: This is probably the first time I every stop by a Mcdonald's since I had a kid in the car. Drove by the drive thru just to get a Happy meal. Ordering the food was fast but when we got done paying and went to the second window the lady said they are in the middle of getting the nuggets cooked and if I can pull to the first parking in front of me an someone will come out. Well, I was pretty patience since again I have a child in the car. Waited for 20 mins and that was it for me. I call the store to let them know I've been waiting for the meal for over 20 mins now and I can not leave the child unattended in the car, just for me to walk inside. They apologize and said the fries with the meal dropped and they had no more nuggets, would I like something else? How in the world can you not communicate this to your client when I've been waiting for over 20 mins and let me know after I called in about my order? Very disappointing! My time is as valuable as yours!

text:
For a fast-food restaurant, I have to give this place a 5 star rating.  I saw all of the past reviews and understood the reason for the low ratings.  My family and I were at the Verizon Wireless across the other side of the large parking lot; after 3+ hours of waiting in there, and we were STARVING.  Right across from this location is a Chic-Fil-A that we love but their parking area was full and the drive-thru line was long.  We saw this huge sign on this McDonald's "Grand Opening" and there were no more than two cars parked in their parking.  I remember reading the reviews but I knew the kids were starving and we all needed to use the restrooms as well.  So we crossed our fingers.... 

I don't know what it was, maybe it's because they felt changed, upgraded, or new but the staff was amazing!  Every single person actually seemed happy to be there.  They greeted us, took our order and we were handed over a pager.  (Guess it's better than yelling your name)  The restrooms were locked so when I asked for the "key" they pushed a button from the side wall and was advised it was unlocked and I could go ahead.  The ladies restroom was small but very clean.  Unfortunately, no paper towels to dry my hands with and so I had to grab the handle to open the door.  

The entire place was clean.  The soda fountain/ketchup area was very clean and in order.  Not a single dirty table or food anywhere on the floor.  The place is divided in half... the area with more tables and open seats (quiet area) and then the play area with more space between tables for parents/families.  They had comfortable chairs for the wheelchair accessible tables too.   

If you've been here before... give it another chance.  Yes, it's just fast-food.  There WILL be children but if you dine-in, there's plenty of comfortable seats away from the playground area.  We noticed that they had a lot of young children BY-THEMSELVES with no parents and no supervision around.  There was also a few homeless guests that stopped in but they were taken care of the same and they weren't bothering anyone.  I have nothing negative to say about this McDonald's.  We were hungry and our food looked and tasted good.  No soggy fries or over fried nuggets that have been sitting in old cooking oil - none of that.  

As I was taking pictures to share on Yelp... (I was spotted with my phone - lol)  a manager came up to me concerned, asking me if something was wrong.  I advised him that everything was fine.  He was actively involved assisting in the drive-thru as he was with the front registers.

text:
Yes, big shock, I know.  I don't eat @ McDonald's or other fast food establishments.  Usually if I did, it's because i was being cute using their free coupons or special promos (birthdays, anniversaries,...).
Yesterday around 1 PM, I decided to stop by since I was in the neighborhood to redeem their free coupons that I received in the (junk) mail, for free small fries and a fruit smoothie.  I selected strawberry-flavored smoothie for a 'drink' to wash down the fries.  I was served by cashier Daniel, who was very polite and timely, and he even thought it was cute that I had the free coupons ;)  He accepted 2 separate coupons, and I was not charged sales tax so I didn't have to pull change out of my wallet.  How courteous.  I dined in, partly so I could take a photo in that setting for you Yelpers ;)  I sat at a cool polished 'wood' counter with a comfy leather stool, cozily inside the one area that looked like it's for WifFi users (not sure if you could use a laptop at that very area as I didn't bring mine). 
The fries were hot and tasty with not too much salt, and the smoothie had the right texture and wasn't too much like softened ice cream and wasn't too cold and did taste like strawberry.  Oh, when I asked another server next to Daniel if there was a fork, she handed me fork & knife that were encased in factory-sealed plastic wrap.  She also hinted that there were a straw and self-service ketchup at a station behind me.  It was just fairly busy and the staff kept up with that pace as if they were properly trained for their positions.  Even the rest of the people picking up or dining in were polite.  As I was waiting for my order (for about 5 minutes, a woman came up to Daniel and mentioned something wrong with her hamburger (like missing the onions), he quickly accompanied her without treating her like an anal hassle.  I also noticed that the establishment appeared to have been renovated, and it was clean and very modern, and the ambiance was casual and room temperature was at a comfortable level..
Overall, it was a professional service for that type of establishment, and I left pleased.  It must've been a good day due to very cool weather :)

text: Out of convenience, I used to frequent this Wendy's because it's close to my work. I can probably say that this is the worse location I've been to. I went inside once to order my food and noticed that the people dining there weren't the best of people. I'll just drive thru next time, problem solved.Whenever I would pull up to the window, RIGHT as I pulled up, the voice over the intercom says "What can I get you?" First of all, can I get a hello at least and second, can I get a minute to look at the menu. The food had issues too. I've had a sandwich with wilted lettuce. I ordered a salad once that looked nice because the cucumbers on top were fresh. But once I dug deeper into the bowl, the lettuce was brown and old. I've ordered chicken nuggets and fries a few times and some times they were hot and other times they weren't. And don't get me started on the actual employees. Not friendly, no smiles on their face and probably a few cases of badly drawn eyebrows. Lesson learned, will not be coming back even if it's for the delicious frosty.

text:
This is my first visit here since the remodel on this particular Wendy's, and what a design decor upgrade they gave this location. Bravo. I remember how rundown and so very plain the old store was. The design of this store is even different than other Wendy's throughout the valley that have been remodeled. I love how the owners designed this location in such a square way. It is so perfect. 

The employees are some of the most upbeat and attentive staff that I have ever seen. They ensure that all the guest needs are met and it is performed with such personalized perfection. I ended of ordering the 4 for 4 menu with a jr bacon as my burger choice. Also salad was on the menu for me and enjoyed a Caesar salad and a Cobb salad that I split up between myself and the twins. I would revisit this store just to be in the company of such competent and courteous staff.

text: Took my girlfriend here on a date. We waited for over 45 minutes to be seated. We were finally approached by a janitor who informed us we would need to go to the cashier. At this point I decided to call it quits and take my girlfriend somewhere else (Roberto's). I am thoroughly disappointed in Wendy and will no longer be dining at her restaurants any longer. Let this be a warning to all of you, Wendy's is not a fine dining establishment.

name: Wendy's

text:
Went here because it's close to the fwy.  The food was good, but the service is severely lacking.  First of all the restrooms only accommodate one person.  The men's restroom was out of order and women's was occupied by one person for over an hour.  Another customer told us he'd been here for over an hour and no restroom was available.  Three other customers wanted to use the bathroom, too
  An employee was told that someone was occupying the bathroom for over an hour.  All the employee did was knock on the door and as four customers watched she announced, "Oh, someone's still in there.". This Wendy's should have a combo to access and have more than one accommodated for the restroom.  Another customer said the person was probably doing drugs in there.  Never coming to this Wendy's again.

name: Wendy's

text:
A vast improvement since this particular Wendy's demolished the old and built anew a glistening testament to the future of fast-food. 

I'm not one to visit, let alone review, fast-food eateries, but this Wendy's is a near to where I live, so its construction has had my attention. I visited the previous, and celebrated the grand re-opening. A quick pros/cons list:

I greatly appreciate the expanded and healthy menu options. When I do visit, it's for a grilled chicken sandwich, a wrap, or a salad with grilled chicken. Quick and healthy. Maybe a Frosty to take the edge off. I like to use the phone app, sometimes to pre-order, and always to check mega discounts and freebies. There is much value to be found here. Service has been friendly, and the new interior is kept clean and bright. I like. 

As others have mentioned, there is often a delay in service, however. This Wendy's hasn't quite figured yet how to put the fast in fast-food, so while we could all benefit from learning to slow down a bit, sometimes haste is in order. Nowhere else is that more true than in a fast-food joint. Once that element is figured out here, an easy 4-star joint.

text:
Super busy Mc D in a very packed part of town. I wish they had someone full-time assigned to the diner/eating area because they all were stuck behind the counter and I had to ask someone to come wipe off a table. I get surprised to see some customers sit at dirty tables with no problem. I just can't do it. So the gal comes out and starts sweeping, the place was super busy and super messy. There was a long row of tables, you know the ones, all connected with many spots to sit. Six of them had dirty, crumbs, grime, napkins, straw wrappers, food remnants - just assign someone to the diner for their entire shift. So the gal comes out, and begins sweeping and taking care of the full trash bin. So I have to go back up and ask someone to come wipe down a table. I spotted a rag I almost just did it myself. I wish there was a priority list too, for employees: when you go in to clean up the diner do these jobs in this order: wipe tables, clean up floor, clean up drink station area, empty trash...

Anyways, thanks for lunch it was fresh, hot and yummy per Mc D usual.

text:
Just happened to be working in the area and really needed some chow.  While on the way to our destination given the short amount of time we needed to be there and the direction we were going, we ended up at this location.

I have not rolled into a fast food drive-thru in sometime.  I also did not consort the app prior to our arrival.  This was a moment when you see the "Golden Arches" and make a split second decision to visit.

Upon arriving at the squawk box..given the cold tone of the server at the other end, I was filled with dread thinking this is going to be a mistake.  I ordered up a fried chicken sandwich, some fries and a sweet tea.  

Moving on to the next window, my trepidation was confirmed by the blunt, no smile serving clerk taking our money.  This was confirmed by the no smile serving clerk at the next window handing out the meal.

When we arrived at our destination and I reached into the bag for my meal, I found the fries and sweet tea to be all that is McDonalds.  Those items built around the centerpiece of the sandwich I so wanted to enjoy.  Just like the robotic order taking, order serving experience I had received, the chicken sandwich had no soul.  I would have derived just as much pleasure eating the wrapper it came in.

Shame on you McDonald's location and shame on me.  Given the geographical location, I should have known better.  But mark my words........I WILL NEVER COME BACK!

text: I cannot even believe I'm lodging this #firstworldprobs complaint but like I'm SO ANGRY. Literally every time I come here, this happens: first off, I order the same drink every single time and for some mysterious reason it's a different price each time. (Grande mocha light frap WITH whip). Secondly, I place my order and patiently go over to the side and watch as they make my drink,  call everyone else's name, put my drink down on some counter and about 5-7 minutes later (after they're done chit chatting) realize it's sitting there and finally give it to me. It doesn't matter if it's busy or if there's no one in line, this happens EVERY SINGLE TIME. Third, they almost always forget to put whip on it. I have started leaving about 20 minutes earlier than I need to go grab my drink, yet I am still late to do what I need to do. SORRY THIS IS A RIDICULOUSLY LONG COMPLAINT ABOUT SOME COFFEE but it's expensive and I'm always really god darn nice to them when I should be sassy. So there.
name: Starbucks

text: Great customer service. Nice and newer store. I just wish it was easier to get out of the parking lot.
name: Starbucks

text: Loud, dirty toilets and tables poor parking. I have had a poor experience with lack of toilet paper. Dangerous take out with cars not paying attention to those crossing drive. Great for 15 year olds. Over 60 consider some place else
name: Starbucks

text: If I could give this location a worse rating I would. The fact that all was ordered between my father and I was a frappe and a red eye  is what makes this worse. Half of the order made its way out just fine but then we are standing where we are to pick up coffee and everyone around us is getting their coffees. No one had asked us if we were waiting on anything or something like that. Terrible customer service. And when we mentioned that we were waiting on something the gentleman that took our order didn't remember what was ordered. From there they made the drink wrong. Terrible customer service, poor knowledge of coffee.
name: Starbucks

text: The coconut milk in my drinks tasted watered down. The girls were rude and in no way friendly. I'd rather travel the hour home to my moms and go there than go to this Starbucks which is literally within walking distance.
name: Starbucks

text:
Starbucks are two kinds, Starbucks and Starbucks Reserve. Starbucks Reserve is usually a larger store that offers more specialty coffees selection. Most importantly, they have a Clover coffee machine that makes my favorite late-night drink, decaf Sumatra. After brewing coffee via Clover, the coffee grounds will appear on the top much like a brownie, so cool!. I have to confess that I'm officially a Starbucks addict. Simply because I'm a dark roast coffee dude. And it's hard to find non-chain coffee shops that offer good dark roast coffee. 

About this Starbucks Reserve branch in Wexford, PA, it has the potential to be one of the best Starbucks branches. However, the slow WiFi internet destroys the experience for me. It's relatively new, spacious and beautifully decorated. It has so many seats that fit all occasions including small events. Parking, hours and getting to this location are so convenient. For the decor and facility, I give it 4.5 stars. After trying them three times, I can't come back because their google Starbucks WiFi is the slowest I have ever encountered. Another thing, the service and baristas seem unpredictable.  One guy was extremely friendly and helpful and later a lady and a guy were the exact opposite!. 

If you don't care about using internet WiFi or a snippy attitude from the baristas, this is a wonderful location!.
name: Starbucks

text: One of my favorite Starbucks- staff are always extremely friendly and very quick with orders. Also a great place to go for studying or work- there is plenty of seating. They keep the temp at a good level. Music tends to be a little loud- but it helps drown out other people. If you don't want to sit at a table, there are four comfy leather chairs available.
name: Starbucks

text:
This Starbucks location has tempted me off my work commute more than once, particularly on mornings where I'm in desperate need of a caffeine fix. Pro tip: Just say no.

I've tried the drive through twice. I've stopped by during a morning rush, so that complicates things, sure. But my order was wrong both times and the wait was more than 10 minutes each time too. The first time I came here I ordered an iced coffee. Instead I got a cold press coffee (there's a difference!) and I was never asked if I wanted cream. Also, a cold press costs at least $1 more than iced coffee. The second time I ordered a grande sized drink but was given a tall, and I still paid the grande price. Starbucks is overpriced nonsense as is -- why pay even more?

I went inside once and my drink was fine, but the service was still painfully slow.

Go somewhere else. Even if it's another Starbucks location. Just don't go here. It's been a disappointment every time. I drive by this place everyday and I won't be stopping anymore.
name: Starbucks

text:
I have never in my life been dissatisfied with a Starbucks until I visited the Wexford, PA location.

Upon walking in, there was a horrible smell much like cow manure. I thought it was maybe isolated to the entrance area, but no. The entire store smelled awful. The employee taking our order was talking in goofy voices and accents and laughing as if it were funny, interrupting us while we tried to tell him our order. My boyfriend waited for the two coffees we ordered while I went to the restroom, which was even worse. There was trash all over the floor, a scum like substance on the wall, and it smelled even worse than the rest of the store. When I returned back to the front of the store, the coffees still were not ready. We ordered two iced coffees, each with almond milk. Nothing complicated. We continued to stand and wait while two employees socialized, the employee taking orders kept goofing off, a worker near the back room screamed at someone on the phone, and someone in a yellow t-shirt and jeans made himself coffee behind the counter. After a while, the mysterious man in a yellow shirt that did not in the slightest resemble an employee asked what we were waiting on. He then told one of the socializing girls who proceeded to get our half made drinks that were sitting on the back counter the whole time. She then poured milk that was sitting on the counter into both coffees. In fact, all of the milks were sitting out. Without lids. And there were crumbs and food all over the counters. This place was so filthy and disgusting that we threw the coffees away. Which we had to do outside because all of the trash cans in the store were overflowing onto the floor, appearing not to have been changed all week.

Do yourself a favor and DO NOT COME HERE. There are plenty of other Starbucks locations around that will have much better service, a cleaner atmosphere, and better quality food and drinks.
name: Starbucks

text:
I was in the area and needed a drink bad.
The store I thought was on the bigger side compared to some of the other Starbucks.
This location has plenty of seating as well.
I had a treat green tea lemonade.
The baristas where very friendly and fast and efficient.
I got my drink very fast and it was made perfectly.
If I was in the area I would go there again.
name: Starbucks

text: Terrible customer service. My drink is always wrong. Rude and completely clueless employees who can't comprehend a simple request. Given them multiple chances. Never going back.
name: Starbucks

text: This place sucks. They didn't have Diet Coke. Instead of giving us other options, she kept saying no until we guessed a drink that they had. The guessing game was kinda fun but still the worst McDonald's I've ever been to. Every time the service sucks and the drive thru takes a minimum of 12 minutes. text:
McDonald's sure isn't doing a good job at this location.  Located on the corner of Park Road and Woodlawn shared with the Pop Shoppe and a gas station, you would think this location would see a lot of customers in turn be well organized and friendly. Definitely not the case. This could be one of the dirtiest McDonald's I have seen with an unfriendly staff to go along with it.  
I stopped in for a breakfast sandwich meal, sausage egg and cheese on an English muffin. After waiting over 15 minutes for my meal I discovered the English muffin wasn't even toasted, cold out of the bag, and the cheese wasn't melted. The breakfast sandwich was just thrown together.  In addition, while I waited for my order I filled my drink, ugh! Was of the dirtiest soda dispensers...honestly wasn't even sure I wanted to drink it. And, it is so old that the large cups don't even fit their machine.
With that said this is definitely a McDonald's I will not be visiting again..

text:
What can I say but that I've been here 7 times and I haven't walked away without any food once again so shame on me for giving them a chance over and over again. 

Tonight after 11pm as usual they said they're only serving drinks and fries and the other 6 times I've been there is always an excuse about why I can't order food so I have to drive over to Wendy's. 

Let me remind you this is on Park Rd. A place where great business and good quality people thrive. But then again there is  nothing but a bunch of young workers outside smoking cigarettes and too lazy to do their job but not too lazy to hang out with their friends that came to "parking lot pimp."

I barley write yelp reviews but I just don't understand how a business can function this way. Anyways good luck to management and also to everyone that works there. 

One little opinion won't matter, let's not forget this is corporate and not an independent business so we know there is no pride taken.

text: I don't normally go to this and I'm reminded of why every single time I do. They seem to always be out of my tea and when they are out of my tea, which is the only thing I order, I ask for hot water with honey so I can use my tea bags  (Starbucks tea bags I purchased for just such a situation) I always seem to get attitude for it. I think a hot cup of water with some honey is the least I can get after always managing to be stuck in their drive-through for no less than 20 minutes. even at 10 in the morning on a Tuesday when half the world is at work and normally wouldn't  be in the Starbucks line anyways. I know it's not their fault that they're out, it's corporate's fault, but a little smile and some hot water without attitude doesn't seem too much to ask for.

text:
How can you go wrong with Starbucks in general? I like the remodeling that they have done to this location. Service has always been great for me. The thing that is that the drinks are inconsistent. I only ever get one drink - iced caramel macchiato. And sometimes there's barely any caramel at all.  For a drink that had "caramel" in the title, it should definitely taste like it. Sometimes my drink tastes mostly like milk, and sometimes the espresso is overwhelming. Bacon gouda sandwiches (although frozen) are so good!  This is my go-to for a quick pick-me-up before work. 

Just an FYI- it's usually much quicker if you go inside. The drive-thru line was insane last time I was here, so I went inside. I was in and out in 2 minutes!

text: This is my to go to Starbucks from Providence. Convenient best location: I grab coffee then run errands close to Wells Fargo, Smith, Dog Store, Wax, Haircut, and plenty of other stores! The staff here are always in a good mood and cheerful. The person at the window often asks how your day is going and wishes you to have fun at work! I like her! I hardly go inside unless the drive thru is really long. But the inside is not as big, very clean, and plenty of seats in and a few outside. I recently tried the Zombie Frappuccino. Let me tell you it isn't for everyone, the purple cream on top was good tart flavor, make sure to mix your drink before sipping, it's hard to explain but it taste like green apple but sweet. I would give this drink 6/10. It's good to try but not addictive enough to repurchase again and again.
