text: I gotta say, I've never had the satisfaction of feeding my concerning caffeine addiction, and laying my eyes on the most attractive man to ever step foot in the establishment at the same time. As I walked up to order my coffee, I was met with the most gorgeous eyes in the Las Vegas Valley. I glanced down to see his name tag. Nolen. Wow... Nolen. I always heard about "Love at first sight," in the story books, but it was always a fairy tale to me. Now? My entire world is changed. Nolen has stolen my heart, and not a day goes by that I don't think about the way he caresses those flavor pumps as he crafts frappacinos with nothing but pure perfection. Get your coffee from Nolen. It'll change your life.

text: I used to come to this location daily when I lived in the area a few years back. I have to admit, it's gone downhill. The service is kind of standoffish now, and the store is always messy. Straw wrappers and other trash litter the floor, the pick up counter looks like it hasn't been wiped down all day. The drive thru and lobby were not busy, but that doesn't mean they weren't still recovering from a large pop of business. My drink did come up fast, and was delicious, as I have come to expect from any Starbucks. Also, there was a rather large delivery blocking most of the path to the messy bathrooms. I was in around 4pm, so I doubt the delivery just came in.  Not the best representation of the company, that's for sure.

text:
Before ordering, I asked the person taking my order if he knew how to make a Cherry Blossom Frappucino. Before he could respond, the lady in the back insisted that Starbucks doesn't make that drink in the US and that it's only available in Japan, and proceeds to tell me that she's worked at Starbucks for 4 years and knows more than I do, even though I've personally ordered the drink several times, both during the spring promotion back in March and after the promotion was over (as a custom drink). She kept insisting that they can't make it, and even as I tried to suggest to her how the drink is made, she responded with "that hardly sounds like a Cherry Blossom Frap", which is comical because for someone who has never made that drink (since apparently it's only available in Japan), she suddenly knows exactly how it's made?! 
I then opened up the Starbucks promotion announcement of the drink, directly from the Starbucks website, and read it aloud to her, recipe and all, to which she replied "oh... that drink". And even then she still gave me a hard time, saying how they're out of this ingredient and that sauce, and that it's not gonna taste the same. I said that's fine, so she proceeded to tell the guy taking my order how to make the drink. They were too busy arguing with me about the drink that they didn't even bother to ask me about the size, so they rung me up for a grande when I wanted a venti. When I saw her making the drink with a grande cup, I told her that I wanted a venti, and AGAIN she gave me a hard time about it, saying that the other guy rung me up for a grande, and even pointed at the label on the cup, and because of that she can't change it. I reminded her that I paid for the drink with a free drink reward so it doesn't matter what the size is, and she quickly changed her tone and asked if I wanted a venti instead (obviously?). I watched her like a hawk while she was making the drink to make sure she didn't do anything funny, and she knew it too - every time she turned around and saw me looking at her she got super nervous. She handed me the drink without a single apology, thank you, or greeting of any kind. 

Unfortunately I didn't get her name, but every time I've been to this location they've either given me a hard time because of my order, given me a bad attitude, screwed up my drink, or all of the above. Not to mention, the tables are always sticky and the floors are always full of trash. Not sure what is going on with the management here, but I've made it a point not to come back to this location anymore.

text:
Don't even know where to start....

Went to this Starbucks with my wife and child after a school meeting.  Thought it would be good to pass by for a drink for my wife.  So I asked the wife and said she would love to get her usual drink.  Got to the window and a man asked "how can I help you", so I ordered a "Iced decaf vanilla bean coconut milk latte ". Then I said, "tall size please".  Then he ask, "oh you didn't want Venti?"  So i decided to repeat the whole order again because it's the 3rd time I come to this Starbucks and they try to sell me a Venti when I am asking for a tall.  So I thought to myself let me repeat myself, maybe I am saying something wrong.  Half way repeating myself a women, interrupts me and says, "no one is asking you for the order, he only wants to know what size you want".  My wife and I looked at each other and stayed in shock on how rude that person was being.  So I drove up to the window and there she was the girl with the attitude.  I asked her are you the one that cut me off rudely?  She said, "yes you intimated my employee and we're yelling".  I said, "excuse me and looked to my wife, and asked my wife did I ever yell?"  Then she went on being defensive and told me I could leave and she wouldn't be selling me anything.  Then I said, no worries I will contact your district manager and let her know what is going on with this bad service.  Then she had the guts to say, "my name is Chase, everyone knows me, I'm the only chase here, call who ever you want, I'm not selling you anything."  

I am simply amazed of this bad service.  My wife was in shock with the ugly service we received.  This is a perfect example of how not to treat a customer.  No worries I will make it a point to take this to the top!

text:
Have you tried the new chicken sausage and bacon biscuit from Starbucks yet!?!

I know what you're thinking, "mm tell me about it.."
I'll feed ya baby bird lol. 

In between two warm and fluffy buttery biscuits is a perfect pairing of a chicken sausage patty topped with with savory bacon. They alone are enough to send your taste buds on a tantalizing trip down memory lane. But as though that wasn't enough to send a wave of delight reverberating through your mouth, BAM! What is that?!! Holy geez it's fuggin gravy! No it can't be!! Yes, my friend. It is. Taking that billy bob right to the kisser is precisely what anyone needs in the morning. All those rich flavors dancing like lil sprites from the  tip of your tongue down to the warmth of your soul. At this moment, I am content.

text:
Never in my life have I ever dealt with extremely poor customer service, by a Starbucks worker allowing a customer to keep harassing me over what I was in the wrong for. I brought my service dog in and another one I was training. I didn't put them on leashes, due to the fact I wanted to get in and out quick, with my reusable drink cup. The few times I have done this, NO ONE complained. Except for this older woman who WOULD NOT let me finish my order.

She complained first time with an attitude and I told her, just let me get what I need and I'm out of here. Not even two minutes later, she's harassing me again. About them all over people; yet the funny thing, the people, my two went to visit were not complaining about it and simply happy. I lost it and yelled in that woman's face and cursing her out. I have been having a bad week and my mental issues were getting the best of me.

Worst thing was the smug look on that older woman's face, as she got the reaction she wanted out of me. Next thing I know the worker behind the register who did NOTHING to tell the woman to stop and let me finish my order. Asks me to leave and refunds my money. I leave there humiliated and extremely upset; that my friends who I called had to make sure I was mental stable and okay.

I can not believe that I got punish for a customer sticking her nose in and policing me. When it should have been the manager. But the fact that that worker didn't not tell the older woman to stop and let me finish; hurts me even more.

I've lost complete faith, respect and trust in this company.

If I was that worker, I would have told that older woman to shut up and if it bothered her that much to get the manager to handle the problem.

Again I know what I was in the wrong for, but I didn't deserve this harassment and to get kicked out for yelling and cursing at the person bothering me. I do not even care if that woman was related to the worker or not. She is not a manager of the store and a customer and should know her place.

text: Even though the place is small, the service was great, the staff is extremely nice, too bad I don't live near by.
name: Starbucks

text: They were out of... iced.coffee. Yes, I ed coffee and they were not nice about it. Just "we don't have any. What else would you like?" Uh, ok.
name: Starbucks

text: I just went thru the drive thru ,and the coffee was extremely cold. The guy at the window didn't seem to be coherent! I am paying $7 for a cold cup of coffee ?? This isn't the first time my coffee is cold.
name: Starbucks

text: This location has pretty much gone down hill through the years in terms of service. The baristas seem like they don't want to be there and who ever is stationed at the register in the morning acts like its a burden that you're ordering coffee so early. Weird.
name: Starbucks

text: Absolutely Love! This Starbucks has a  genuinely charismatic staff, who after a week of continuity going there, remembered my order and began addressing me by my name. I appreciate quality customer service, and these guys got it down! Especially the morning crew :) thank you for your amazing service!
name: Starbucks

text: Clean and quick service. There is a long table to spread out and work or meet friends.  There wasn't a lot of club chair seating when I was there. That would be a nice addition for the future.
name: Starbucks

text: I just made a passing comment after ordering two coffees (one cold brew and one hot) that they both were for me but it was for my road trip and the sweetest girl at the register wrote me a little note! I didn't catch her name but she has brown hair and was wearing red lipstick. It's the little things in life that count
name: Starbucks

text: Typically stop by this location after the movies or meeting with my photographers. The staff is friendly and doesn't really bother you. They have a nice long table that more than one person can sit at or (like me) for one person to take up the whole table with school work. :-( Overall the location is clean, staff is super friendly, and the artwork throughout is nice.
name: Starbucks

text: Impossibly slow! I feel sorry or the kid who was making drinks.  He only has two hands and there were seven of us waiting for drink. Tell the kid filling bottles to step up and help out. And, oh yeah. The chick at the register can make drinks too right?
name: Starbucks

text: I come here everyday. The baristas are all very friendly and always recognize us when we walk in. The manager John is very nice. They always have our mobile orders ready when we walk in. Never had an issue here. Will continue to come back!
name: Starbucks

text: If your ordering via mobile app be sure to repeat your name over and over again to the barista upon arrival. Placed my order via mobile app when I arrived I gave my name, and the barista said my order wasn't ready, and 10 drinks later my drink was sitting next to her the whole time!!!!! It only took to seconds to look up at the previous orders made to check correctly for my name. Now I'm late to work!
name: Starbucks

text: Love using the mobile app...  Run in, grab your drink, and on my way!  I stop in before I head to work.  I have been ordering so frequently that they know my drink, know my name, and know what I look like. I walk in and I hear good morning, Judy!  The staff here is awesome!
name: Starbucks

text: This is my favorite coffee shop an is always nice people working there, I  like  passion ice tea,
name: Starbucks

text:
This is the worst Starbucks on this end of town. The employees are always rude (except for Ricky). They usually don't chitchat, or even say hi. On my last visit, I don't think anyone even made eye contact. There's often a long line in the morning. 

If I were you, I'd just drive to the Starbucks at 99th & Lower Buckeye.
name: Starbucks

text: Finally a decent experience here in Avondale. The Java Chip Frap was made quickly despite some annoying people in line ahead of me at 8pm.  The drink hit the spot after a long sweaty day of work. Some people though seemed to be loitering at the tables outside and inside. How much time can you really spend at Starbucks before becoming creepy guy? Anyway, won't be back in Avondale, but will get this drink again somewhere else.
name: Starbucks

text: This is a busy little store with small seating area. This is more of a grab and go store due to size. There are only 2 small tables and a medium size table and all feel like cramped. The staff is friendly and always busy here.  The location is convenient and right next to The grocery store. I always stop here on way into work.
name: Starbucks

text: Worst cappuccino ever. Burnt flavor and they made it twice. Way to throw $4 down the toilet. If they can't train people to do it right then don't waste your time. McDonald's coffee is better then this.
name: Starbucks

text: The staff is usually nice but sometimes they are very sarcastic and annoying and it seems like they don't wanna be there.
name: Starbucks

text:
I like this location, takes forever to get out of the driveway but the line for drive through is quick. This was the first one that I saw that had the video on the screen outside that was cool.

This space is smaller but the service is always quick and friendly and the drinks are consistently good. 

Also I like that they sometimes do special stuff like for a while you could upgrade to trenta iced coffee for free that was sweet.
name: Starbucks

text: Sorry Starbucks but I liked this store much better when it was Caribou Coffee.  They were heads and shoulders above you guys.  Better coffee, better food, better atmosphere, and most importantly,  superior customer service.  Thankfully I can still buy Caribou for my home brewer!
name: Starbucks

text: Not enough seating and too many people sitting around that haven't purchased anything.  Looks like a study hall inside.
name: Starbucks

text: I just got my secret menu item. The Chunky Monkey Frappuccino. You will not be disappointed when you get this drink.  I loved it. Please see the picture for the ingredients.  The staff was extremely friendly and very fast service.
name: Starbucks

text: Ive always had great courteous service inside or drive Thru. Orders are always correct and the staff is always helpful.  Great indulgence close to home but it is a bit difficult to get in or out in high traffic times on such a main road.
name: Starbucks

text: This was a very decent Starbucks as they managed to get my drinks/orders right every time I was here.  The drive thru line was incredibly slow, however.  They had a sign about trying to make it "the fastest around" asking customers to have their money ready, etc.  Sorry folks, but the slowness on Starbuck'd ..not the customers.  My drink seemed to take forever once I got to the window.
name: Starbucks

text: Disappointed waited in drive thru way too long but get it that they were having some issue.  Then the coffee was luke warm. Had to turn around and park, go inside to get a hot coffee.  For the price really need to make sure coffee is right the first time.
name: Starbucks

text: Fast moving Starbucks. It's in the same building as a Chipotle. It's on a very busy portion of Bagley Rd. Drive thru. Limited interior seating. This Starbucks is always fast with a friendly staff. They have a Clover, which is a coffee making master machine!
name: Starbucks

text:
Stopped in here on very cold and snowy morning to get some coffee.

This Starbucks is physically connected to the same building a Chipotle is in. Several folks walked up expecting to enter Starbucks - but were trying the door to Chipotle.

Service was prompt, coffee was strong and good.

There is not a lot of interior seating here - so beware. All of the seating was being utilized while we were there. Including something I've never seen before - 3 of the tables had "Reserved" placards on them. There is some limited seating outside - but it was closed down due to the frigid temperatures and snow.

#Starbucks
name: Starbucks

text: Drinks made and ready from leaving the house near greenbriar middle school. We were able to hop on the highway and drive to Columbus, well caffeinated. Exactly what I needed! Venti skinny cinnamon dolce latte no whip, no cinna crumbs,  almond milk, quad and a pumpkin latte quad no whip.
name: Starbucks

text: Thank goodness this is here!!! Why did it take so long to get a Starbucks on Bagley Road?  Great staff and... DRIVE-THRU!!!! Need I say more?
name: Starbucks

text:
Resident Starbucks guru here....gracing his presence into the reviews of this location. Ok ok....really people, I am not full of myself. But it is super fun to try and be anyways! I digress, this isn't about me, this is about Starbucks....my love. My life partner. My simpatico. So, onto the review.

I cannot say that I am a huge fan of this location, nor can I say that I do not like it. I am very sorta in the middle. First, the parking at this location is an absolute NIGHTMARE. Whoever had the grand idea of putting a Chipotle and Starbucks in a plaza alone together....must have been a functioning alcoholic. Two places that draw large crowds shoved into small spaces and equally as small parking lots? I THINK NOT! Not to mention, this is on a BUSY main road....which means getting in and out of here can cause you to draw up your last will and testament. 

Of course, they have coffee. Lovely, beautiful, sexy and delicious coffee. My order was correct and the staff here was friendly. They do not have a very large selection of snacks or Starbucks gear....so if this matters to you, look to another location. The store is small....like small small. If you are looking to sit and work in peace, it isn't gonna happen amigo!

The have a nice little patio outside but only has a few tables to sit at. I mean to be fair, there are only a few tables inside too. Did I mention this location is small? All in all, I would come to this location if I had no other option.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks is close to my house, so I thought why not?! I can get a good drink, a few snacks if need be and study for an exam. Mind you when I say that I am studying, I do not anticipate complete silence, I cannot focus and complete silence and need a little bit of background noise while I focus. I will tell you while in this location, I was unable to focus at all!  The staff was extremely loud and unprofessional. It was memorial day so there were NO customers. I was literally the only one sitting inside and I can tell you all 4 employees where extremely loud blurting out rude comments, talking about customers and cackling. One employee was literally yelling and the others just laughed. No one ever said hey dude keep it down there's a customer in the store, they all just fed into his immature nonsense. The worst part of all of this is there was a supervisor in the store because I heard him saying to the other employees "hey don't talk to me like that I'm your supervisor!" Yet he could not manage the conduct of his employees while a customer was in the store. I left after 25 minutes of sitting down because I could not deal with the immaturity any longer. I am in my late 20's so I'm not old, but this group was very young and immature. I am very disappointed I won't step foot back in the Starbucks or spend another dollar there! So annoyed!!!!
name: Starbucks

text: This used to be one of my favorite Starbucks, but they need to step their game up. Just walked out because there were only two people behind the counter and about six people waiting for drinks. It was also a long wait the last time I popped in with only a couple people making drinks and one of them was in training. I'll be back in a couple days and hopefully I will be able to add a star or two to my rating!
name: Starbucks

text:
I love this Starbucks! I am a regular and have a pretty specific order, they are always attentive and make it right everytime! I know some people will complain that there is no drive thru which can be a bit of an inconvenience sometimes but that doesn't change my opinion of this location!

The baristas are very friendly as well and seem to remember me each time I come in which is such a great feeling! Yes, they get a rush and you will have to wait but that's life! Be nice to them! :)
name: Starbucks

text: Guaranteed slowest service inside and in the drive thru
name: Starbucks

text: Waited 15 minutes in line with 3 people and it didn't move at all. Had to leave the line to get to work on time.
name: Starbucks

text: Probably the worst Starbucks in the world. The wait is usually like 30 minutes. Every one working there looks like a complete train wreck. So I gave mobile ordering a try to avoid the wait. That's also ineffective. Stood there waiting for 20 minutes because my "order was lost". Get your shit together. These people need more training.
name: Starbucks

text: This is the best Starbucks around.  They are very friendly and I seen them deal with bad customers.  The girls work fast and there coffee is great. You can't go wrong with a visit here.
name: Starbucks

text:
I travel a lot and have been to Starbucks locations across the country from Manhattan to Spokane, WA.  This is a good one.  

I have only three words for you "nitro cold brew."

I don't typically get fancy drinks. I get espresso (which don't get me started on Starbucks espresso...), iced coffee, iced tea, and occasionally black coffee.  The fact that this location has the nitro draws me out of my way to visit. (I know there is at least one other location in Cleveland, but I've only seen it at a Grand Junction, CO location) I actually like Starbucks nitro cold brew a little better than Phoenix (but I much prefer Phoenix espresso.) 

This new location is bright and airy, but the reflectivity of the high ceiling can make it a little loud there at times. The seating area is nice and the bar seating is a nice touch The staff is typically lovely and pleasant. The only things that would make this location better is a little acoustic treatment and Reserve status with the Clover brewer.
name: Starbucks

text: Ok here it is .... I really don't know what more I can say I'm running out of all great things to say.. I truly love and consider all the baristas my friends, they truly make my day, I look forward everyday to see their beautiful faces. Even if i send one of my kids to get me coffee they make sure to write a personal note on my cup.  They go out of their way to teach the new baristas my drink , you want your drink done right by the most friendly people you are ever going to meet and an atmosphere that is super friendly and cool i suggest coming here.
name: Starbucks

text: Omg My daughter went to Starbucks to get a cup of coffee , The next thing I know she's giving me this thing that looks like a shake and says that I made a mistake I ordered the wrong one." one sip of this green tea Frappuccino and I was hooked "I never buy coffee from coffee shops before now every time she wants to go I'm like oh yeah get me one of Those large green tea Frappuccinos

text: I can't even believe what just happened at this chipotle. I love chipotle and I'm kinda bummed at how I was treated. I ordered 2 bowls and 1 bowl with rice and beans (just 2 sides) and the guy charged me for a bowl. No big deal I corrected him and said it was 2 sides. He argued with me and told me it was a veggie bowl in front of a whole line because I had black and pinto beans. I specifically asked the girl to mix the two beans half and half to make one side. I had very very little food because I was not that hungry but he didn't want to be wrong and embarrassed me. Finally he saw I was right and tried to say this time it was ok (like he was doing me a favor) at that point my appetite was gone. Like really who lies about a 6 dollar bowl? The worst part is my son was so embarrassed he walked out and I had to go find him. Thanks chipotle for killing my afternoon and making my son sad. I do appreciate the lady who worked there and apologized to me on behalf of the guy who caused the scene and also the manager who gave me some coupons (although I didn't want to accept them because I didn't want anything for feee) all I want is for people to treat others with respect and to listen. Ask questions don't assume everyone is out to get something free.

text:

I almost always order with the app that way there's no long line to stand in and the food is ready when we get there. Don't expect your food to be ready at pick up time, expect them to start making it at that time. Also, if you use the app be as detailed as possible in the comment/notes section if you like your food a certain way.

text:
While I enjoy chipotle way more frequently than is should, this location happens to be the closest to me and is mediocre at best.  The food taste just like any other chipotle and the portions are well the same so no argument there.  

The 2 star review comes down to the line constantly being out the door and the staff not able to move it quickly like other chipotles.  I understand there is a lunch and dinner time rush but this has never effected any other chipotle I've been to.  

My least favorite part of this location and the main reason for the low review is the online ordering.  While the app is very easy to use and says exactly what you want on the order and even on the receipt here I am yet again with another messed up order that I just picked up.  If this were the first time I could get over it however I have NEVER, and that is a true fact, never received a correct online order that is spelled out on the receipt in front of them. name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text: I am Celiac.  Eating out can be a scary, challenging thing.  When I told the server at Chipotle that I needed my food gluten free it was taken very seriously.  My order was taken, the server stripped off her gloves, thoroughly washed her hands and put on fresh gloves.  I then watched in humble amazement as fresh bins of salsa, guacamole and lime cilantro rice were brought out and scooped with fresh spoons.  Meticulous care was taken from beginning to end.  I had the bowl with the aforementioned ingredients as well as chicken and a little cheese.  It was delicious.  It's a "you pick" situation where you create the combination you want.  What a treat!  Thanks, Chipotle.

text: I love eating at Chipotle. I love the convenience and the close location. However, this particular location has gone way downhill. When I first starting coming here, the employees were attentive, on task, and always got orders done in a timely and correct manner. The employees that work there now are terrible. The girls up front were having their own loud conversation and not paying attention to the people taking their orders. When one girl asked me what I wanted, I told her, and instead of finishing it, she loaded the bowl with sour cream and left. The second girl who came to pick up on my order proceeded to drench my bowl with more sour cream, and when she saw what she had done, she just covered it with the remaining stuff. She then did not listen to what I asked for on my two burritos, and added whatever she thought was correct. The girl at the register charged me for an extra quesadilla and was more concerned with carrying out the conversation with the other girls up front. Also, another girl swiped rice that was scattered all over the counter back into the tray of rice. Very unsanitary. The employees here are not very skilled in customer service or doing their job, especially in a timely manner. This location has a lot of work to do.

text:
Well, visiting this lovely town for the first time, I decided to visit this chain for the first time. Once I entered, I thought I should leave. The background music was sooo loud, I knew I would be lost. I lost most of my hearing in Viet Nam. Although I wear hearing aids, not supplied by VA, I thought I should try it.  Hey, I should order the features. Can't go wrong. Wrong, the First Lady started asking questions, I stated I can not hear you.  Well, I have no idea what was on me burrito, but I Doubt it's what I
Like.  I was correct.  I got this giant burrito, but no idea what was in it.  At checkout I tried ordering chips & salsa, but again
Music tooooo loud.
The burrito was OK, no idea what meat was in it.  The chips wayyyyy too salty.  My first time at the chain, and my last. They must cater to the younger crowd that can hear. Tooo bad.  I love Mexican style food and spicy, but I need to know what you are fixing me when I am trying to order.
The burrito was JUST OK, but I make better
Sorry Chipolte. Been wanting to try. 
Music tooooo loud to know what's going on, or what I really ordered.

text: Chipotle what is up with your new radio advertisements? I love eating at chipotle. The food is always fresh and tasty but with the recent bad press you've gotten I don't understand why you would choose to run the radio advertisements I have been hearing lately. The advertisement I'm talking about is the one where the narrator explains chicken or beans to the listener as though we are stupid. This does not seem like a very smart marketing strategy. I do not appreciate being talked down to and I'm pretty sure other people feel the same way. I'm disappointed in this decision because I love eating at chipotle restaurants . I have been concerned because I have heard rumors that chipotle may be shutting down due to recent bad press . I don't think this new marketing campaign is going to help the situation . Your customers are intelligent we are not idiots and I do not appreciate the tone of your new commercials. Please get some better marketing and stay in business . I do not like to imagine a world where I cannot buy your chips and guacamole!

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
While I enjoy chipotle way more frequently than is should, this location happens to be the closest to me and is mediocre at best.  The food taste just like any other chipotle and the portions are well the same so no argument there.  

The 2 star review comes down to the line constantly being out the door and the staff not able to move it quickly like other chipotles.  I understand there is a lunch and dinner time rush but this has never effected any other chipotle I've been to.  

My least favorite part of this location and the main reason for the low review is the online ordering.  While the app is very easy to use and says exactly what you want on the order and even on the receipt here I am yet again with another messed up order that I just picked up.  If this were the first time I could get over it however I have NEVER, and that is a true fact, never received a correct online order that is spelled out on the receipt in front of them.  My daughter ordered a chicken quesadilla kids mean with white rice and pinto beans like always.  We paid the extra for the chicken.  And we have no chicken and one scoop of rice for a kids meal. I reviewed the receipt and it's all there just not in our bag.  

If the surprise location could get their employees to move quicker and actually read what they're making this place would be so much better.  Hopefully a manager will read this and take note.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text: Normally I go to a different chipotle location, but I was on my way home and driving right by so I stopped. You would think that during a dinner rush there would be adequate amounts of food prepped or least enough on the line to feed the long line that I had to wait in. I asked for 2 burrito bowls, easy enough right? Nooope. They were out of fajita veggies, barbacoa, sour cream, guacamole and chips! They gave me very little rice and meat and when I asked for a little more they said they were going to have to double charge me. And the line was incredibly dirty there was a white film all over the counter and they were throwing food around so fast and sloppily that cheese got into one of the bowls and in my salsa. I'm allergic to dairy so I ended up not being able to use salsa on my bowl. I ended up having to wait 15 minutes for chips to come out and by the time I got the chips and got home, my food was cold and had to be reheated. Won't be going back to this location. Very unsatisfied.

text: I have been coming to this location for a couple of yrs now. I go out of my way because I like the employees. I think I need to rethink that. It has come to my attention that this location and maybe others seem to think these hard working and dedicated employees can survive on less than 20 hrs per wk. I don't know where mngment live but I am pretty sure they wouldn't be paying their rent on hrs such as this. So I don't believe Chipotle deserves my loyalty as a customer nor should I be recommending them to my friends and coworkers as a place to get a great meal. If they plan on expanding as much as the news says they are. They will faill as they won't have anyone to work there. If my employer cut my hrs in half and still expected me to travel half way across town and have a smile on my face. I WOULD ENCOURAGE ANYONE WHO IS TREATED THAT BADLY AS A LOYAL AND DEDICATED EMPLOYEE TO TAKE YOUR SKILLS TO ANOTHER ESTABLISHMENT THAT WOULD APPRECIATE YOU. Goodbye Chipotle it was great eating while it lasted but without great employers your just another greedy corporation that doesn't deserve my or anyones patronage.

text: Great location, fast friendly service.  Always what I ordered......
name: Starbucks

text:
Starbucks is a staple. I love the coffee and hate the prices.... Most people feel the same. 
Service is usually quick. Occasionally they get backed up, but that's what happens when the person I front of you orders a triple double vente mocha latte with soy and whipped cream on the side...omg! What is that?
name: Starbucks

text: I know it's a Starbucks...but I've been doing random work here recently and it is conveniently located, has great wifi, and really really friendly staff and customers. Lots of power outlets for laptop work too. It definitely gets packed (and a lot of tweens go there after school ~3pm-4pm), but is lovely nonetheless. Much bigger than the starbz in Solon.
name: Starbucks

text: The Starbucks in Chagrin Falls has such a perfect location in town (right next to the falls!) and has some incredible staff members, but it's such a small shop that it's not ideal for working or sitting down to chat. Wish that they were able to expand in some way to allow for more seating.
name: Starbucks

text: This place is convenient to my work. But honestly there is always an issue, today there was no cold brew. I guess I'm confused how you are out of all cold brew coffee at a coffee house. People are not that friendly either.
name: Starbucks

text:
Even though this Starbucks is constantly packed, it is a great neighborhood Starbucks. You forget it's a chain when you walk in and the employees know the familiar faces and have a conversation with you instead of just taking your order and moving on super fast. 

Some Starbucks don't make the drinks tastey or strong enough but everytime I come to this branch, they always make them perfectly. From flavor to temperature, they 99.9% hit it right on. 

I love going to this Starbucks located in the heart of chagrin falls. It's an experience, not just a stop.
name: Starbucks

text: My husband picked up a Carmel light frappechino at about 1.30 pm today. I have to say it was the worst drink I have ever had. It was so watered down and he asked do extra Carmel and it was even written down on the cup. Let me tell you there was barely ANY Carmel at all. I don't know if it was a new person or someone was in a hurry to leave. It was absolutely terrible and with it being the venti size it is fairly costly. I think I will probably go out of my way to go to another Starbucks. Very disappointed
name: Starbucks

text: I am not sure why this Starbucks hasn't blown up yet! It is sitting right next to a water fall! You can literally drink your coffee and stare out the window. Super cute town surrounds this Starbucks boasting old hardwood floors and 100 year old doors :) just an all around awesome place. I've even been to the original Starbucks in Washington and this one blows them all away. If you're in Cleveland, oh please make this stop :)
name: Starbucks

text: I honestly think I may give up on this Starbucks...too many misses. Today I ordered a Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Brew and they definitely left out the vanilla syrup as it was super bitter. Unfortunately did not try it until I was back in the road to work. Often out of items...not sure who orders or who's fault that is. Ordered a Bagel with 1 butter and 2 Cream Cheese and got two butters, no Cream Cheese. When I asked at the counter, I got attitude. Agree with some other comments about lack of friendliness. Another time ordered one drink, got a different one. It all adds up...I also think the staff thinks they can act that way because they are the only game in town. Searching for another friendlier coffee house.
name: Starbucks

text:
Not all Starbucks are created equal. 

So, I'm gonna start reviewing them along with my regular grab bag of foodie places. Plus I travel, so I see a lot of Starbucks.  I try to always hit the local places....not always possible. Starbucks is easy to find and familiar.

This Starbucks is located on Main Street in Chagrin Falls, OH.  Super cute town. 

This Starbucks is long, not wide...so it can be tight if they are busy, but there is still ample seating.

Music is a little loud, baristas are pleasant enough, drinks are coming out quick.  Lots of people at tables working.  Actually, all tables are occupied. Customers are not uber friendly...but it is Starbucks.  You are supposed to walk in, look really busy and self concerned, grab your half caff/ iced/soy/hazelnut/latte and jet out to whatever super important thing you are supposed  to look like you are doing.  

I had Teavana Venti Berry Sangria today.  Venti cause I had a lot of work to do and I am on the road traveling. I needed a drink that would cover my long time of occupying a table. (Btw, I am a Teavana fanatic. I have a whole drawer of Teavana tea and paraphernalia at home....go to a Teavana store.  You'll become addicted.)

My drink was good.  A tad to the weak side, but good. 

Until next time, coffee (tea) drinkers.
name: Starbucks

text: Drinks are routinely well made. Staff is efficient but less friendly than I am used to. I think the worst part of this location is that some of the clientele are clearly entitled and are pretty rude.
name: Starbucks

text:
Food: it's Starbucks. You know the deal. If you get a coffee, and ask for it there, get it in a mug! It makes drinks with whipped cream much more enjoyable!

Atmosphere: right next to the literal chagrin falls, you can't go wrong camping out here for an afternoon. Seating is tight, but it has that classic coffee shop vibe. Staff is friendly and place is tidy.
name: Starbucks

text:
I haven't had any problems with this location. They make my drink stronger than the one down the street. I just got one yesterday and it tasted watered down but this location tasted better. I like the employees and they work really fast. I had been when the drive thru was PACKED and went inside and got my order pretty quickly.
They also have the canned refreshers- the other location down the street doesn't have them.
Also it's still brand new and looks fancy, good location and cute outdoor seating :)
name: Starbucks

text: A Starbucks is a Starbucks. Have frequented this one for  several months as a morning walk destination. Place is clean, service is good and the coffee is hot.  They have a couple of low fat breakfast sandwich choices. These are ok...with enough Sriracha hot sauce anything is good. The pay card App gets you instore refills. The drive through is always full but they keep things moving. It's a coffee factory but a successful one
name: Starbucks

text:
Boy did I get a bad vente espresso frappe, tasted odd and had whip cream that I hadn't asked for.   A few sips and up it came, made a mess of my truck and the dress shirt I was wearing.
I didn't go back but the Starbucks at Bell and 3rd St took care of me.  
I won't be back at the Bell and Cave Creek store.
name: Starbucks

text: This is my daily Starbucks as its very close to me. The staff is all very friendly and my drink and food are always correct. The drive thru is a busy one, but they keep it moving and always have a friendly barista at the window!
name: Starbucks

text: Friendly employee in the drive thru. Order was correct and she was friendly and engaging.  Would stop thru again when in the area. Now if only it wasn't 9 million degrees here haha
name: Starbucks

text: Sunday evening I stopped at the fairly new location at Bell Rd and Cave Creek Rd. I had previously gone once before and had no problems. Sunday was different; besides having issues with my Starbucks gift card the drink was just awful!!!! When I asked how much was on the card they told me they were unable to say until I paid in cash. Which I did and they never came back to the window. If there was a problem with the gift card they should have been more helpful and at least returned it. There was not a line in drive through so there was no need to be rude. When I got home my grandson told me he would drink it as I did not want it, it was awful! He took two sips and agreed with me how nasty it was. Train your staff better, customers are not a joke as they help pay your salary. I would recommend some extra training for these two fellows. I am hesitant to even give one star.
name: Starbucks

text: Not to busy on a Friday morning when I walked in.  Was able to get service right away.  Was able to get a Cold Foam Cascara Nitro.  Two other Starbucks I go to do not have the nitro machine so that was awesome.  It was delicious and beautiful to look at!  Only downside (minus one star) is that there are no comfortable seating options.  All hard wooden chairs.
name: Starbucks

text: Took a drink of my ice coffee and almost chocked to death. Not really, but it wasn't fun swallowing this.
name: Starbucks

text: I have come to this location many times before and my drinks have been ok. Today I ordered a hot soy latte in the drive-thru. It was half empty, full of foam, and the milk was wayyyyy hotter then normal. Seriously need to train the baristas better at this location--they have been drinkable before, but today's drink was awful.
name: Starbucks

text: The worst Starbucks ive been to. Had to repeat our order several times and it was still wrong. When we were told the total, the amount was incorrect and we told them that the price did not sound right. They still R & R card for that amount. Then voided it, then ran it again without telling us what the new amount was and what went wrong. Then she argued with us about why she ran the card without talking to us first. I am very disappointed in the service and we will not be returning. I recommend that you go to one of the many other Starbucks available.
name: Starbucks

text:
Awesome customer service! Clean, quick and friendly! Thank you Starbucks  
Would highly recommend stopping by ...... there are Starbucks everywhere, but the employees here are incredible
name: Starbucks

text:
This is by far my least favorite Starbucks I've ever been to. I get a salted caramel frap every time. No special requests, so they should be able to execute it perfectly. I went the first time when they first opened in 2017. It was all ice, almost no flavor and very little liquid. I gave them a few months and tried again thinking they just needed to get into their groove. Same! All ice, no liquid, little flavor. I tried again this morning probably 6 months after my 2nd attempt and SAME. All ice and no flavor!! I know they would say if you don't like it you can ask them to remake it. But as a mom I'm trying to juggle my belongings and a child. I don't critique my drink until I'm in the car and driving away. Also, for a $6 drink they should know how to make, I feel I should be able to trust it's made right. 

Needless to say, 3 strikes and I will not be returning to this Starbucks again.
name: Starbucks

text: Came here for the first time today, and went through the drive through. The wait was a little longer than the usual. When I got to the window I was handed my drinks and told to have a good day, and had to remind them about my food item. The service was good and my drink was perfect. Just make sure you don't drive off without everything you ordered while the iron the kinks out. This location did just open, and it looks like a nice location to sit inside and enjoy your drink or food inside.
name: Starbucks

text: I loved how friendly and fast the service was. I am really happy that they took the time to listen to my order and didn't feel any bit of rush even though they were slammed. This Starbucks store knows how to really operate !
name: Starbucks

text:
Ok. Here goes. I'm pretty fussy as my fellow Yelpers are aware and I have read the negatives posted here. Certainly, why would you spend extra $$$ to get bad anything. Right?

However... I have to single out the most consistent, competent and ridiculously fabulous barista this side of a fashion runway....LONDON!!! Starbucks please take note here...seriously...this girl (London in case you missed it) is the epitome of great service with a smile. Starbucks should clone her as their corporate profits would exponentially skyrocket! Never an off encounter with her. We get her nearly every time at drive thru and not once have we had a less than perfect experience. She even asks in advance if our Maltese Turbo would like a pup cup. It's like reminiscing about how great service used to be. 

We have all had those dead eyed drones serve us with zombie like enthusiasm, but we go actually out of our way to visit this store. Today's grande Pink Drink was perfection. Thanks again for inspiring this review!
name: Starbucks

text: This is MY starbucks. I choose it over the others in the area (and there are many) due to the consistent good service. Not to say I've never had problems, but the employees are always quick to fix any I might have without hassle - very friendly and hardworking group. The place is always clean and orderly. Good place to study.
name: Starbucks

text:
Not much to say about Subway, as they all are pretty much the same, with the same sandwiches, same specials, and the same decor inside but since I usually eat at a Subway 5 days at of the week when I'm at work, I usually come to the same few and the employees are very nice to me. I've never had a bad experience here and the food is always fresh. 

I usually come in early, around 9ish in the morning, so the place is usually very clean, the trash is empty, the restroom is clean and stocked, the bread is freshly made, the veggies/meats/cheeses all look fresh and the employees are all in a good mood. 

Will come back again.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
What can I say? I love me some chipotle! Po-tay-toe Po-ta-toe Chi-Poe-t-lay Chi-pottle lol! Any who, I really love this place it's usually pleasantly packed, empty restaurants usually are bad signs! I enjoy bowls some days, but have to say the burritos are my favorite. 

I know your probably thinking any place can deliver these things and maybe yes, but customization is key my friends! 

Bean juice only, a few beans, double rice, xtra cheese, you name it! 

You can get x amount of salsas.. ON THE SIDE... boom I get a new flavor punch in my mouth with each bit! That you cannot get everywhere. 

The guac rocks! Many places you ask for guacamole, but you get guacamole sauce. What's up with that? Eww, nothing! 

And my most favorite, VIP, yes the feeling of walking in and hitting that immediate right, then left, right to the cashier. Online ordering suckas!!! No wait, and the orders are usually just as if I was behind the counter making them myself!

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
So. 
I love Chipotle.  its one of my very favorite quickie stops for good food that isn't processed all to crap.  

Yesterday, after a super late night out, my husband and I couldn't decide where we wanted to eat.  I said that I thought there was a Chipotle nearby, and so we decided if we saw it before our other choice, we'd go there.  Chipotle won. 

I usually order the burrito bowl with rice, but I am trying to be a bit more health conscious, so yesterday I opted for a salad.  
Now, here's what I don't really understand.  

Other Chipotle spots (not sure about this one) will LOAD you up on rice when making the bowl.  But the salad yesterday...was severely lacking lettuce.  
They were super stingy on the ingredients, and I just don't like that.  I'm not asking for a mountain of food, but when you only give me a tiny tiny scoop of protein (sofritas: YUM), and I have to ask you 3 times for more veggies...something is wrong.  

Flavors were good for me.  Hubby said his chicken in the burrito was flavored really differently yesterday, and he didn't care for it.  Not to mention the fact that they didn't wrap the burrito well, and he had to rewrap it himself. 

Also, shortly after we were seated and eating, there was a huge line, and every single employee was huddled around a small room, doing something with equipment.  Now...I get it if something maybe broke, or some emergency, but not a single employee came out and said "We'll be right with you" or anything to the line of people waiting.  That is extremely poor customer service.  

I'll be back because its close to my house, but if I can go to a different spot, I most definitely will.

text:
I looooove Chipotle... I know a lot of people have issues with it and when they had that little tif bit I never stopped coming here. Since I hmno longer work in that area I don't go as often but I still try to have it once or twice a month. 

I am always kindly greeted and the line when I go is never too long. It's always clean. 

I do miss the old school pinto beans they made with the bacon but I have since moved to black beans (cause healthier??). I don't get any rice mainly cause I don't like cilantro and too many carbs. My bowls usually consist of double or triple chicken or double chicken and barbacoa. Their barbacoa is second to none. It's so juicy and tasty. 

Everything is always fresh looking and not dried out. The guac looks super yummy but since I'm allergic to avocados I can't eat it hahaha bit I looks so inviting. The chips are SO good I just wish they were a smidge saltier and lemonier (is that even a word ). I usually get chips with a side of sour cream and a side of red sauce (mix them and you have heaven. I also use this mix for chicken quesadillas).

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
Pretty much always game when there is a vegan option at a predominantly non-vegan establishment that hits the spot. With that said, Chipotle's sofritas are VEGAN which makes it the perfect place for my meat eating boyfriend and I to get the best of both worlds. Not to mention, you get a lot of food for a fair price.

Truth be told, I haven't had a bad experience here yet. The employees have always been friendly and generous on portions, the store is clean and the food has always been fresh even when they are near closing. Wait time can be a little long in the evening when it is busy as there are less employees working, but I think most sensible customers can see that as a forgivable set back. 

As long as quality of food and service continues to be this great, I will always be coming back to this location. 

Chipotle hack: if you want a burrito, get the bowl and a couple tortillas on the side. You usually get a lil more for the same price. ;)

text: I would like to express my dissatisfaction with this locations online ordering service. I own a local business in the same area and in the past few years have averaged $300-$500 a month in online food orders for my employees and I. This year I stopped ordering and coming to this establishment because the quality of service consistently declined. More often than not every time we ordered lunch online and came to pick up the order, it was not ready or made incorrectly. My employees or I would come to pick up the order at the listed time of completion on the website and come to find out the order had not even got processed. Many times the store was not even busy, and employees where just standing around. So today I decided to try and order again online, entered my order in at 2:45 pm, came to pick it up at 3:45, and the same issue with the food not being ready had occurred again (there was only one customer in line) In one hour a simple online order could not be processed!! I had to wait another 10 minutes for them to make the food. I spoke to the manager and she had no answer to why this problem keeps occurring after I told her this continuously happens when we order online. She offered me a refund, and I declined it, I do not care for the money, I just wanted a realistic answer to why the online ordering service is so poor when a year or two ago this problem never was a issue.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
Chipotle Mexican Grill! Six months ago if anyone would have said to me let's go and have some food from Chipotle my answer would have been...No!

Ever since they had issues with their food I have stayed away because of obvious reasons but I decided to give this place one more try as I do believe in second chances.

I decided to go to the Chipotle on Craig and Losee and try a burrito. When I got there I was surprised to see at least 10 to 15 people having lunch, to me this is a good sign because it means the franchise is finally overcoming all the negative publicity regarding their food.

I decided to go ahead and try the barbacoa burrito. The area where they have their cooked meats and greens was very clean and looked organized. The greens looked very fresh and the meat looked as if they were in fact keeping a fresh batch.

My Barbacoa burrito had the barbacoa black beans, white rice, pico de gallo sour cream, avocado, and green salsa.

Like I mentioned before I was a little skeptical and not too sure of what I was getting myself into by eating the food but I have to say to my surprise this burrito was very delicious. All the ingredients we're fresh cooked just right,and the burrito it self was very filling. The Barbacoa was actually  really good and it tasted  like actual barbacoa  not too many spices, not over seasoned,  it was done just right . The cost of the burrito with all the extras added to it was roughly $9 not a bad deal for the quality of food that they are now serving,and the amount of food you get stuffed into your burrito.

Overall not a bad experience I'm glad I gave it a second chance the food tasted good, good service, clean place, I was really impressed as to how far Chipotle has come and with this being said it looks like I might give it another chance in the near future.

text:
Online Ordering Review****

I've used the online ordering option many times. Usually with the assumption that I'm not going to receive a perfect order. Not a big deal but, when entire parts of my order aren't there, then I'm not too excited. I stopped ordering all together after being disappointed too many times. After over 6months of not ordering online I did today and received a salad with little to no lettuce and wrong salsa. It was either quickly or lazily or together because it looks just awful. I ate some of my Husband's food because I just can't eat all of that red salsa. :(

DO NOT ORDER ONLINE!


For whatever reason it has never (not Once) worked out for me.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill

text:
What can i say other then that i LOVE Chipotle! 

This one particularly is super close to home, 5 minutes to be exact. Parking lot is fairly busy due to the other businesses nearby.

The service here isn't always up to par. They are not always nice or smiling but good thing me loving the burritos makes up for that. My normal fixing is between steak or carnitas, brown rice, i care less for the beans, either works and all the fixings please! Sometimes i will splurge on a chips and salsa with guac and a patron margarita.

Our recent visit was my husband's first time. Yes i said first time! And he really enjoyed it as well. He tried the newest protein offering for his burrito which was the chorizo amd chicken combo. He gave 2 thumbs up!

Maybe one suggestion to put knives outside along with the forks and spoons, why do you have to go to the counter? I have no idea?!?! 

To wrap up this review i gave it 4 stars due to the service but food is always great. Tasty and satisfying. Alot for your buck! Go ahead and stop by if you havent yet.

text:
DO NOT EAT HERE. 

I don't normally write reviews for places unless it's outstanding or straight disgusting, with the exception of one or two I've written.

HOWEVER, this chipotle is dirty as hell! I just found a deep-fried cockroach in my bag of chips AFTER I HAD EATEN ALL BUT 4 OR 5 CHIPS..Didn't know that came with the chips!! DISGUSTING. I FEEL LIKE THROWING UP FROM HOW GROSS THAT IS. I AM NEVER EATING AT CHIPOTLE EVER AGAIN. 

This isn't the first time an incident like this has happened! My coworker's wife was eating a taco from chipotle, and when she bit into her taco, she ended up biting on something crunchy! Guess what that crunchy item was?? A FREAKING COCKROACH. This incident occurred right before the mass chipotle E. Coli outbreak, too! You would think they would get their stuff together and maintain a clean restaurant after that horrible outbreak! 

I am going to corporate and all the other social media to demand an explanation of all of this crap ending up in my food

name: Burger King

text:
I used to hang out around this area a ton a few years ago. Michael-Angelo's, a grocery store, was next door to Burger King. I would shop there, get my Portuguese egg tarts, and then grab a quick bite to eat at Burger King.

Since Michael-Angelo's moved from Markham to Aurora, and then got bought out and is no longer with us, I haven't visited this area. I decided to give Burger King another shot again.

In the past, I remember having a Whopper combo coupon. I ordered at the drive-thru speaker, and then presented my coupon at the window. I got chewed out by the woman for not saying that I had a coupon at the speaker. Wow, sorry. I thought that I could tell you when I am paying, so you can make the price adjustment.

The other day, I came after work and used the drive-thru. I had a coupon for a Whopper combo for $5.99 before taxes. I placed the order and indicated that I had a coupon. The man was polite and nice. Hey, I should come back here more often!

I paid. He was so kind. It was quite a different experience for me.

My food was decent. It hit the spot. My Whopper was yummy. The fries were okay, but I did eat them all (I'm not a huge fries person, but like them from time to time). I washed everything down with a Diet Coke.

I normally go to the Burger King closest to my work. I should stop here more often.

(218)

text:
Let me start off by saying, I LOVE Burger King! But this particular location isn't the best. I don't know if it's cause I go through drive thru, but they always get my order wrong and their drive thru is never busy!!! 

I gave in a fairly normal sized order and the person who took the order seemed to understand with no problems. I had asked for onions rings instead of fries in which I got fries. I has also asked for the zesty sauce and they failed to put that in. Completely dissatisfied and this happened to me twice!! I would have complained if I didn't go through drive thru cause I checked when I got home! 

STAFF: Always seem to be in a rush with taking the order and giving the food even when there isn't a line up. They are friendly and nice but could be quick yet also efficient. 

FOOD: Great, but never has enough sauce on my burgers even when I ask with extra sauce.

text: 1 star, that's all i will give them. Why? Because i love Whopper's! Otherwise this place needs to be shut down. Dirty, outdated and 1 big hot mess inside this location. text: I've been back to this location many times but the service is hit or miss.  Sometimes the employees are friendly and other times they just ignore me.  I usually order using the Starbucks app and while they advertise in this location about skipping the line by using the mobile app, I often get stuck waiting for a while for someone to acknowledge me when I'm trying to pick up my order.  I know the location is busy but the employees should still acknowledge you when you're standing right in front of them.
name: Starbucks

text: I'm a regular Starbucks customer at different locations and this is one place that needs improvement towards their customer service. The individual helping me was not attentive to what I was saying and I thought she was joking when she was providing the incorrect order back to me, however, that's what she heard. I believe she is a new employee, therefore, I was hoping someone was helping her than looking at their phone. I would like to update my review because there's opportunity to improve and bring me back since I love coffee.
name: Starbucks

text: I love this location. Everyone is always super friendly and the drinks are always consistent. Definitely worth passing four different Starbucks just to come to this one!
name: Starbucks

text: The one star is for the coffee. It's horrible. Tastes burnt. Had them remake the latte, was still a burnt flavor. I am thinking that Starbucks coffee is just bad. Service was fine.
name: Starbucks

text:
I'm really disappointed in the cleanliness of this Starbucks.  Most recently, my wife and I stopped here to grab a coffee on our date night.  There was an open, half eaten subway sandwich on the counter, coffee spill stains on the bar and generally dirty floors.  It raised the question - "what do things look like behind the counter?"
When we looked, we found more of the same...over flowing trash cans and whole gallons of milk sitting out on the counter.
The coffee and food that we get from this store are on par with other stores - pretty darn good, you just don't leave feeling good about eating/drinking it when you're there.
name: Starbucks

text:
My last two visits to this location have left a bit to be desired...

First visit all I wanted was a simple blonde roast with a little skim milk in it and they told me that there was no blonde roast after 12 so I got the Pikes Peak which of course they put no milk in and was way too strong

Today I went inside and asked for a blonde roast with skim milk and got into my car and realized there was no skim milk in it...

Two out of two times the order was missed here...
name: Starbucks

text: If I could give zero stars for this specific Starbucks location I WOULD! The service was terrible me and my friend walked in and literally waited 10 min keep in mind we were the only ones in line. There were two people by the counter and we weren't greeted or acknowledged once. They did make eye contact with us several times but ignored us! It was 7:30 at night they weren't closing anytime soon and no one was there. It was surprising to us because we love Starbucks. We ended up just leaving without placing an order. DO NOT GO TO THIS STARBUCKS TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
name: Starbucks

text:
The service here is lame! Our barista had no energy and wasn't friendly. She even said she doesn't drink coffee or tea. Why would you say that? And why do you work there??? What's interesting was when two girls walked in (her friends) suddenly our barista had personality. 

Well my caramel frappes are now almost $6 they have raised their prices 200% and their rewards program is not as good as before. I may have to break with this sbucks habit and say so long!
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks sucks!!! I usually love going to Starbucks because of the environment and friendly customer service. However, tonight was not the case! My friend and I were the only ones in line and we didn't get greeted or acknowledged.  It was around 7:30 PM! It's not like they were closing soon or going through a huge rush or anything like that. The barista behind the counter actually left on a bathroom break as we were at the counter ready to order & the other girl wasn't any help at all. By the time the guy came back, he didn't say anything to us or come back to the register to take our order! In fact, his back was turned away from us and we were just standing there waiting. I don't expect perfection, but as a customer ready to pay nearly $6 and then some for a drink, I DO expect AT LEAST an acknowledgment. If he was occupied with something else, he didn't even have the audacity to say "I'll be right with you ladies" or "Thanks for waiting. I'll be with right with you shortly" or anything of that manner. Totally unprofessional! Amidst leaving to go the bathroom while we were at the register ready to order, the other girl working & yet not helping us at all, and no one seemingly enough ready and wanting to take our order, my friend and I walked out of the establishment and will never return to this location. How's that for a bloody review!
name: Starbucks

text: Pretty quick and got my order right. I came during the day. Glad they had a drive thru because many in the area do not seem to have one.
name: Starbucks

text: The inside of the store is disgusting!  Trash, dirt, old drink spills, milk jugs left out on the counters, overflowing garbage cans. You are a reflection of the corporate store AND our community. What a disappointment.
name: Starbucks

text: The layout of this location is odd.  You go to the end of the counter furthest from the door to pick up your drink.  There are some soft seats and a couch if you get lucky enough to arrive when they aren't in use.  Also, a few tables and a mister outside.  Service was quick and friendly and the bathrooms were clean.
name: Starbucks

text: My 24 oz berry hibiscus was mostly ice. The beverage literally took me less than a couple of minutes to finish. I definitely feel like I wasted my money here.
name: Starbucks

text: This is my neighborhood Starbucks and I am here all the time. The staff always go above and beyond my expectations. They treat us like family. My drink is already being made as soon as they see me walking in the door. I would highly recommend this Starbucks to anyone looking for a warm friendly place to hang out.
name: Starbucks

text: Do not go here. Iced coffee is pretty basic, and when it was made wrong I went inside after the drive through, and as kindly as I could, asked for a replacement (something I rarely do)... WORST service I've ever experienced, and incredibly rude. The barista actually scoffed in my face lol. Then continued to snicker to all the other baristas behind the counter, right in front of me. Just very surprised how rude people can be and would never support a business like that.
name: Starbucks

text: very friendly staff.  quick making the drinks.  I like that they have indoor and outdoor seating.  bathrooms are unisex and both wheelchair accessible.  I noticed other people's comments about cleanliness so I made sure to look.  behind the counter was clean and I did see staff clean while I was there.  several tables have crumbs on them but people were sitting there when I came in. the creamer area was clean.  I would definitely come back to this location.
name: Starbucks

text: Slow service and rude staff. They aren't accommodating when they are slow or even friendly or apologetic. Seems like that staff needs better training on good customer service. I have had a few good experiences before 6am.
name: Starbucks

text: Best Starbucks Everrrrrrrrrrrr!! Love Ella at the drive thru!! Great energy and even better personality. She made me smile and was just amazing. I will definitely come back to this Starbucks even if it's out of the way
name: Starbucks

text: This is my local starbucks. I always like to see Lila's smiling face as I go through the drive thru. I love the trenta sized unsweetened passion tea.  It's the little things!
name: Starbucks

text: Probably the most inconsistent Starbucks I have ever been to. The line goes really quickly which is why I couldn't leave less than two stars, but I hate that this is the one I have to go to if I stop before work. I order just an espresso drink and I ask if they can fill the entire cup with milk and one out of six times they say yes. I'm paying three dollars for some shots of espresso and they are blatantly rude when I try to ask for more milk? The ladies at the window are always extremely pleasant but whoever takes the orders in the drive-through has a serious attitude problem. I understand companies have policies but at least be consistent and explain things with a nice tone when you hand me my coffee halfway filled. Keep in mind this is the ONLY location I've ever been to that gives me a hard time about this.
name: Starbucks

text: I've went to this location several times and each time I've received what I ordered but the person taking my order has not been friendly at all.  What happened to the baristas asking you how you're day is or making small talk with you?  Every time I've been to this location the person at the register just kind of looks at me and doesn't say anything.  I guess they figure if they stare long enough you'll just start telling them your order.  I love Starbucks but it's tough paying what I pay for a drink to get such mediocre service.  I expect it at a McDonald's but not a Starbucks.
name: Starbucks

text: Heidie is great she always remembers my moms complicated order as soon as we pull into the drive through and Leila is always super friendly
name: Starbucks

text: I used my Starbucks App to order my coffee since I wanted to grab and go. Received my coffee on time. Remember to thank your baristas. They work hard to make our day with our favorite beverage. Really made my morning.
name: Starbucks

text: I have never been to a Starbucks that smells horrible! The smell is so overwhelming that you can smell it as soon as you open the door. After thinking about the smell I came to the consensus it was probably spoiled milk that has just sat there for hours. Once, I took a deep breath and went in I then ordered and waited for my drinks. All of the coffees were luke warm and were definitely not up to par for a Starbucks restaurant. It is sad to say that I was definitely disappointed with this visit and I have never experienced a smell like that before.
name: Starbucks

text: SLOWEST SERVICE EVER. Even when no one is in line... some people have places to go and need to grab a quick coffee over ice. Please work with a little more urgency. Thank you for the coffee-
name: Starbucks

text: Not busy at all with maybe 2 people seated in the store, but the staff seemed like they had more important things to do than wait on me. I was in a line of 1, so you would assume I'd be overwhelmed with attention. Simple order of the largest iced coffee. What I got was a small cup sat on the counter without a word and a quick turn around. The coffee was was fine but the rest kinda soured it for me.
name: Starbucks

text: This is our usual spot. We love coming here and walking around Birkdale, hanging at Starbucks, and talking with the baristas! Come here and hang out! You can beta order and it's always ready when we get there.
name: Starbucks

text: Holy cow!  It was freezing cold in this place this morning!  One of the baristas was wearing a scarf.
name: Starbucks

text:
You would think that it would be a no brainer for the barrister to ensure that the lid is securely in place before serving up an order. 

Thank you for ruining a brand new pair of white pants.
name: Starbucks

text: Nice place to grab a cup of coffee. A little bit of a club hangout for middle age crisis People but the service is outstanding
name: Starbucks

text: This is the best Starbucks in Huntersville. They have a Clover brewing machine. There are tables for two and a large communal table inside. Outside there are about as many tables and seats. The only thing missing is a bike rack--I use lamp posts and trees instead.
name: Starbucks

text: The staff is super friendly, and they always get through the line quickly, no matter how long. I also love how early they open - very convenient!
name: Starbucks

text: This is the best Starbucks in Huntersville. They have a Clover brewing machine. There are tables for two and a large communal table inside. Outside there are about as many tables and seats. The only thing missing is a bike rack--I use lamp posts and trees instead.
name: Starbucks

text: For me, Starbucks is Starbucks when it comes to the food and coffee. What I will mention about this particular location is that the staff are always fairly friendly and it seems there's always a line out the door. This is in large part because there are so many regulars who hang out on weekend mornings, chatting with one another and petting each other's dogs. It's a very neighborly, friendly vibe and I love it. My one, constructive observation is that the service is insanely S-L-O-W, especially on a weekend morning. Today I waited nearly 20-25 minutes for my venti Latte and oatmeal. As I live in the area, I know that this was not just a one-off occurrence, but that it seems to be the norm. I really think this is unacceptable for a Starbucks. I think there's an opportunity to streamline the service so that the patrons can be moved in and out fairly quickly. If you have the app on your phone, I highly recommend that you place your order in advance so you don't have to wait as long.
name: Starbucks

text: This is always such a busy Starbucks, but I really like this location. The baristas are always nice and when you beta order, it's always there when I get there! Sometimes the cleanliness isn't the best but I think that comes with the busyness of the place!
name: Starbucks

text: Can only hope that the "remodel" will bring about a better experience. Food at this location is always terrible and the place is always filthy.

text:
I have eaten at Subway a lot, this location only a few times. The reason for my low review score is a lack of knowledge by the employees.

My wife went to get us sandwiches for a lazy diner after a long day. I asked her to get me the "new special" Reuben, toasted. I should have been more specific...

If you have ever had a Reuben you know that it is 5 ingredients that come together to make a glorious, tasty meal.

The sandwich artist asked what what kind of bread? Not a good sign. My wife says, "whatever it comes with". I will cut to the chase and say they got the meat and sauce right. I got every topping available, American cheese and white bread with mine. If you don't know how to make a Reuben, don't offer it.
address: 3230 E Union Hills Dr, Ste B-125, Union Centre Shoppes

text:
And still I persist.  Why I don't know.  In years past I used to like Subway and ate there several times a week.  The only reason I go to this one is because where I live I have a choice between the raw cook it yourself pizza place (that I stopped going to) and Subway.  I simply don't have any other nearby fast food options when I've had a long day and want a fast bite to eat.

After my most recent visit I was prompted to write this review because I wondered why it looked like there was so little meat on my salad, which after all is just supposed to be a sandwich without bread, right?  Being naturally curious I had to find the answer to that question and I did, directly from a Subway franchise owner (not the one who owns this store however).

It seems their "formula" is that if you order a sandwich as a salad it is built to have a six inch portion of meat and cheese and a footlong's portion of veggies.

But the rub comes when you pay for it.  If you order that meal as a SMALL sandwich it will cost you $4.59 and if you order that same sandwich as a LARGE it will cost you $4.99.  Now if you follow their formula and get a large amount of veggies and a small amount of meat and cheese how much do you think it will cost you?  Wrong!  The salad version is $6.58!!!  That is some creative math they've got going on there.

That would be bad enough but, hey it's my choice to be stupid and not just buy a large loaded sandwich and throw the bread away.  My reason for giving them 0-stars however (and calling in the Dept of Weights and Measures) is look at the picture of my salad.  Do you think that's the same amount of meat that they put on a small sub sandwich?  I doubt it. 

But look again. See anything missing?  Yep, NO CHEESE!!

So now the question is should we call it creative math or something far more sinister like the fact that they got busted because their "footlong" sandwiches weren't actually 12" long?  Stay tuned.  Maybe that location will be vacant soon and I'll have a whole new option for fast food near my house.
address: 3230 E Union Hills Dr, Ste B-125, Union Centre Shoppes

name: Starbucks

text:
Positives: 
1- the drive thru moves quickly even when you think "no way am I waiting in that line!"
2- the location is easy to access and leave such that even in horrible rush hour, you can get in and out of the lot

Negatives:
1- I come EVERY day and order the EXACT same thing. No one remembers me. EVER. 
2- I constantly have to restate my order to get it entered correctly and I would think this is my fault but I don't have this issue at other locations
3- don't bother trying to use the walk up to beat the drive thru line. Soooooooo sloooooow. 
4- twice recently they have given me the wrong drink and I haven't noticed and needed to go to a SECOND Starbucks to get a corrected order. 
5- finally, some of the staff annoys me!  I don't want to talk about the details of weekend plans on  630am on a Friday. A simple "hi, how are you, here's your correct order" will do...
