text: This store has plummeted in customer service in the last 8 months. Never had problems before. Now consistently I have issues with food not ready, waiting 1/2 hour longer than what time I was quoted or wrong size from what I ordered and paid for. Other customers around me being told their orders are lost. Store is complete chaos!
name: Papa John's Pizza

text: This is by far the worst papa johns I've ever placed an order with!! I ordered a pizza with easy instructions and they still failed to send the right pizza... They forgot something on my pizza but because they had ran out! No one bothered to call and tell me, they sent the pizza as it was. Anyways I called them and a worker supposably wrote me down in a book and give me credit for one free pizza... He said he talked to his manager!! I called to place an order a few days later and there's no sign of that anywhere... Horrible service. Be good to loyal customers!
name: Papa John's Pizza

text: We have been regular customers at this location for over 8 years. The pizza is ok, the service isn't the best, but we don't expect a lot from a chain, BUT this last experience was UNACCEPTABLE! So, bought pizza Sunday via online, the girl helping us clearly had no idea what she was doing. It took her several minutes to even just spot our pizza that she looked right at several times. We sign our receipt for $11.91 & go on our way. Well, fast forward today, I was checking our online banking & notice they charged us $15. I call the store. John tries telling me my total was $15. I explain I have my emailed receipt that states $11.91. He then takes a few minutes & says "your total was $11.91 but you left a $3.09 tip". I then reply "I did NOT leave a $3.09 or any tip at all for a pizza that I picked up!" They have an employee or employees that are changing receipts & OVERCHARGING CUSTOMERS! We're so disgusted & WILL NOT go to this store EVER AGAIN! BUYERS BEWARE
name: Papa John's Pizza

text: I wish i would have looked at the reviews before ordering at this location. My pizza was cold, soggy and not cooked all the way. This has been the worse pizza I have had. Should have just ordered from dominos.
name: Papa John's Pizza

text: I would give no stars if that was an option. This place is a joke. They tried to double charge us for their buy one get one free pizza. My husband tried to explain that they were charging too much, but the person taking the orders was not very bright. We ended up at Metro Pizza instead, which was delicious! So, I guess thank you for such ridiculous service Papa John's.  Won't ever attempt to order here again.
name: Papa John's Pizza

text: We've ordered from this location for over five years. Last time we ordered the pizza came extremely doughy and 15 minutes late. I called and spoke with a manager to let them know. I trusted he would work on improving quality. Today we ordered the same order again and the pizza was doughy again...and this time 20 minutes late. Pizzas are coming not just a little doughy but very slimy and raw kind of doughy. Disgusting! We can't even eat it. I just wanted to tell the manager about the problem and he had an attitude and was very rude, he insisted on my information and I simply wanted to give my feedback anonymously. He kept talking over me demanding my info... I asked for the store managers name and he said he refuses to cooperate with me and hung up on me. I'm floored!! I will NEVER order from this store again! Management should no doubt be fired! If the store manager or owner reads this....you want results, start at the TOP! Either the employees aren't being trained properly or just don't care at all. Either way, management should be competent enough to handle the problem. And how he spoke to me...very unprofessional and disgraceful. Done! Lost our business!
name: Papa John's Pizza

text:
If I could give negative stars I would! We come here A LOT, I have four boys and they love their pizza. Lately they've been uncooked or burnt with cheese stuck to the boxes. Ordered from them a couple nights ago and my order was totally wrong and they said that they put it on our account that the next time I came in I would get the same order credited because they messed it up and all I had to do was order with the same phone number and they would see the credit. I went tonight and ordered like they told me to and they told me they knew nothing of this deal and shrugged their shoulders. The pizza was again uncooked yet burnt the crust, imagine that. So my order was not credited and burnt yet uncooked. Never again will I spend another dime in this place. Definitely need new management or something. 
Won't be coming again.
name: Papa John's Pizza

text: I wish I'd checked the reviews before deciding to order. Holy cow, was this awful! I ordered 2 medium pizzas, one pepperoni and half pineapple with light cheese and extra sauce, the other pepperoni and sausage with extra sauce. There was some sauce but not even to a degree I would consider "normal" let alone extra. Pizza wasn't cold but it wasn't hot. Received in about 45 minutes, which is twice as long as Domino's usually takes. They also called to ask my gate code, which i had provided online when I ordered (but appears they didn't print on the receipt for their driver). Guess I'll be sticking with Dominos - at least they seem like they give a damn.
name: Papa John's Pizza

text:
McDonalds has improved its decor and menu over the years and I have visited this location a few times. Lines are fast and service is friendly. Very organized.

I recommend downloading the My McD's app on your phone as you get promotions and coupons directly to your phone instead of carrying paper coupons around with you.

text: This is my favorite Starbucks store. The staff is super friendly and very accommodating! They bring my drink to my table for me since I have a disability and use a wheelchair. They have 4 wheelchair accessible tables, 2 inside and 2 on the patio. They don't give me a hard time when I order a coffee refill for my dad, while some locations do. When I order a tomato mozzarella panini, they cut it in half to make it easier for me to handle.

name: Starbucks

text: I have come this this location for the third and final time.  Thought maybe bad luck on my first two visits with Maria being so incredible rude when I placed an order from my phone and show up 10 minutes later and they didn't see the ticket so they didn't start the order.   This week it happened for the third time and they just can not be nice and apologize for not checking on the machine that prints out orders.   I'll stick to my main Starbucks in Cave Creek where James and his staff always give 5 star service!!!
address: 32421 N Scottsdale Rd, Bldg 4, Ste K
name: Starbucks

text:
I'm not sure why this Starbucks location got such low Yelp rating. I usually use the app in ordering and they are right on in getting my order ready upon arrival. The staff are super nice and looks like they enjoy working there. However, the lines get pretty long which translate into poor reviews. Just use the app and avoid the line. They also have nice patio and many customers bring their pets.
I tried their spicy Italian panini. It looks like a hot pocket and I didn't care for it. It was just convenient and quick meal while running errands.
address: 32421 N Scottsdale Rd, Bldg 4, Ste K
name: Starbucks

text: I like Subway but this one was not so good.  When I entered the store it had a bad smell like sewer problems  but since I was taking out, I went ahead anyway.  I ordered a BLT asking the bacon be cooked but not the bread.  The young man put the bacon in the oven then asked what I wanted on the sandwich.  I asked for lettuce, lots of onions and mayo. He loaded the bun with the lettuce and onion, removed the bacon from the oven and without draining or wiping away the grease laid it on top of the sandwich. He then squirted mayo across the top of the bacon and cut it half and wrapped it.  So now I have a sandwich with bacon and mayo on the cut side and lettuce and onions in the back half.  I got home and reconstructed the sandwich.  Probably won't go back.

name: Subway

text:
HELL NAH! If I could rate a ZERO or NEGATIVE 100 that would be my rating.  Something told me I should've just made the drive down the street and went to me REGULAR location.  I never have these type of problems at the Subway up the street from Target, and they are open 24hrs.

So on to this raggedy ass location, late night washing at the laundry mat, I was hungry when I left the house but I figured I was only drying clothes so I can hold on for 30mins. Big mistake, 9:30pm what I was in the mood for was closed, and a cheesebuger, taco, pizza, etc just wasn't the palete pleasing meal that I wanted.  So where do you go in a time of some "FRESH FOOD" eating? SUBWAY, that's their slogan 'Subway eat FRESH!'...well my meal was NOT FU@%!N$ FRESH and now I see why all 3 reviews written for this location is 1STAR and if they could they probably would rate ZERO too.

I get there 30mins before closing, attitude sucked, lack of personality, NO customer service whatsoever.  I don't care that you're in a rush to go home, you applied to work at Subway, I know the struggle, once upon a time I was also a Sandwich Artist, so miss me w/ the speech on how long it takes you to clean up.  How about you good back there an prep for some bread for proof for the next day b/c my bread was STALE and damn near crunchy.

ONE OF MY BIGGEST PET PEEVES: if I ask for something outside of the normal, I am freaking aware that there is an extra charge.

I asked: Can you add avocado to that for me please (now this is before I knew about the stale bread)

HIS response: well that's gonna cost you $0.75

What pissed me off is that he stopped making my sandwich and gave me a crazy look when he said, so I SNAPPED!. "No $h!t Sherlock, it's listed on the menu as EXTRA w/ the price to the left, ol' dumba$$.  Did I ask you how does it cost, no I said can you add avocado to my sandwich and I said PLEASE"  I promise if he could spit in my sandwich right he would've.

So I finally get back to the laundromat w/ my sandwich in hand, my stomach is screaming at me, I unwrap my sandwich and it's in 2 PIECES!  No, if that was I would have gone to Jimmy John's...ok, actually I did go to Jimmy John's but they  had closed at 9pm :-(
name: Subway

text: This is my 6th time eating at this location. Either get the bmt or tuna or turkey and I have to say; WOW! Sandwich was made to perfection. Usually certain Subways lack on the sandwich making skills but not this one. This is my new Subway. Every time I have ordered it is the same lady and she knows what she is doing lol.

text: I rarely visit McDonald's. I did so most recently a couple days ago. It was the start of an early morning and the drive-through looked very busy. My wife and I went inside to order a meal to go. That's when we noticed there were flies. Lots of flies. Flies everywhere. In the air. On the point of sale unit. One landed on my wife, another on the hat of the indifferent server. I can only imagine why so many flies call this McDonald's home. If it's this bad out front, what the eff must it look like in the back? Yikes! I should have said something. It was gross. Had me kind of shocked. More importantly, the staff should have said something. Absolutely unacceptable. My tip to you, avoid the flies, avoid this McDonald's. Maybe avoid all McDonald's. Your choice. Which choice will/did you make?

text:
Surprisingly I've never had an issue with the food here but the weekday morning/afternoon manager is a condescending, little teenage twat. I once had a coupon for a free McCafe drink and they were having issues getting the code to scan. They called the "manager" over and she told me she'd "go ahead and do it THIS TIME..." but that the coupon was for a frappe, not an iced coffee because that's what was in the picture. This was all explained rather rudely and when I said "yeah well the coupon just says ANY beverage" she just repeated herself... So I emailed corporate and guess what? She was wrong. 
Had to lunch there again today and the same girl was really unfriendly and rude about the fact that their soda machine wasn't working. No smile. No apology. Just "yeah I don't really know what's wrong with it". The non manager girl was nicer about it than her. So yeah, if you go here don't feel bad about calling out their teenage staff on their bullshit.

text:
Placed my order around lunchtime and figured that I was going to have to maybe wait about 30 to 40 minutes for my pizza to get delivered. UM WRONG. 

I ordered online and when I hit the "ready to order" button, I quickly received an email stating that my pizza would arrived in 80 to 95 minutes!!!! Whuuuuut?! I was shook. My pizza would arrive between 1:47pm to 1:58pm, according to their website tracker. 

I did realize that that was a crazy amount of time to be waiting for a large pizza and a drink, but I figured I could wait I guess. 

Fast forward to the time frame I was supposed to receive my order and my food had still not been delivered! Ugh! I finally received my food at 2:15pm and that's about 17 minutes after their expected delivery time! 

My pizza was just warm and did not taste fresh. It had sadly definitely been sitting around for sometime. I will unfortunately not order from this location ever again. 

Since when does one wait over an hour for one pizza and a drink. Crazy.

name: McDonald's

text:
My all-day-breakfast phase is slowly starting to fade. However, it has been fun to frequent McDonald's locations that I have never been to. 

This location is the second-closest one to my workplace. It's on the southwest corner of Dixie and Matheson Boulevard. After a nice day with my boyfriend a couple of weekends ago, I grabbed a quick bite here on my way home.

I have now been to this drive-thru twice. I do not understand why folks like to smoke while in their cars at the drive-thru. Both times, I was inhaling second-hand smoke thanks to the smoker in the car ahead of me.

On a good note, I got the same cheerful, helpful employee working the drive-thru both times. He made both experiences good ones.

My orders were done correctly and I wasn't waiting long. The drive-thru is a single lane. There are arrows on the pavement, so you can't mess up unless it's winter and no one has plowed the lot.

The food is what you'd expect from McDonald's. I hope that I can go through this drive-thru smoke-free one of these days!

(110)

text: The coffee here is the same as any other Starbucks, what makes this location stand out is the service. I live around the corner and stop in frequently, all staff members provide excellent service and are so friendly especially Cali! She rocks!
name: Starbucks

text: Parking is Brutal! But yes it is a Starbucks and a very well furnished Starbucks with comfy couches and chairs and a welcoming group of people. It's definitely one of the Starbucks where you would rather come in and linger (I love that word) and take your time before rushing back out into the world.
name: Starbucks

text: Wow, rude personal. Not very helpful and annoyed quickly. The old lady should look for a different job if she doesn't enjoy her current one.
name: Starbucks

text: One of the best Starbucks I have been to. Super efficient baristas who take the time to remember customer names. Great place to get some work done -- seating inside and out.
name: Starbucks

text:
Very unfriendly staff unfortunately. Maybe just having a bad day, but it might be better to stay home instead of taking it out on customers. 
Ended up not getting anything and went to a coffee shop down the road.
name: Starbucks

text: Great location, always busy when I come by after my Saturday workout - very friendly staff and nice and clean.
name: Starbucks

text: Recently visited this Starbucks location for the first time. I love the area it is in and loved the atmosphere of the Starbucks itself. I know most people are familiar with their products but I find it helpful when I know about service and space when it comes to Starbucks since the service can vary as can the seating space. This particular branch had great service the day I attended and decent seating for a Starbucks with a wide open interior and seating outside in the front and the rear.
name: Starbucks

text: I love Starbucks but this particular location isn't the best. Got up at 6:30 am to get a iced coffee and got home and it tasted like a glass of milk. No coffee whatsoever just ice and milk! If you love caffeine then don't go here you will be disappointed . Customer service is good but the way they make their drinks are horrible. Please get people who care about the customers and know how to properly make Starbucks drinks.
name: Starbucks

text:
I visited this Starbucks just to have somewhere to use my laptop and do some work for a little while.  Parking is a bit of a pain.

I usually order cappuccino's but on a hot summer day, I really wanted my favorite - a fizzed strawberry acai refresher. Sadly, the fizz machine was down.

Instead, I opted for a strawberry green tea infusion. Never had it before. After one taste, I didn't like it. I'm used to sweet drinks. It literally just sat there with condensation growing on the cup from the ice melting. The associate working at the time saw I hadn't been drinking it and asked if I liked it. I told her no, and she offered to re-make it for me and make it sweeter. I thought that was so helpful and I really appreciated her doing that for me. While I still won't order this drink again, after she re-made it, it was definitely better. I do prefer it sweeter.
name: Starbucks

text: Staff is always quick and friendly. Manager is awesome, printed me a receipt from earlier in the day in a snap!
name: Starbucks

text:
Being my neighborhood Starbucks, I'm a bit partial.  Parking is not in their favor, but the front patio is great for one looking to be perfectly perched. 

There is no drive through, and the interior is rather small, nestled between two other businesses.  The staff members are always polite and the wait is usually minimal.  

As one that prefers local coffee, I like that this Starbucks has a great local feel.  It's right on the bridge of the old school Charlotte Chantilly and Elizabeth neighborhoods, offering a great neighborly feel that is very walkable.  It is also surrounded by the likes of Sunflour Bakery, Bang Bang Burgers, Hero's Aren't Hard To Find Comics, The Crunkelton, The Stanley, Sandwich Max, Caswell Station, and other local spots that make it feel like it's a part of the one of a kind selections of the neighborhood.  But anytime there's a coffeeshop within a hop, skip, and jump of your front door, it's hard not to be a fan.
name: Starbucks

text: This is by far the worst Wendy's in the world.  And that's a stretch because most Wendy's are pretty good.  One night I came in and this huge family cut in front of me.  I only had one small order but would you believe it they served them first before making my one sandwich.  They are very inconsiderate and their work is sloppy.  That was terrible that they did that to me and I've been a loyal customer to them for a long time.  Most of the workers there are okay but I found out the hard way that some of them are hateful.  The dining room is run down and dirty and smells bad.  Their restrooms are always dirty too.  I wouldn't be surprised if their kitchen is also dirty

name: Wendy's

text:
Normally I wouldn't review a mainstream fast food joint but the service and food I got at this Wendy's last night was so awful I have to share.  

My husband and I had a very late lunch which spilled over into a very late dinner and decided around 10:45pm that Wendy's sounded good.  We went through the drive-thru and were greeted by a female employee who, at first, seemed professional and friendly.  I was driving the car and after her greeting us and asking what we would like, I politely (and I'm especially polite at fast food restaurants out of fear of food sabotage!) asked her to give us a minute to look over the menu.  She very nicely said that was fine and instructed me to order when I was ready.  So far, so good.  

No less than 30 seconds later, she got back on the speaker and curtly said, "Are you ready yet or what?"  I'm not sure what could possibly have happened in the half minute since she last spoke to us but her demeanor had changed drastically.  I wasn't really ready but again, in an effort not to piss off someone who's making my food in a sight unseen kitchen, I obliged and started to place our order.  She interrupted me probably 2 or 3 times while saying my order; it was just so rude.  I'm well aware that I need to indicate what size value meal I want and what kind of drink I want - no need to continually interrupt me while I'm speaking to ask me.  Wait until I'm done talking and if I haven't told you exactly what I want, then feel free to ask away.  But to interrupt me over and over again?  Hello?  Common sense and courtesy, anyone?  Both are highly lacking here.  

I pulled around to the window and gave my money to a gentleman who was nice but not overly friendly.  Not a big deal.  However, when the woman who was obviously the gem on the drive thru speaker (I say obvious because she was the only one there with a headset on) came to the window, she literally handed me the bag of food, did not look me in the eye a single time and started to close the window.  Not a word was spoken.  No thank you.  No enjpy your food.  No come back again.  Nothing.  I wondered if she had suddenly become a mute.  I said thank you as she was handing me the bag and she literally kept looking over my car and out into the street. Annoyed at this point, as she closed the window I yelled out to her, "Hello?  I said thank you!" She looked at me with a blank stare and walked away.  Again, not a word was spoken by her.  

Unfortunately, the food didn't redeem the horrible customer service.  The fries were obviously old and the tortilla on my grilled chicken wrap was so hard around the edges that I ended up just taking everything out of it and eating it like a salad (which, to be honest, wasn't that bad but I wanted a wrap, dammit!).  My husband did enjoy his burger but his fries were old, too.  

Look - I get that eating at a fast food joint is hit and miss and I understand that going late at night can get even sketchier but there's just no justification for an employee acting like that and most definitely no excuse for the food to be old and hard.  If you're open until midnight or 1am, I should be able to get food that late that's as fresh as it is if I come at the dinner rush.  I'm sympathetic to fast food employees - it's a thankless job, they're not paid well and I'm quite certain that a lot of their customers (especially in this shady area of town) are real pains in the ass.  

With that being said, like I mentioned before, I am NOT a pain the ass when ordering food at any restaurant establishment, and most definitely not if I'm ordering at the drive through of a fast food place.  If I'm being rude and condescending, by all means - dish it back out to me! I don't expect to be treated well if I'm not treating you well.  But if I'm nice, friendly and respectful, is it too much to ask for the same?  

And now I'll close - with this being the longest Yelp review I've ever placed.  Whew!  I'm coming up for air and if you've made it all the way to the end of this, I salute you!

text: Went on New Year's Day to pick up a quick lunch while cooking a large dinner for friends and family. I went through the drive through. Almost nobody there, only one car ahead of me and I was #40 0n my receipt so I know the people working there had plenty of time to get me food done well. I was treated politely and got my food quickly as expected. When I got home and opened the bag is when my expectations were not met. Very poor food quality. Dry chicken sandwich, wilted lettuce, no condiments. Squished Whopper and cold fries. It looked as if they were down to the last buns in the bottom of the box because both sandwiches were flattened. Either that or someone purposely squished them flat. Then they were wrapped and served with old cold fries. Not worth the money for such bad food. Don't make the mistake of coming here, do yourself a favor and go down the street to In-and-Out for a good burger.

name: Burger King

text:
I came here 10 mins before 10pm on a weekday. I wanted to grab something quick to eat while I waited for my friend to drive by and pick me up. Needless to say, the staff had the doors LOCKED tight before 10pm even arrived. The only reason I came is because Yelp indicated they closed at 12 midnight, and who doesn't want a little fast food to kill the time, right? Anyways, all of a sudden the time on here has suddenly changed to 11pm. 

I am so over it and will NEVER be coming here again! Employees that manage franchise locations need to pay attention to the hours posted on line. It is a waste of my time and everyone else to be misleading with store hours of operations!

name: Burger King

text:
Whaaaat... There's a lounge corner and free Wi-Fi!Â  Hey can I just use YOUR Wi-Fi Mr. B King? I sat at their tall cafe tables. Very nice! You can watch the mounted flat screen TV perfectly. They play cool music. There's an indoor kids playground. 

The employees are cool. They all seem to get along and laugh together. Quick customer service indoor and drive thru.

Great value menu. I'll have one of each item :P for my slight fast food binge. Would you care for some brain freeze? There's frosted Coca Cola flavors! Yet another bonus, their soda fountain is a fun touch screen that dispenses a large fruit variety of Sprite! I tried peach! Yaaaaheheeyyyyy!

And the best part of your BK experience shall be...Chocolate candy themed pies! GET. IT.

this location of burger king got me disappointed & angry today, i ordered the crispy chicken meal for $5.00 because they are sending these several coupons in the mail so i thought i enjoy a meal on my way to work, my sandwich was not eatable ! the chicken was hard like rubber, 1st bite in my mouth & i spitted out ! i think they microwaved it for too long !  because i was hungry i went for the fries, they were extra salty which i never asked for extra salt on my food, less salt is always better, so really my meal was just the drink :(

name: Burger King

text:
It's Burger King, no more no less. Consistent meal at a bargain price. We have been taking advantage of the two whopper meal deals and have had good friendly service over the summer. 
Today, like we usually do, we added cheese to the deal for $1 more. Yeah it's a dollar, but we like cheese.  
3-4 bites in the whopper we notice something missing - the cheese! We informed the front counter, and rather than say giving us a slice of cheese or saying bring your burger back so we can put it on - the immediately ordered 2 new whoppers at no charge (they didn't want the original ones back.   Classy!! Remake the food properly.  Kuddos BK, quality move.  (And we were stuffed - couldn't eat any moe of the original whoppers.

text: First of all, the whopper had a few shreds of lettuce and too much mayonnaise. How much could they save by putting a decent piece of lettuce on your sandwich? They had 2 whoppers for $6, by the time we added one order of fries and 2 drinks, we paid as much as 2 value meals with 2 orders of fries and 2 drinks.  The kid at the counter should have suggested that. So now I feel I didn't get a good sandwich or a good value.  Guess what? In-n-Out Burger, McDonalds, Smashburger, Red Robin, Fatburger, Five Guys, Shake Shack all have decent hamburgers. Too bad this place is convenient but I won't be stopping there anymore. You can go anywhere and buy what they sell, in a clean store with a smiling employee and feel like you got a good value.

text:
The manager is rude. We walked in and didn't even say welcome like every other McDonalds does. I was with a couple of friends and ask the manager asked us to wait a minute and we said it was fine. It was more than 5 minutes that we were waiting and still no one there to take our order. She walked past us and my friend asked her if anyone was going to help us. She looked us straight in the eyes about 3 times and said nothing.  I called the store and she answered.  I asked her if anyone is going to help us and once again told us to hold up a minute... The tables and booths were dirty.  There was an employee out of uniform. I worked in fast food restaurants before and you are suppose to use the scoop for the ice not the cup. That's how the manager was doing. She still had us waiting...  Do to her poor customer service and bad attitude we decided to leave.  She really needs training and counseling on her anger management because we are the customers not her friends to be giving us attitude. All we went for was an Ice cream cone. Just one for my friend. 

Thank you,  Will

name: McDonald's

text:
Lately I've been avoiding all Mc Donald's like the plague because almost every time in the last few years we get terrible customer service, and despite my comments on this my husband insisted our midnight soda run for tonight be here cause it's cheap, by home, etc, and I think our experience just a little while ago tonight just convinced him to blacklist going to any Mc Donald's location as well!

After dodging someone that looked like they were going to throw them self into he front of our car (bad druggie neighborhood), we got to the menu and as we were right away reading the sign taped up that said something (it was dark, no lighting really), a lady quickly spoke up and said they're closed because their system is down.

We say OK and begin to drive away-she starts talking to us, asking my husband, "Wait wait, are you the UBER driver". What? We politely say no, and she asks this SEVERAL times, to the effect of "I know but are you the UBER driver?!" and getting snippier each time, no answered to each time, and she still asks yet again! I figured maybe their thing wasn't working right (often found at Mc Donald's speakers it seems), or she simply didn't hear my husband the first many times, so I spoke up just slightly louder than how he was talking (NOWHERE NEAR a yell at all!) and say the same thing so she'd stop asking and let us be on our way.

She quickly barks loudly "DON'T FUCKING YELL. WE'RE CLOSED GO AWAY."

WOW! JUST WOW! Someone needs to lose her job! She is clearly not suited for dealing with customers and upholding any employee standards! And if she doesn't get let go I hope this place goes out of business! It's keeping people like her that steer people away and give you guys a bad reputation!

Better yet I look online at recent to recent ish reviews and they all say how awful and nasty this crew is! No kidding!

Originally I was avoiding this place because of the frequent druggie and pandhandler problems on top of the fact that 80%+ of the time we get sodas here they taste nasty or we were given diet (some of us are badly allergic), but now I am even more openly giving people the word: DO NOT GO HERE.

text: This is the most ratchet mc Donald's in Vegas. There are so many bums hanging around outside with shopping carts and blankets. Then I don't understand how you charge $1.20 for two cookies then $.79 for the third one. I have money that's not the issue. However I find understand how the exact Dang cookie ordered at the same time has a 20 cent up charge.. that is a 33% difference and seems wrong. When I asked the cashier why they were different prices she got on the headset and said "this girl wants to know why the prices are different she thinks I'm ripping her off". First of all I'm a grown woman not a girl. Second I didn't fault her for anything and wasn't rude to her so I'll chop that comment up to her immaturity and lack of professionalism. Also at least walk away from the window before you talk ****.. Luckily I don't live by this ratchet store so this will be the first and last time I ever visit.

text: Typical subway restaurant. The main reason why I give it a two over anything higher is due to the fact that every since time I've gotten a sandwich here, (when put together by specifically one of the workers) it's always not completely folded correctly. This is done in a way that every time unwrap the sandwich half the ingredients are outside the bread and paper wrapped soaked with the majority of the sauces used. It's just disappointing that everything is done so well, but the final step of putting it all together ruins the whole experience.
name: Subway

text:
After reading previous reviews, I assume they must be under new management. This is the only location in town where ingredients seem fresh, and they are always well-stocked. It is also the CLEANEST Subway I have ever been to- by far, and the two owners are fantastic! They are always quick and professional. 

We drive across town to come to this specific location now!
name: Subway

text: The female worker who works at this restaurant is a great person. She makes good quality sandwiches and is friendly with customers. However, two guys who are probably South Asian are terrible employees. I understand their language. I have heard them making fun of customers, whispering to each other and smiling in an insulting manner, if a customer asks for more ingredients. Recently, one of these guys put only two cheese pieces in a footlong sandwich. The management should either discipline or get rid of these employees.
name: Subway

text: I went to this location at 1:30am on a Friday night/morning 7/1/2017 to get French fries. The employee that was working the drive thru said they were only serving breakfast at that time and could not make fries. I knew that couldn't be right because I have gotten fries at this location that late before! So I went to another near by location and got french fries around 1:30 with no problem. I even asked the employee at the other location what time they stop serving French fries for breakfast and he said 4am. I am disappointed that this location closest to my house had an employee that lied because she was too lazy to make more French fries and that I had to drive to a different one. Other than that one employee, I have no problem with this location. But for Mc Donald's in general, I'm disappointed that they got rid of their chicken strips! I know this happened MANY years ago, but I would love if they came back! They were my favorite chicken tenders ever!!

text: I have consistently received not only poor service but the worst food from this McDonalds but tonight put me over the edge prompting me to finally write a review.  Tonight we ordered 2 meals a Big Mac meal and a Filet-o-fish meal.  The fish was a brick!  I have no idea how long it had been sitting prior to use but was completely inedible with barely any sauce.  The Big Mac tasted stale as if old bread had been used.  The fries were your typical re-heat and unsalted.  Anyone that enjoys McDonalds knows there is nothing worse than old fries.  I even questioned if they had given me a vanilla milkshake since it wasn't even mixed.  The only thing enjoyed about this meal was the Dr Pepper which was forgotten as part of the order and had to be asked for.  But I must say, the most entertaining of all was to open my Filet-o-fish box only to find a Big Mac inside and the fish sandwich in the Big Mac Box.  To think these fast food workers campaign for $15 an hour and for your hard earned money give you a meal you wouldn't even feed your dog.  Before resulting to social media to vent my frustrations I opted to call the business to give them an attempt to correct tonight's plethora of errors for the phone to only continue to ring unanswered.

text: If I could give this location no stars I would. They have terrible customer service. I went through the drive-thru late at night to get my sister and I some ice cream after a not so great day. First, no one took my order at the initial drive-in so I pulled up to the first window. Then two employees proceeded to walk back and fourth ignoring us. I finally was able to wave one of them down and asked if I could place a order, his response was go to the next window. Finally hoping I would be able to order another employee, again, ignored us. There was a small crack in the sliding glass so I tried getting his attention. He got upset threw his hands in the air and screamed "were closed, go home!". I went through 15 minutes before they would close at midnight and they managed to waste my time until then... don't waste yours.

text: Worst McDonald's ever. Got my entire order completely wrong, not just one small thing. Ordered 2 cheeseburger happy meals with cheese only and yogurt as the sides. When I called to complain, which I never do but considering the entire order was messed up I did, they were short and rude on the phone. I came back to get a refund and the guy on the phone was rude again and the girl that handed me my money didn't say a word to me and turned around and walked away. I get that it's only McDonald's but if you have no customer service skills than you probably shouldn't work at a place that deals with customers regularly.

text: I've never had an issue with hot food and fast service at McDonalds but the crew today at the window didn't do a good job at all. I ordered my food, paid, pulled to the pickup window - the girl at the window handed me my drink, told me they were waiting on the hash brown and to pull out of the drive thru and park (there were no cars behind me) I pulled straight ahead out of the drive thru and parked in the first open spot ahead of the drive thru, I have a bright blue car - hard to miss. I waited 10-15 min with no one coming. I drove back thru the drive thru and the kid said "oh we walked around the entire building looking for you!" Again, I was hard to miss. Got up to the window and the girl was laughing, handed me my food and I drove off. No apology, no offer to credit, and my order was wrong. Poor service all the way around today from the drive thru crew at 12:15 pm time frame.

These guys ought to get out of the fast food business. They are pathetic at running a fast food store. Slow, unorganized,  lost!

text:
NEVER GO TO THIS McD!

This is the worst McD in the valley and its closest to me so I end up going to it. However they screw up orders alot, and they have the rudest managers. When you complain about their mistakes they make excuses instead of just fixing it. When you complain about that, they say you can just go to another McD and see if they will help you.

The owner of this place should fire all the Managers and find some who know how to work with customers as mistakes happen but they shouldn't happen so many times a day that when a customer like me how only goes once in a while is always getting mistakes. If I get them for almost every visit just image how many times they are making them in a day for me to hit those kind of odds.

There is no reason for a manager to tell you to go some place else. There is no reason for a manager to make excuses for the mistakes. They should just apologize and fix the mistake that is all we want them to do when they make mistakes.

text: This is the worst McDonalds in all of the ones I have visited in my entire 47 years alive.  I have sent my comments to McDonalds Corp and to their district office and yet no improvement. We had the best service, and when we messed up an order, we immediately made it right no questions asked.  This McDonalds treat you like they are doing you a favor for serving you when it should be they should be thanking me for visiting.  I have lived in the neighborhood for 13 years and this McDonalds has never improved.  Maybe it's not the management but the owner who does not care.  He or she should have their franchise license revoke for poor service.

text:
In a hurry, do not order mobile pickup. It will take over 25 minutes upon arrival, or they will claim they don't have your order.

Want great service? Go elsewhere. They are oblivious here. They used to have a great young girl as a lead months and months ago and she did a great job running the shift. But these days you have a middle aged woman who's a bit slow and when she's receiving payment for kiosk orders, she's so lost.

Just don't go here if you're expecting fast anything.

When they just microwave burgers why does it take 15 minutes to get that order out?

General manager, useless, provides a phone number in store that only goes to the store number and she never answers nor do any employees. Useless.

Also, ground beef recall due to Listeria. Eat at your own risk.  Go to FDA food recalls for details.

name: Starbucks

text: You can't go wrong with Starbucks.... With that said, this has got to be the SLOWEST service in town. No matter what time or however many people inside or at the drive thru, expect to wait at least 10min for a drink (that's AFTER you wait in line to place your order). Three stars instead of 5
name: Starbucks

text:
A nice start to the day 


This Starbucks is not my usual stop however, it's one of  my favorite. I love my coffee and what's better then a Starbucks iced white chocolate mocha, I can't think of anything, well maybe a vanilla scone.

The service at this Starbucks might not be the fastest but it's still phenomenal and the staff are always very friendly. This location is clean, inviting, and feels comfortable and they have seating outside at the patio, plus a drive thru.

My coffee was made exactly the way I order and tasted great. In addition, to the great coffee Starbucks has delicious pastries if you need a snack. I really enjoy grabbing a cake pop or two to go.

Great coffee, pastries,  friendly staff, and shopping.  It doesn't get any better.
name: Starbucks

text: This place closes at 9, I know employees hate people who come in last minute but it's still your job to be compatible and manage. I came at 8:55pm and the lights were off but the register was on and the girl was still there. I hadn't even got to the counter yet and " umm, were closed." I said no, there's 5 minutes til closing its 8:55. "Sorry I already cleaned everything" are you kidding me? I just saw a couple walk out with fresh caramel lattes before I walked in but you won't serve me?! I've worked at smoothie and tea places, just bc you cleaned everything doesn't mean you don't serve me bc you don't feel like cleaning the blender one more time! This was beyond rude and lazy, this girl shouldn't have a job if your going to treat customers like that! (Ps. It takes 2 minutes to make a drink) LAZY.
name: Starbucks

text:
I've been to this mcDonalds a million times but it's the first time I really want to say this hoping McDonald is reading. 

The manager is really nice but I think either the staff are trained badly or it's just a bad case of lord of the flies there. 

It's a Sunday morning, we used the kiosk to order and the receipt was jammed inside. I walked over to the counter and asked the first person to help me, to which she responded " yeah the machine is jammed so you don't get a receipt but I will get your food". I tried twice to explain to her that I could see my receipt in the slot but she just kept giving me the same respond. A second person (some teenager with a frown clearing showing how much she didn't want to be there) chimed in with "ma'm that is not your receipt, there is no receipt and we can't print another one for you"        . What she meant was "it's just a stupid receipt and stop asking us". I already know it's not true because this happened before and I got one re printed. Frankly I really didn't care about the receipt, it's the general laziness of either of them walking back there to get the someone with a key bit that probably bothered me more. Never mind that legally they have to give a customer a receipt when asked. 

While I was waiting to speak with the manager, a customer walked up and said "I ordered two sausage egg mcmuffins and these have neither sausage or egg in them". At that point he manager just arrived to the front with all 3 of the servers gawking at the  meatless/eggless sandwiches with no clue what to do and me standing there waiting for a receipt. It's almost comical. 

Of course I got my receipt (exactly where I saw it stuck inside) and many apologies from the manager. And the guy got two new sandwiches and happy. Just makes you wonder if the manager is doing everything why they even need the others. 

One thing about McDonalds food is that it's consistent - it's not gourmet but it serves it purpose.  Just unfortunate they could find consistently "with it" people to work there. It's the restaurant business I guess. 

By the way it's a 24 hour location so the info for the restaurant needs to be changed.

name: McDonald's

text:
First, the limited time Italian Pesto Chicken Sandwich is incredible.  Fresh parmesan shavings, arugula, focaccia bun.... OMG!  Please make it a permanent item! 

This is a really well run store! 

Staff are friendly and go out of their way to help. 

Once the restaurant is closed, they don't nag you, every 15 minutes, to get out.... Unlike the North Queen store, beside Panera! 

It's also one of the FEW Stores whose restaurant, inside, is open until Midnight.

On that topic.  McDonalds used to be open 24 hours a day, INSIDE the restaurant.  Now, I can't find ANY, in West Toronto or Mississauga, open 24 hours, and only 2 or 3 that are open until Midnight!

I hope that McDonalds improves the late inside restaurant hours, across the board, asap.  I refuse to buy ANYTHING but snacks, desserts, smoothies, milkshakes and coffee using the drive through. 

And I know that I'm not the only one!!!

text: I placed my order at the drive thru and from the time I paid until the time I reached the pick up window it was 10 minutes. Even when I got to the pick up window, no one showed up for a good minute. When I reached inside the bag, the fries were cold. When I went in to the restaurant, they told me I could wait another 5 minutes to get a fresh order and that I had to understand that 3:45 is their rush hour. What that has to do with cold fries, I don't understand.  I got my money back, left and contacted McD's online. The response was "sorry we disappointed you, we are working on it, but go back and try again. Sorry, I am not here waste my time to test out whether you are improving or not. At least there is a Burger King around the corner. Too bad you can't give no stars.

name: McDonald's

text:
Been coming to this McDonald's for almost a year, I've never been inside, I always drive thru. The order takers are usually nice and professional sounding. Especially the dude with the thick black glasses that works 1st window on day shift. He should broadcast radio, open and close the doors on Go trains or be the next generation TD Canada easy line voice. 
Every now and then you'll come across a snobby one. But I'm always polite as possible and they get thrown off by my positive attitude. Please and thank you's? Yes they still exist. So my tip to the reader is, be polite to the people that your belly depends on. Remember, they're handling your food.
A piece of hair stuck in the back of your throat? Felt something solid hit your tongue while sucking your drink through the straw? Yea but you thought nothing of it and still swallowed.
I've never had issues with my serving but the way I hear people in front or behind me yelling in the speaker, erks my soul.

text: A lot of seats, parking is big, clean, busy, customer service is 5 out 10. Looks a great place tp study
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks always does an amazing job; not only with their drinks and food but with customer service.  The last time I was there the guy at the drive-thru window was very friendly...he made my day!  It can get busy here sometimes but the lines always move very fast.  I love when a business knows how to do their job and provide the best customer.  Please continue to be as great as you are!!!!
name: Starbucks

text: I have a complicated drink and they always make it perfectly! The one time they got it wrong they fixed it with pleasure. Never been inside but it looks like they have a cute outdoor seating area.
name: Starbucks

text:
We stopped at this location for coffee and bathroom break during our road trip. It was a short visit. Place seemed nice and clean. The cashier looked like they could care less about taking my order. Took him a few minutes to realize I was even standing at his register. When I saw the barista making my drink, there was more than a splash of coconut milk in my Double Shot on Ice. He was pouring more like it was a latte or possibly to hide the lack of espresso shots he had. 

I don't typically get drinks remade unless they put actual milk vs alternative. If I lived around there, I might try one more time during a drive-thru. However, not impressed compared to my typicall experience for the chain.
name: Starbucks

text: So excited I just wasted money ... not sure why when you say no sweetener in ice coffee they always put it in... I hate sugar in my coffee I find it to be disgusting plus I can't have sugar.  Please listen to your customers this is an on going issue at all Starbucks
name: Starbucks

text: Second day in a row going to this Starbucks... second day in a row that I nearly witnessed an accident involving three cars trying to get into the drive-through.  They were out of iced venti flat lids today.  Somewhat disappointing considering a dome lid and a very Berry Hibiscus refresher aren't a good combo.  I requested a scoop of strawberries added into my drink on my app.  I found out when I picked up my drink that they were out.  Thankfully, I used my reward on this drink and didn't get overcharged.  Not the best Starbucks experience.  I'll be going back to Afton Ridge tomorrow.
name: Starbucks

text: Got a reduced fat turkey bacon sandwich. Love those but I find out today that they're not so good cold. Two step process. Warm sandwich. Serve sandwich. How exactly do you miss one of these steps? $8 meal for this corporate BS. Maybe Starbucks should pay $15 an hour then customers wouldn't get bad food and bad service. I've already scratched 2 Starbucks off my list that are near my house. Now this one is scratched off. I have one left in a grocery store near work. Once they screw up it'll be Indy coffee shops which is what I should be doing anyway.
name: Starbucks

text: This Starbucks is next to my house and I always go here but lately it has been the slowest drive through ever. It's so frustrating to order a Frappuccino and then wait 30 mins (no joke!) in line only to get a watered down, syrupy frappe. I will not be returning to this Starbucks again for that reason. Get more competent and speedy baristas! SO annoying!!
name: Starbucks

text: This may be the last time I come to this Starbucks. It is the slowest drive through I've EVER been in. It's like this every time. Got here @ 2:05 finally got my drink @2:21.....
name: Starbucks

text: Worst Starbucks ever! I live three blocks away and drive on the highway to go pass this one. They always make my drink wrong, slowest drive through and the other day the young lady taking my order got a terrible attitude with me.
name: Starbucks

text: Has got to be the slowest Starbucks in the Carolinas !!! Every time I come here I'm waiting forever whether it be inside or the drive through. Could be a little more clean as well !
name: Starbucks

text:
Subway is nothing out of the ordinary, but what I will say is that it is considerably easier to eat healthier here vs other fast food chains.

This location is typically filled with employees from the surrounding courthouse along with customers from the light rail station. 

One thing about this location is that the hours are a bit shorter, but it is to be expected. Service is average and efficient.

name: Subway

text: Have come here a lot, usually to study. Baristas are nice and drinks come out quick. There are plenty of different seating options though the ones near the windows in the winter are pretty cold. There's a good mix of grad students and professionals and everyone seems pretty nice.
name: Starbucks

text:
I am a Starbucks fiend - I have probably been to a Starbucks in every major city in the US, and this is definitely one of the coziest and friendliest ones I've been to! 

I love the fire place and different seating options, the baristas always get my tricky drink orders right and are always very pleasant -- especially the 6 am weekday crew. (I should really learn their names!)

Four stars for the painfully long lines on the weekends, but maybe everyone just loves this location as much as me!
name: Starbucks

text:
I really love this location of Starbucks. The seats by the fireplace are so cozy for a browsing on your laptop or reading a newspaper. There are two long tables at the front, a few high top tables, and various tables scattered about that can sit 2 - 4 people. The employees here are always friendly and the service is quick in the afternoon and evening (I haven't visited during morning rush hour time so I can't speak for that). It can get packed in the evenings, especially when exams hit the CWRU undergrads, so just keep that in mind. 

I've never had a problem finding a seat near an outlet, if I needed it - some of the outlets on the floors didn't work for me, but I haven't tried since. 

Overall, this is a great location for a study spot or to catch up with a friend, especially since it is just down the street from some great restaurants.
name: Starbucks

text:
Pretty nice location with a garage in the back (25c per hour). Very spacious Starbucks with plentiful seating and lots of outlets - great for studying! They also have giant full-length windows facing Cedar so great for people watching too :)

Sat here for about an hour enjoying my coffee and saw lots of foot traffic come through here, but on a weekday morning, there were no more than 3-4 people in line at a time, and I received my drink within 5 minutes of ordering, so they seem to be well staffed. It was also really quiet compared to other Starbucks that I've been to, so again, probably a great study spot :)
name: Starbucks

text:
Coffee of course is good. The worker who made my drink not so much. I went in there with a "secret menu" request and the cashier took down the recipe but the other lady making the drinks complained the entire time right to my face saying "I hate my life" "I hate when people make these requests"... like lady I'm standing right here. 
She definitely is giving Starbucks and probably this location a bad rep
name: Starbucks

text:
Woah, this is a nice Starbucks.

Very spacious, interestingly laid out, and has a small faux-fireplace with couches surrounding it in the back right corner. Also has window seating facing Cedar Rd., so there's a lot of seating options here.

The coffee is normal; it's Starbucks, after all. You can't really complain.

Really a solid place to hold an interview, or to study. It's close to my current residence, so it's nice to go and read a book there.
name: Starbucks

text: Great place to work/study if you are a student. Many outlets, many tables and chairs. Also a comfy corner with a fireplace. I like to get a nice cup of coffee or tea and just study for like 4-5hours straight. No one ever bothers me and the staff is chill.
name: Starbucks

text: First time ever in this location. Not only did it take 25 minutes at 8 AM, but I found 3 inch long white hair in the frothed milk on top of my drink that conveniently went right into my mouth.
name: Starbucks

text: Seating is pretty good and it's a decent spot to sit and work as well. It's a bit too crowded or loud at times, but overall have had a positive experience here.
name: Starbucks

text: A dependable positive Starbucks experience. Courteous, speedy service. Delicious coffee. Ample seating. Challenging neighborhood parking.
name: Starbucks

text:
Horrible service! 
The cashier was on such a hurry,  made our drinks so fast like it was time for her to go home.
Our drinks where sssoooo watery..yuk!!
I Won't be back!!
name: Starbucks

text: Can't even give them one star.  Terrible and unintelligent employees. Unable to follow simple instructions. Will never return.
name: Starbucks

text: Pretty generic Starbucks near Pitt campus. As it's near the university areas, it tends to be more populated during the day. Busy times include early morning, noon (during lunch), and early afternoons (when students get out of class). They do take Rewards if you're part of the chain's rewards program. Seating is adequate and there are some couches? on the left side when you walk into the coffee shop. Order ahead on your mobile phone to avoid long lines (not sure how much faster, but usually wait time difference is noticeable). Certainly convenient for students/people working nearby, but probably not the best location to go to.
name: Starbucks

text: I want to give this place a better review, I really do. After all, the employees are always friendly, and they make the best latte of any Starbucks around, but it drives me absolutely insane that they only ever have half & half out. I hate half and half. A lot. It leaves a funky coating on the inside of my mouth. There is no reason why they can't leave milk out. They claim it's because not enough people want milk, but I'm not sure why that would matter. You can leave milk out for a REALLY long time before it goes sour, especially in the insulated container they keep it in. So every single time, which is 3 or 4 days a week, I have to bug the barista for the super secret cold milk. *sigh*
name: Starbucks

text:
At this particular location use the mobile order app! I think there were more people who came in to pick up mobile orders then there were actually standing in line. 

I didn't actually stay and sit this visit but the seating area always looks packed. You'll be lucky to find a place to sit let alone an outlet. 

The countertops where the cream and sugars are were very dirty. I know it was busy and everyone behind the counter was busy but it wouldn't take long time have some one wipe them down occasionally. 

I'm a fan of Starbucks so even after not so great experiences I still end up going back.
name: Starbucks

text:
I tend to prefer this Starbucks when I'm in a bit of a rush because I've found the workers tend to be faster yet careful in making drinks. Plus the close alternative is the Starbucks on Fifth and ALL of the PITT students go there ... Having the mobile app helps a lot! Especially if you frequent pretty often, like me.

But if you're looking for a place to sit, good luck! The interior isn't as well-lit as I would have hoped it to be but I think it's the fault of the location, if anything.

For non-coffee drinks, I tend to get the strawberry aÃ§aÃ­ refresher when I'm in need of something refreshing and light. I get the hot matcha green tea latte when it's cold out. The jade citrus mint tea with honey is good for a sore throat! If you bring your own cup, you get a few cents discounted.

For coffee drinks, I get the lattes sometimes with a pump or two of syrup. Take advantage of the customizations you can make! I've fallen in love with the blonde roast, personally. Try it out!
name: Starbucks

text: Solid Starbucks. I go to this location when I meet friends in Oakland for lunch. I would never go out of my to go to this one. Parking is almost always a nightmare in Oakland. Students are done for the summer now so it is not as bad. I got my usual (chai tea latte). It did not disappoint. Service was quick and friendly. I will continue to return while school is not in session.
name: Starbucks

text:
I had to finally just write an updated review because quite frankly Starbucks has upped their game in my eyes. The staff is super friendly, no attitude anymore, and they are willing to give their opinions on drinks even when the lines are long. It is lovely. 

Yes, it is still crowded; yes, it is still loud; yes, the lines will still be long. I now stand before you and say so what. Do what I do---STARBUCKS APP. Yep. I just put my order in while on the bus and by the time I walk down there BOOM it is made and I just take it and walk out. This app is amazing. After 12 drinks you then even start earning free food and drinks!! How is that not the best thing ever? 

Ok. So the reason for the updated review is because of the Citrus Green Tea Latte. Picture this, a lovely lunch in Oakland is finished and I was asked if I would want some coffee. I am not the biggest coffee drinker but just thought, eh why not. The lines were short and since the person I was going with did not have the app I just went through the line like a "regular Starbucks customer" (;-) LOL.) The big sign hanging above the register spoke to me. Citrus Green Tea. YUM. I asked the staff member waiting on me his thoughts on the new bevvy. He said it was, "very citrusy and refreshing". My next question was about the sweetness. He assured me that it would not be overly sweet and I would enjoy it. Since I had a free drink coupon I thought, what the hell, I'll try it. 

I am honestly saying I am happy that I did. This is a seasonal beverage and I hope, AND PRAY. That they decide to keep it. It was refreshing and citrusy just like the staff told me. Basically, it was everything I have ever hoped for in a green tea citrus drink. 

I came back to the office and made four girls try it. Everyone loved it!!! (Good thing I got the biggest size!!!) I am looking forward to going back for more! Yum!!
name: Starbucks

text:
Solid Starbucks. There is nothing special about this location in comparison to the stereotypical Sbucks setup, but there is also nothing blatantly negative either. 

The service was speedy, baristas were friendly, and the product is not easily distinguished from any other location - I got a grande iced soy latte and it was everything you would expect!

It was a little chilly indoors, but there was a good amount of seating, outlet access, and clean bathrooms without a line.
name: Starbucks

text: It was your normal Starbucks I always think there prices are high for coffee but I have a gold card and my refills are free they changed the gold card rules so it's harder to get enough points for a free item. I always get a Trenta water to go it's filtered 10 times and keeps me hydrated.
name: Starbucks

text: It's pretty much your normal Starbucks. Lots of seating and the baristas are pretty efficient (and super friendly!), but it's always packed. It's a coffee shop on a college campus.
name: Starbucks

text: Pull up to the drive-through and ask for a second. No response, no big deal some people just don't have manners. Pull up to the drive-through window and I'm handed a cup of red fruit punch that has more on the outside of the cup than it does on the inside. That is just what I want red fruit punch all over the tan interior of my car. Asked the girl to wipe the cup off, you would've thought I asked her to shoot her dog. Get my items MINUS 2 things that I paid for. This is the worst Wendy's ever. I would not return.

name: Wendy's

text:
Yesterday I had a very late evening and against my better judgement stopped here to get a cheeseburger rather than cook at home at 9PM. The burger came browned on outside, raw on the inside.

Empoyee workers could care less when I went back inside after biting into the thing and thinking "yech." Employees handed to manager and showed no interest whatsoever at this. Manager didn't know quite what to do .. offered to make me another - I told him I had no appetite for a burger now, please just give me a refund. The excuse I got was that the timer on the burger grill doesn't always work right, and sometimes opens the grill early. . 

You'd think they would be a little more concerned about serving uncooked meat. The staff are clueless and careless millenials. 

This experience has turned me off of fast food - and certainly Wendy's

text: It's a Starbucks....  The toilets are clean and don't require a code. There are stairs though to get to the bathroom,  sorry strollers and wheelchairs.  The WiFi is fast and doesn't require a code either.  So,  it makes for a nice stop while venturing around old Montreal.
name: Starbucks

text: Bad customer service. They could not get simple order right. No bathroom, and the carpet are incredibly dirty. Bad seating.
name: Starbucks

text:
This Bucks is close to the Notre Dame cathedral, and is a quick and easy rest spot if you're trotting through the Vieux Port. 
We went in a Sunday afternoon. Not very busy, no line up, friendly staff. An all-around average Starbucks experience.
name: Starbucks

text: Stuff is so friendly! I got my frappuccino really fast! There is only one thing. I said I want a frappuccino with coffe, but a cashier understood me wrong and made it without))
name: Starbucks

text:
It is a nice place and relatively spacious considering the location.

However, the choice of music is unacceptable with a variety of clients that are workers, tourists and a multi-cultural.

Granted Starbucks wants to be seen as an unconditional welcoming coffee shop, but the music should be not promote "gang violence", opposition to faith nor promote/impose ideas.

But the doppio tops most espressos in the market.
name: Starbucks

text:
Amazing staff! 
I just went through the drive-thru...I ordered a London Fog with a "make me something cold with no dairy and not too sweet.  Sweet is ok but not too sweet. Be creative." 
And I got an amazing cold drink that was amazing! And the gentleman at the drive thru window was very friendly and pleasant. 
Good job. 
I will be back with my friends.
name: Starbucks

text:
Service is always slow at this location even when there is no one else around. Staff aren't as friendly as at other locations. I ordered a cream cheese Danish from this location which I had many times before. When I took it from the worker it was so hot it literally burnt my hand. When I told her it was dangerous and maybe the heat was too high on the oven they didn't seem to care. I even got her to touch the pastry bag and she had to pull her hand back right away. Some could be seriously hurt if they had put that to their mouth. I often get pastries for my children from Starbucks so I am happy I was the first to handle the pastry. 
The last time I went through the drive thru it took 20 minutes for me to get my drink and there was no one in front of me. They never apologized for the wait!
name: Starbucks

text: Inside of the supermarket, the kids that work here are often on their phones or making chitchat with each other. I've had a muffin that was still frozen here before along with banana bread, a pastry and a donut that tasted like garbage. The drinks taste like, well, Starbucks. Pull out your $6-7$ and drink up, but the service could be better for sure.
name: Starbucks

text:
Watching her wipe her sweat away from her forehead and hair then making my coffeeâ€�
.
.
.
.
.
.
name: Starbucks

text: It's Starbucks haha what else is there to say. There all the same overpriced coffee and etc. good luck.
name: Starbucks

text:
A solid 3.5 star Starbucks that is located upstairs in the new Holt Renfrew hallway.  

Most mall Starbucks are lacklustre but they do serve decent coffee when you're dying for a caffeine hit.  This one in particular was actually quite amazing as it has a CLOVER!  For all those who truly like good coffee, the clover is a programmable brewing system that takes in account everything... time, temp, pressure, and it's programmed at HQ for each specific bean.  They only use their reserve beans for Clover.  If there is ever a time to drink coffee black at Starbucks... this would be it.  

The service wasn't very fast but I dont blame the staff... they had at least 6 people at all times going at it.  The people who are not used to ordering at Starbucks was dragging down the wait time in a PAINFUL way.  I almost feel like they need a primer ... I digress.  

They do have several tables off to the side to enjoy your coffee.  It was quite packed during a random Sunday and I would say it's probably hard to snag the tables for 4.  I wouldnt say this is a good place to work but a decent place to people watch.  Especially for those who struggle painfully to order a medium double double.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text: The Starbucks is a really nice reserve Starbucks but the line is always out the door because it's located inside of them all. I wish it was larger but I feel like this location is always jampacked because of where it's located in the mall specifically. I would definitely be back and all the employees are very nice here.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text: I like that Square One finally has a Starbucks where you can sit down and enjoy your drink. This is located right by Hudson's Bay/Top Shop when you get into the mall. When my friend and I lined up there were about 4 people in front of us and the cashier zipped through the line in 5 minutes, I swear. The baristas had our spicy chorizo breakfast sandwiches and our frappuccinos within 5 minutes which was awesome because I was starving. I recommend this place for a nice break while shopping for sure.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text: I went to the new Starbucks in Square One by Club Monaco. The drinks were amazing and so was the barista who served my girlfriend and I. At first we were served by someone and ordered one drink and noticed that they had a promotion for new members to get a free drink, I had signed up and did not receive the promotion for the drink. We spoke to Rebecca who was really busy at the time and she was able to assist us in a timely fashion and suggested a drink in which I've never tasted (but was amazing). I don't normally write reviews, but she offered great customer service and will now be a loyal customer to the Starbucks franchise. Thanks again Rebecca.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text:
Very efficient for a very busy Starbucks. But the floors seem pretty dirty, tables are nice and clean though.

Staff are attentive and friendly. No problems with correcting mistakes at all.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text:
This location of Starbucks is usually busy even when it was not renovated. There is decent amount of seat as its in a mall to seat down and have sip. 

I didn't have any problems with the service but it does take time if there is a big lineup.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text: Quick efficient service , not many lineups  compared to other locations in the mall.   Love the frappuccinos  in the summer ,and the lattes in winter.   Saw some exotic coffees and the barista  recommended the Vietnamese coffee as it's quite strong . That's the coffee I shall try next
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text:
I usually go to this location in Square One when I am at work and each time they never fail to meet my standards. I usually order a white chocolate mocha, a cheese sandwich, or a bacon and cheese breakfast sandwich. All items meet my expectations and I have never had any issues with any of the items I have ordered. 
This location is the busiest I would say. Peak hours are lunch time and 3-6pm. It gets CRAZY busy and so I would recommend putting your order through the online app! It seriously beats waiting in the long line...although the line does move quickly. 
When it gets busy and you're waiting for your online order, they usually say your name aloud so you're aware when your order is ready, and you can get it promptly :) (it's hard to see your order on the counter when a crowd of people are blocking your view).
In addition, this Starbucks location is close to the parking garage entrance so if you park at p5 I believe, go up the escalators and you'll be in the luxury wing and at Starbucks!
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text: I love this location. Friendly staff and they make my coffee the way I like. Unfortunately it's closing on the April 15th.
categories: Food, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Desserts
name: Starbucks

text: The only reason for one star is that the cashier was very sweet.  This place is filthy.  Staff could care less that you are there.  Waited 15 mins for a hamburger.  I won't be back.

name: Burger King

text:
Yeah, it's a burger king. You cant expect much. However, at the leat I would expect to be treated as an adult human being when talked to by another human being. My example started out simple enough. They got my order wrong. No huge deal. I asked for no onion and no mayo on my burger, which happened to be a double whopper. I had ordered through the drive through with my wife because we were pressed for time before a movie started. We started eating in the movie theatre parking lot, and I noticed that my burger had the two things that I asked not to be on it, after the drive thru repeated it back to me "double whopper, no onion no mayo". Again, not a deal breaker. I called and informed them that my burger was wrong. The guy who answered put who I could only assume was his manager, She Satan. She answered the phone and said, "Yeah, you got a problem with your burger?" No hello, nothing. I said,"Yeah I ordered my burger with no mayo and no onion." She said, "I find that hard to believe since our burgers don't come with onion or mayo." Now I am getting a little perturbed. You start off the phone call rudely, then you accuse your customer of lying. I said, "I am looking at it right now, and it has both on my Double Whopper." She said, "Oh, Double Whopper? That isn't a burger. " Get the hell over yourself lady. After that, she was just playing with me. I said, "Nevermond, I am never returning to this place again." 

If you want to be treated like trash, go to this place.

name: Burger King

text:
Dirty. Ripped. Stained. Sticky. Broken.
Those are words that come to mind when I sit here and look around at their dinning rooms.
Sesame seeds are filling the cracks in their used up, worn and torn benches.
 The men's washroom toilet stall has a screw on the door to hook your jacket on!
Very ghetto.
Whoever does their overnight cleaning (if that ever happens) needs to bring a vacuum and use it in all the sesame filled cracks and corners.

This place needs a DEEP cleaning, not the surface cleaning they rarely seem to do.
This is the kind of place that would be featured on a "Kitchen Nightmare" episode with Gordon Ramsey screaming "you don't care!" while pointing out all dirty torn seats.

The seating area at the front windows facing Samson blvd are really hot in winter (before noon on Jan. 30) good for those of us that need a tan or need to thaw when coming in from the cold winter.

Definitely the best McDonald's location of this area, it is facing a farmer's field where you can sit starring out, wondering when your life went so wrong.

Whenever I get drive-thru they skimp on the fries, their mediums are always half full.

This morning (Monday) they were out of peppermint tea and I heard a woman tell another client they were out of something else.

Their chocolate shakes have always been good though!
Their wifi is very good too.

This is the biggest of the 3 McDonald's in this area, the other 2 are on the 13 next to the Couche-Tards and the other is inside the  Walmart.

It is just so easy to notice how dirty this place is. And when the dinning room is dirty it is ALWAYS an indication of how dirty the kitchen is and it often is a reflection of the staff but more importantly the owner and managers.

Fast (Junk) food doesn't have to be eaten in a dirty environment, or maybe the two go together like the sea and sand?

The owners should go visit the Pierrefonds location on blvd St-Charles, which, in my opinion is a cleaner, better run restaurant.

Maybe my standards are too high? Nah! Theirs are too low. 
These are some of the reasons why a lot of people don't come to fast food restaurants.

P.S. after I wrote this I read other reviews on another website that starts with a G...and a lot of people are saying the same thing as me: Dirty, broke down, out of items, GHETTO.

"Would you like me to hook your coat or this screw madam?"
"Well, thank you my dear boy!"

text:
Tropicana inside shell gas station.
My lunch started at 12:00pm I arrived at this location at 12:05pm I've been sitting inside my truck at the drive through for 20 minutes it is now 12:25pm this is the slowest most pathetic service I've ever encountered. I then decided to leave the drive thru park my truck go inside to find five people waiting in line and only one person making sandwiches what a joke I'll never go there again
name: Subway

text: Long story short, today was my final straw with this location even though it is closest to my work and has a convenient drive thru. I always place my order online so I can pick it up quickly and not once has it been quick in the year that I have been coming to this location. For example, today it took me 20 minutes and 2 times through the drive thru just to get my sandwich that was ready for pick up 10 minutes prior to my arrival. I have even tried going inside when I have more time and the service is extremely slow. It has never been packed or even busy, they just disappear in the back and try to make up for it with extreme kindness and smiles EVERY TIME. Very frustrating when I give them the benefit of doubt for a whole year, and nothing ever changes except it gets worse.
name: Subway

text: The worst service in Oakland. Ordered a burrito bowl with steak and received maybe half a scoop (about 6-7 cubes of steak) and politely asked for a little more - considering it's supposed to be $8 worth  - and was told I would have to pay double meat to receive anymore. There was a very short line, unlike how packed it usually is, so I had commented on why "accommodations" (throw a couple cubes of steak on top) couldn't have been made to receive a reasonable amount of protein, but was given attitude and eye-rolling. When I went to pay, I stood around the cashier for awhile because they had refused to hand me my food/slide it across the counter to indicate it was mine. My friend I was with had also tried to ask for more chicken -as she had received a very little amount as I did- since she had only ordered a salad. Very poor customer service, very small amounts of food.
