text:
This place is a sh*tshow.

A customer wandered off mid-order, and one of the two idiots working the line decided that the appropriate response was a hard-target search of every gas station, residence, warehouse, farmhouse, henhouse, outhouse and doghouse in the area.   Those of us in line didn't mind the wait at all, because "lunch hour" is a misnomer and we actually all have unlimited time.  You can only imagine how relieved we were when the errant customer was finally located (upstairs!) and able to tell him what kind of rice she wanted.

The register was operated by a tyrannosaurus rex disguised as a young woman.  At least, I assume it was a tyrannosaurus rex, based on the fact that she seemed unable to extend her arms away from her body to accept payment or hand me a receipt, and she only spoke in grunts.  A real charmer.  This place doesn't have a hiring problem at all.

The burrito was typical Chipotle: Poorly wrapped, falling apart, and loaded with sueÃ±os rotos.   I'll definitely be walking past this place again, on my way somewhere else for lunch.

text: Nasty staff. An older indian women. I Ordered greentea latte, asked this lady who makes it if it has suger and she grumpdly said no. So i said i would like to have some agave in it and she again said" we dont have that , just add your own."  Later i found out there is honey packets and she never offered to me. And she rudely slap down the drink on the table and didnt annouce what it is, i have to like ask and she didnt put the hand protector ard the cup so its burning my hands, since i am in a rush i just grab the tea and left. When i took a sip the latte it was so sweet. Worst experience in all thr starbucks i have been too. I mean if i am paying that much for a drink i expect my drinks come out correctly and be treated with respect. I will report this joint to the starbuck head quarter.
address: Pearson Airport Terminal 3, 6301 Silver Dart Drive
name: Starbucks

text:
I literally just ordered 2 minutes ago and I had to write this review ASAP because this is the worst Starbucks i have ever been to. Save your money and do not buy from here. I would give this NEGATIVE stars if I could. 

I ordered an iced blooming rose tea latte and I overheard the staff talking about if the drink I ordered had any special requests and I think the younger barista was saying something about if the customer doesn't like the drink then *shrug*. I am not 100% sure what they were talking about because it was loud but it was something along the lines of what I had typed earlier. It was the fact that she a whole "i dont care" attitude when she was talking to the older lady. 
Anyway, I saw her shaking/mixing the drink IN THE CUP with the lid... this made the lid dirty and i have never ever seen a Starbucks barista shake and mix the drink with the lid on. My best friend has worked at Starbucks for years and told me they dont do this. I usually like watching the baristas mix drinks so this was very unusual. In addition, the drink was not even mixed well. It was very powdery and you can see the powder sticking on the side of the cup. ALSO it was not filled up to the top. The younger barista tried to play it off by saying it was just the powder that makes it look not full(??).. are you kidding me? I have never received a Starbucks drink that wasn't filled up to the rim or close to the rim. This was an inch off of the rim. When she remade it, she did not use the cup to mix. Told you so. 

When i told her that it tasted powdery, she just took my drink and threw it away and said nothing to me and started remaking it. Talk about HORRIBLE customer service. How can you hire someone like this? Seriously. Okay, even if she was having a bad day, you could at least tell me youre going to say "sorry about that. I'll remake your drink." I'm not even asking you to be friendly, just let me know. She literally just took it and threw it away. Absolutely unacceptable customer service. Don't give your customer attitude for something that you screwed up on. Doesn't make any fricking sense.

EDIT: ordered light ice and they gave me regular ice. Tossed the drink next to the POS machine without any mention that it was my drink; they just nudged it towards me. Franchise owner needs to fire these employees and be updated about the terrible reviews on Yelp. None are good reviews. They dont deserve to continue working in customer service and if they continue to serve customers like the way they served me, Starbucks will be painted in a bad light.
address: Pearson Airport Terminal 3, 6301 Silver Dart Drive
name: Starbucks

text: Worst Starbucks location ever. They sold us a breakfast sandwich that was missing half the meat. When we asked them about it, the staff was extremely rude and told us too bad. It came that way so we just have to deal with it. We refused this answer. We paid nearly $5 and expect to get what we paid for. The cashier took the sandwich and threw it across to the garbage and then continued being rude. We asked for a replacement and she acted as if we were the troublemakers. We only want what we paid for. It's in the airport so they have a captive audience and I suppose they believe such service can pass. Next time we'll visit another business in Terminal 3. Starbucks corporate should not let franchisees like this one ruin their image.

name: McDonald's

text:
So I did mobile order curbside pickup, and if you've ever done this then you know the app says "your food will be out shortly" when you're parked, and once you leave "thanks for stopping by!" Comes up, which means the order was completed. 
Well, after about 10 minutes of sitting there, the "thanks for stopping by!" Comes up, and I'm like wait what.. I didn't get my food? So I go inside and I show them my phone and I'm like "why's it say this when I never got my food?" Long story short... come to realize they skipped over my order. The manager excuse was, and I kid you not, "when we get busy we just click complete on the mobile curbside pickup orders and just remember it in our heads" like what? And I'm like, but you guys didn't do that obviously, like wth? 
They gave me a free small frappe bc of this but this whole trip was probably like 35 minutes so fuck this place
categories: Restaurants, Sandwiches, Coffee & Tea, Fast Food, Burgers, Food
name: McDonald's

text: After travelling all day via airlines - we arrived home after midnight, the only thing we could find open was this McDonalds Drive Thru, NOW I remember why we don't eat McDonalds! We ordered 2 value means - one a "large" size and one regular.  Had at least 4-5 employees inside, we could see goofing off, dancing, etc. We were given our drinks - both a "regular" size, couldn't get their attention to exchange for the "large" size we'd paid for. After a long wait finally got someone's attention, they took the soda - then disappeared for a while.  Came back - handed us a large soda and our bag, then disappeared again.  We drove away, got home - the "large" fries was less than 1/3 full, but hot, the regular fries - appeared to be a small fries - was in the bag upside down and COLD!  The hamburger buns were hard (stale) and both burgers - were pretty bad.  We were the ONLY customers this establishment had at this hour and still got terrible food and service - just reminds us why we don't eat fast food - especially NOT McDonalds!

text: So not happy with this location. I go here quite a bit because it's in an area where I shop a lot. Almost every time the drive thru messes up my order. I know better than to pull out without checking my bag! Today, drive through parked me & told me they would bring my order out. Well they forgot to give me the drink with the happy meal!! The whole point of drive through for me today was so I didn't have to get my kid out of the car. Guess what, I had to get my kid out & go in to get my drink. I didn't check my bags, since they parked my car I figured I'm sure the order is right. Wrong!! I got home & the happy meal was messed up! How hard is it to get a happy meal order right??? And the wait time in the drive through was pretty long too! This McDonald's is ok I guess, but check all of your bags before you leave!

name: McDonald's

text: This is the fifth time that I have come here and ordered Mac - Jr's with extra cheese and extra pickles; all 5 times have resulted in a messed up order. First of all, they always charge me $0.40 for one slice of American cheese that probably cost them less than a penny - every time though, I received no extra cheese (so 2 sandwiches x 5 visits x $0.40 = $4.00 in Micky D's pocket). I guess it's weird that I complain that McDonald's charged me for something I didn't receive but come on, when you pay for something you should get it. I also NEVER ask for a sandwich to be remade because I've had a bad experience with that and will never inform that my order was messed up and I wish to have it remade - NEVER. The days of employees caring about attention to detail and taking care of customers with good work ethic are dead and gone. Somewhere as American as MicDonalds has went down the tubes and no longer is an excitable experience anymore. I'm more disappointed than anything because when the order is right, and I get what I asked for and paid for, it is quite pleasurable and wonderful. So sad...

name: Wendy's

text:
I come to this Wendy's more often recently because I'm in this area more now.  Evans and Kipling is pretty much a light industrial area and this Wendy's is a combo Wendy's and mini drive through Tim's much like the one on the Queensway not far really but the "Etobicoke" Wendy's on the Queensway is the "nice" Wendy's.

The most depressing Tim's/Wendy's is the one near Kipling station on Dundas, the one on the Queensway is the nicest most modern one and this Wendy's is something in between.  

This Wendy's feels more old school and the parking lot is shaped oddly.  When going to Kipling to exit it's awkward because you have to watch 2 drive in exits, the Tim's and the Wendy's not to mention cars coming in and when leaving cars are whizzing coming downhill from the overpass.

The inside of this Wendy's could use an overhaul but I wonder being in a blue collar area if they will fix this place up like the one on the Queensway which has the couches and fireplace not to mention the self serve Coke variety machines.  

At the end of the day this is still Wendy's food which is in my opinion one of the better fast food franchises out there now.  However just like the other nearby Wendy's and basically all McD's these days this place needs a much overdue face lift to brighten things up.

attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': True, 'dinner': False, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}

name: Wendy's

text:
This branch definitely needs a renovation. There are 2 types of Wendy's restaurants in the GTA. Some are new and some are just old. This definitely belongs to the latter. Don't get me wrong, the restaurant is not falling apart, but compared to other locations eating here feels odd. The lights are darker/dimmer. The tables although clean are definitely showing its age.

Food here is obviously the same as any other location of Wendy's. This is a busy location so food is always hot and fresh because of turnover.

Best thing about this location is the service. Every single employee is cheerful and happy.

Drive thru is quick although might get busy during lunch. In my experience, even in the peak of the busy time, I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes either in the drive thru or eat in.

Will definitely come back.

text:
I was hoping to get some nostalgia high from returning to wendy who I hadn't seen in over a year, you know like an old high school ex... she turned out to be an ex mother in law instead...

The fries were abundant and delicious, they beat the clowns fries any day.

But that burger, that I always remembered and thought was supposed to be so good... what a let down...

Parking decent,  restaurant and washrooms were clean... staff were quick... I wasn't full after my meal and gave it a 3(I was left hungry) but on second thought, pumped it to a 4.

text:
a huge fan of Wendy's, as it is one of the few "fast food" places with a decent tasting chicken sandwich, even better now that they have the jalapeno fresco sandwich, which is to DIE for, complimented with the jalapeno poutine makes for a lip burning good time. I was a skeptic at first, cause I didn't think it would be hot at all, but its so deliciously hot that its keeping me coming back, and making Wendy's my primary go to for a quick bite to eat. 
very VERY happy that this location is close to home. lots of parking, staff are friendly, location is very clean. 
it loses a point because there's been a couple of times where they haven't been open due to either a staff shortage or a power outage.

text:
The neighborhood Starbucks . Always great - open till late even on a Sunday with indoor and outdoor seating (2-3) tables ..not too crowded if you want to sit in , the drive through is always busy .
They have your regular Starbucks grub - they get the order right and in quick time too ! 
Everything to like about this Starbucks !
name: Starbucks

text:
It's a credit to Starbucks that when one walks into (or drives through) one of their stores they know exactly what they're getting.  It is a decidedly strong high-end coffee.  Whether one is in NYC, Texas, DC, or in suburban Pittsburgh, Starbucks is remarkably consistent.  

What puts the individual locations over the top is the people--and I've always found the baristas in the McMurray location to be both personable and professional.  The folks here have always been very pleasant w/ my children, which scores huge points with me.
name: Starbucks

text: i was in today on my lunch break and ordered a wrap.. the girl making my order(Adi) lacks customer service skills and appears to hate her job!! I Stated i would like wrap and instead of giving me a moment to decide she rambled off the diferent kinds of wraps in a rather rude tone as if she needed me to hurry up an make a selection.. her actions as she was preparing my wrap were unfriendly and uninviting ...sorry Adi if your having a bad day .. but you certainly need to check yourself before dealing with customers who come to eat and provide you a paycheck!! i will no longer come to this location because of this rude employee!!

text:
While not 24 hours or open late (past last call) the drive through here is open until 1am.  The Wendy's across the street closes at midnight.  

Honestly out of all the fast food burger chains I know BK is my least favorite but when it's after midnight and before 1am this place can perhaps be your best friend.  

When I went it was a short line (one car in front of me) and waiting for the food took less than 5 minutes.  When you need a double Whopper and poutine... ya sometimes you just do.  

BK is still not great but hey I needed them and they were there.

Other fast food options in the area include Burger's Priest, California Sandwiches, Wendy's, KFC/Taco Bell however none are open past midnight.

text:
The entire complex is getting a exterior facelift but Starbucks is still open for regular business. Harder to find if you're not familiar with the area. The staff seem great... And the owner...or perhaps she's a manager... Is always happy and seems to be a great person to work with. 

The atmosphere is nice and cozy... Drinks are excellent and fast. Lots of room to sit and have meetings... Or even do some work. The patio is gone while they do renovations but I'm sure it'll be back.

I would recommend this location because of its great staff and relaxing atmosphere.
name: Starbucks

They aren't terrible though.

text:
My boyfriend went out to wash our rental car and this location was the nearest one along his route back to our air bnb. He forgot our usual order so he ordered 3 big macs and fries. Came home and he noticed they forgot a sandwich. He was frustrated as he just wanted to eat after washing the car, so we gave them a call and they acknowledged their error.
 Apparently they forgot to put it in the bag before handing it to him. When he got there, they sold the sandwich to someone else and made a new one. Came home, had our dinner, and noticed they included a small batch of fries. He was irritated but the fact that this place at least acknowledged their error was impressive. Other locations would fight us about a missing item, so I appreciated they wanted to fix it.

text: Since management has changed this Starbucks has gone down hill. I use to love going here, quick and efficient. Now they're doing more paperwork than assisting customers in line. It takes forever to order and forever to receive our order.

text: First of all my disappointment in the time it took pales in comparison as to the anger I felt when a staff member accused me of stealing someone else's drink. So I was on my way to surprise my boyfriend at his placement and saw this on my way and decided last minute to drop in & if the lines short I'll pick up some drinks to surprise him with. The line had 3 people and no one on the sides waiting for pick up so I thought cool, 7-10 minutes tops. Well I could see that the person in front was kinda annoyed about the wait and I just assumed that the person ordering was probably just indecisive on what to get but over all took like a few minutes to order. At this point there was ONE barista in the back and ONE on cash the other worker was doing some cleaning ... slightly understaffed especially considering I was there at 4:45ish (almost rush hour time) When my order was taken they didn't ask for my name & I didn't realize so I went to wait & I knew what I ordered so it's fine when the drinks came after they took and extremely long time to be made (it was 5:05 and my boyfriend finished placement at 5 so surprise ruined) a girl behind me said she ordered that drink... like yeah you probably did but I ordered first so I proceed to get a trey and put straws in my drinks and then the guy working there called out to me and said miss you picked up someone else's drink and I said I ordered this and he tried saying so did she and the girl that took my order remained silent. I was ready to ask for a full refund at that moment but obviously my boyfriend has been waiting for a while now. In conclusion, I felt very disrespected. There are high schools around so I get that they think maybe I'm a kid trying to steal drinks but get your facts right before you call out to the entire store.
name: Starbucks

text: I used to live close by so I've been going to this Starbucks for years. Since change of management (God knows when that happened!), this place have been one of the worst I've ever been to. Very slow service. Unfriendly bunch. Unprofessional. And why put a new cashier on a very busy time of the day? So I get the wrong orders every time! I wouldn't bother telling them to change it cause I have to wait another 15 minutes. Waste of money.
name: Starbucks

They are not wearing name tags and they don't even write names on the cups. The store looks dirty and unorganized. And they used dairy pitchers when they're steaming almond milk. Thumbs down!

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'upscale': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'hipster': False, 'casual': True}

name: McDonald's

text:
I reeeally don't like this location but it's so close to me that I still come here.

Why don't I like it? No all-day breakfast. Self-order kiosks are positioned badly so you'll either be waiting a while during rush hours or pushed up against someone else using the one behind you. Store is laid out badly so you have no idea where the line to order starts and who's in line vs. who's just waiting to pick up an order. Hordes of old people come in, buy 4 drinks and 2 sandwiches between like 8 people, and take up multiple large tables for like half an hour. (Management does nothing, of course. I frequently see the manager cordially pat these people on the back and yak about their friend who just turned 90.)

Terrible at custom orders. Ask for a sauce on the side and there's a 50% chance they'll get it wrong. Not maintained well - trash is all over, kiosks are frequently out of paper, bins are overflowing, trays are piled high. Terrible at prioritizing orders - I've waited 10 minutes for 2 sandwiches and a coffee while other people who ordered after picked up massive to-go orders for their families.

Tables, especially tables that seat more than 2, are few and far between. Get rid of the stupid barstools that nobody likes and put in more tables! Wi-fi works so badly I've given up on it. I'd rather use my data and actually be able to access the Internet.

Pluses? It's 24 hours. They are competent at preparing simple orders. The location. Nothing else.

attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'upscale': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'hipster': False, 'casual': True}

name: McDonald's

text:
I came in here because I heard about the automated kiosk ordering system as it slowly takes over possibly all of the McDonald's in North America. There were 4 giant screens where you have to use your fingers to swipe through the various menus or go back and forth to switch between categories on what you want to order. Each machine also has a credit card reader, a scanner for coupon, and the screens are in a well lit area where the sunlight won't give it glare and make it hard to see. The only down side is that the screens are right at the front door and it's a bit cramp with people with backpacks on. Once you order, you will get your receipt with your number on it and the workers will have your food ready and call out your order.

One of the local gave me a coupon for a $1 McCafe and I used it on the machine and thinking they will need to take the coupon when I get my food but no, McDonald's worker did not care so the coupon could possibly be used and used again until the expiration date. It was quite interesting to see how the fast food industry will be slowly evolved to with these automated kiosks and still find it interesting that people are still going up to the cashier to order it the old fashion way. I don't feel by any means it made my food come out faster but it does cut out the interaction and one long queue line when you can just line up behind whichever kiosk you want to use next.

The food, I mean, it's McDonald's, at least they are strictly consist on the taste, the portion, and what makes a McDonald's burger taste like their burger with chopped onion, well done beef patty, s shot of the ketchup and mustard, and with the pickle to round it off. The McCafe is definitely you can skip upon and go to a Tim Hortons to get yourself a better coffee.

Otherwise, you're on your own; unless you have a bodyguard protecting you.

name: Subway

text:
There are not enough banana peppers to go around.  We live in a world where banana pepper supplies are threatening.  YOU cannot have any banana peppers.  That other subway? Oh yea they probably have them.  But not ours.  That is a luxury.  Why do you need them?  When I was growing up, I had to walk up hill both ways to get banana peppers.  One does just ask for banana peppers.  There is a process.  You have to put in an application for banana peppers then have it reviewed by the banana pepper supply manager then if there's a question is has to get kicked to the VP in charge of Banana Pepper Management.

FYI sometimes they don't have banana peppers.

There's 1 halfway functioning person working.
The credit card machine takes 5 minutes.

It's probably easier to call Subway, set up your own franchise location, and order a sub with banana peppers than it is to get one here.
name: Subway

text: Everyone who has made my sandwich was quite rude and obnoxious. I went on Friday night and had a nice young lady who made my sandwich and she told me she's only been their a month! Sad that the workers who have been there longer are so rude. Probably won't be back.

text: Not that McDonalds is ever a good place to eat, but this location is consistently terrible. It just so happens to be close to my home so if I'm on my way home and need something quick, I will stop at the drive through and every time, I wonder why I bothered. Slowest service ever, like even in the middle of the night it takes 20 min to get through. The teens taking your order are full of attitide, say "uh huh", "what else" and have no manners. When you get to the window there is typically one person actually working and 5 others goofing around and being loud and obnoxious. I mean. Not that I ever expect much from a fast food place, let alone a McDonalds, this place takes the cake for exceptionally poor service. Perhaps hire a manager who is out of highschool?

text:
Do you like decomposing lettuce? Me neither.

When it came time to put veggies on my sandwich I noticed that their lettuce was rotten. I asked if they had fresher lettuce (not that I should have to). The worker told me "no, this is it" and then proceeded to fluff the lettuce in the bin, apparently hoping there would be non-rotting lettuce at the bottom. There wasn't.

Rather than get mad, I took the ridicule route. After being told "no", I just stared at the rotten lettuce and laughed mockingly. The worker got ashamed or at least uncomfortable and went to the mini fridge. Lo and behold. A fresh bin of lettuce was in there.

So I got my normal, fresh lettuce, but those that came after me didn't. The worker kept the rotten bin out.

The whole time this worker made the sandwich, she was lamenting to her co-worker that the Walmart wouldn't hire her until after she worked at Subway for six months.

I wonder as I write this why I didn't just walk away. It's been several hours since I ate it and I haven't felt nauseated. So I guess overall it was a win. Won't be returning though.

text: Last time I ordered online from this store I ended up with another customer's pizza. One of my guests had already started eating it before we realized it so I didn't bother calling. Today I ordered a one pizza for the family that had mixed meat and veggie toppings, which was perfect. However, I also ordered a vegetarian style with mushrooms, peppers, and onions. I received a cheese pizza with two slices that had pepperoni and peppers on it. My order was correct on the box. It was correct on my email receipt. The employee that answered the phone, however told me I ordered a sausage pizza? Vegetarians don't order sausage. She was very adamant that is what the computer said. The manager took the phone and said the same thing about sausage. However, like I said, the order was correct on the box and correct on my email receipt. They sent out a replacement and it was badly burned. I will never order from this store again. Order at your own risk.

text:
4 Stars for Subway?

Oh hell yeah! With the foot long Meatball Marinara, Italian, or Black Forest Ham subs currently going for $4.99, I am a fan. This costs less money than buying frozen processed dinners from the supermarket.

While the $4.99 promotion is taking place, I have been frequently taking out the $4.99 Subway Black Forest Ham sub in lieu of buying frozen processed dinners from the supermarket. If it were not for the fact that most of the Subways near my work and home are in parking lots that are a nuisance to navigate, I have also bought the frozen processed supermarket food on the days that I normally do not eat out. What separates this Subway from most of the locations by my work and home is the simplicity of navigating the parking lot which is to the northeast of Interstate 215 and Valle Verde Drive. First off exiting the parking lot is a breeze. There are two sets of traffic signals off Valle Verde Drive by Subway that stop and slow down the cross traffic. This includes the set of traffic lights at Interstate 215 and the Kohl's Shopping Center attached to the Subway parking lot. This has eliminated the nuisance of existing. Second off, it is equally a breeze parking. It is in a pad with a only a few businesses that don't draw crowds at the same time it is close to Valle Verde Drive. This eliminates navigating through a shopping center. 

  The times  that I stopped by this Subway were when I was in the vicinity of Cornerstone Park or driving home from east Henderson or Boulder City. They were oftentimes on the days that I normally eat out but wanted to eat in my home. A nice thing about Subway is that I can pick up two days worth of Black Forest Ham subs and store them in the refrigerator to get me through the following evening. 

   Everytime that I stopped by this Subway the employees have been fast and professional. And the Black Forest Ham sub has been just the way I ordered: toasted multigrain bread, pepper jack cheese, every topping excluding pickles and banana peppers, topped off with oil, vinegar, mustard, light mayonnaise, and Black pepper.

  With the outstanding $4.99 deal, I am a fan of Subway. After the promotion ends and the Black Forest Ham goes back to $6 and change, I will continue to patronize the chain. Perhaps less frequently. Additionally with the ease of navigating the parking lot, I am also a fan of this location.

text:
Not really a big fan of subway in general but I love this location.... It's open late, I think it's 24hrs. It's a clean, small store but the staff is so extra courteous. They know all the ingredients that go with the sandwiches, I usually make up my own but the odd time a new sandwich comes out, like the delicious pulled pork sub so I want to try it as the company has it planned, then make tweaks if I need to. However most places the people know nothing.... The quickly run out of things like spinach and they do not restock all night to your out of luck if they run out. But at this location I've never had that issue.

I like the fact that the location is extremely clean, they seem to really keep up with it as well inside and out which is refreshing. They have signs posted asking you to rate the sandwich you get, they always ask if your satisfied so you really get what you pay for and more. 

I travel out of my way to this place because the quality and service, I don't plan on stopping anytime soon either lols!

text:
We all know and love Papa Johns slogan: "Better Pizza. Better Ingredients. PAPA JOHNS" :) I couldn't agree more so here is my review. 

I haven't physically being inside this location but I ordered delivery tonight through the Yelp App (which utilizes Eat24 to place the order).

On this cold and rainy night, I placed my order at 7:38pm and it was delivered at 8:18pm which is quick. The pizza arrived fresh and hot. Using the Yelp App to place my order was so smooth and efficient. I ordered a medium pepperoni pizza and it tasted delicious. It cost about $11 then add in the delivery fee and the total price came just under $15.  Don't forget your tip for the delivery driver. 

I have no complaints. I'll most likely be back here again.

YUMMY!!!

text:
I have been going to this location for about 7 Wednesday now around the same Time 0830-0900.   The people are very nice and friendly.  The drinks are hot.   Store looks amazing.  

From Scarbo to this location the wait time form or ding a drink or food is longer the. I'm use to.  I know they working on it cause of turn over.   The guy in the bow tie amazing make sure you say "hi" to him.   He on bar.  

Today I order the drink and wait time is bad (but they working on it). The drink was burned and I brought it back and they remade it from  another area and it was much better.   I even got my money back from the manger.   I was shocked..  . 

I say improvement take time and I would go back.   I just like the walk in so I can get to know the staff.    3 more Wednesday then no more class in Newmarket.    Keep up the good work Newmarket.
address: 17130 Leslie Street, Building A - Unit A
name: Starbucks

text: This Newmarket location is a busy one however great staff and service!!  Drive thru is friendly and efficient and don't be turned off by line of cars as they get through it quite quickly.  Although Starbucks is more expensive than traditional coffee shop, great tasting drinks.  My favourite - soy latte!
address: 17130 Leslie Street, Building A - Unit A
name: Starbucks

text: I visited this Starbucks on Sunday Jan 10, 2016 after a pretty rough weekend of being sick. The staff was friendly when I ordered my vanilla latte and brownie (warmed up). When I got my drink/treat, I took 4 steps, tripped over my own feet and my latte and brownie landed all over the floor. The baristas immediately ran to my rescue, told me not to worry about cleaning it up, made another drink for me on the fly as well as heated another brownie. They were friendly and could sense my complete embarrassment. A smile never left their face and they honestly made my day. To the young man with the longer hair who made my drink, the brown haired lady with the blue eyes and the girl in the beanie; thank you for everything!
address: 17130 Leslie Street, Building A - Unit A
name: Starbucks

text:
I would normally not review a chain as big as Starbucks unless I had an either really good or really bad experience. I've been to this location hundreds of times, and have never had an issue. The staff has always been very friendly, and do a great job at knowing their customers and giving up excellent recommendations. 

Today I decided to go through the drive-through to grab a Macchiato and the line was taking longer than normal. I wasn't in any hurry so I didn't mind waiting, but still with three cars in front of me, the wait was close to 10 minutes for me to get up to the window. When I pulled up, the barista apologized for the long wait, and actually gave me my drink for free, saying it was on them because everyone in front of me had large orders. You don't normally see this from large chains such as Starbucks, so I really appreciated the thought!
address: 17130 Leslie Street, Building A - Unit A
name: Starbucks

text:
like Starbucks. Actually I love Starbucks. And I love this location. It was renovated last year and looks great. There is a lot of seating, its lit nicely, its clean, and the folks that work here are super! Ask them anything about your drink or treat!

I know I know its pricy but I like what I get.

I usually get the chai latte. I get it lactose free. They have three options. One - lactose free milk, Two - soy (its nice try it), Three - with coconut milk (its new trying it right now, I like it, doesn't over power). The chai latte is spicy and creamy. Get it without water for a really strong spice kick, that's how I like it. My other go to drink is the cinnamon dulce latte, equally a delight.

Treats, I like the oat fudge bars,scones, and coojies. Chocolate goodness. Ask them to heat it up for you for an extra special treat!

Sandwiches, this is going to sound gross but its delicious. I love the Thai tuna wrap - heated up. They'll question if you really want to, but trust me you do! I am also completely obsessed with the the feta and spinach breakfast wrap. Yum!

So if you happen to find yourself at the corner of Gorham and Leslie in Newmarket, stop in, they have WiFi ( and it occasionally works!). Or better yet, they have one of the few drive thrus that I've seen
address: 17130 Leslie Street, Building A - Unit A

name: Wendy's

text:
This place is awful. It's my first time in a Wendy's on Canadian Soil. And first time in maybe 10 years. REGRETS! 

So I asked for the dessert section of the menu because I couldnt see it on the backboard behind the cashier. She (the cashier) looked at me, saying "just frosties" she then  placed the cup closer to her than me so I had to reach across. 

SHE IS NOW LITERALLY VACUMING AROUND ME. after making a horrible scraping sound as she dragged a vacuum along the tiles as opposed to sweeping. Eeeee eee Eeeee eee Eeeee!  Oh G-d. My ears. 

The frosty tastes fine. Like a thick milkshake.

text: I have been here half a dozen times and it is consistent and they try to move things along. It's pretty simple as it is Wendy's so you can eat healthy with a salad or go for  Baconator. What's not to like. Plus you have a view of the planes landing over your head at the airport.

text: Had breakfast and coffee in this Starbucks establishment. The bacon eggs were delicious and the blonde coffee roast is my new favorite.
name: Starbucks

text: Felt like a London Fog, and was told they ran out of Earl Grey tea.  It's like telling me they run out of coffee! Who does their inventory check!?! Never going back to this location - who knows what they might run out next time!?
name: Starbucks

text:
This newer location is much BETTER than the original location at the edge of Food Central, a.k.a. the food court.  First of all, it is enclosed, there is seating (availability questionable), line is shorter, and the baristas are friendlier.

I usually don't get the baked items, but this place actually makes them look good behind the glass showcase!

Yes, there is seating, but I honestly wouldn't feel comfortable doing work there, unless off-peak, as it's busy and kinda noisy.

Overall, it just seemed more efficient, nicer experience than standing in a long ass line waiting for a $5 drink.
name: Starbucks

text:
A nice small location with super friendly staff.  We ordered a couple cups of grande blonde roast and the egg bites and steak sandwich. The coffee station just had cream and milk and I didn't know what type of milk it was as it wasn't labeled. When asked, they gave me a pitcher of skim milk to use, like I wanted. 

The sandwiches were hot and we really liked the egg bites with low carbs. The steak breakfast wrap wasn't that tasty and a bit dry.

Not much seating but we managed to find a spot to sit down at a nice wooden table. The place wasn't that busy at 8:30am on a Thursday.
name: Starbucks

name: Starbucks

text: Can't come here anymore. Manager just makes me uncomfortable. Obsessed with cleaning but place still messy. They're always hiring and it's always different people so I'm guessing the manager is OCD about things or very strict. The veggie area is messy sometimes like random veggies in other veggies. It gets super warm sometimes inside I wouldn't know if the meat on top is still cold or room temp but still gross. Pretty sure my stomach has gotten sick like that after that day not that I remember. Kind of silly adding locks to bathroom doors that they have to open it for you to use the bathroom like who has time to wait for them to finish making a sandwich to let you use the restroom? They did that to a paying customer and the old guy almost had an accident waiting to use the restroom. I've lived on this side of town for years and came to this Subway for quite some time. It's changed. Not going back anymore.

text: The new steak & cheese wrap is amazing. I asked to lightly heat tortilla and the server was apprehensive until another customer said he just doesn't want to work did he heat it! The tomatoes were ends at the bottom of bin, therefore I asked for fresh ones and he brought a full fresh bin. Despite some draw backs...he finally made it the way I like and it was perfect!

name: Subway

text: Service is horrible. The staff almost seem pissed off about being there.  At no time did they greet any of the customers, nor did they even make eye contact. They answered questions with short 1-word answers. Their sandwich making was uneven (the lady in line before me ordered the exact same sandwich that I did and I noticed she got 7 slices of meat, while I only got 5). I do love eating at Subway but I certainly wont be coming back to this location!
name: Subway
